member.name: T:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer
member.summary:
The YAccelerometer class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce accelerometers.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the possibility to access x, y and z components of the acceleration vector separately.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAccelerometer.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.get_xValue
member.summary: Returns the X component of the acceleration, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the X component of the acceleration, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAccelerometer.XVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.get_yValue
member.summary: Returns the Y component of the acceleration, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the Y component of the acceleration, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAccelerometer.YVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.get_zValue
member.summary: Returns the Z component of the acceleration, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the Z component of the acceleration, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAccelerometer.ZVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.FindAccelerometer(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves an accelerometer for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the accelerometer is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YAccelerometer.isOnline() to test if the accelerometer is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an accelerometer by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the accelerometer, for instance Y3DMK002.accelerometer.
member.returns: a YAccelerometer object allowing you to drive the accelerometer.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.nextAccelerometer
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of accelerometers started using yFirstAccelerometer().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned accelerometers order. If you want to find a specific an accelerometer, use Accelerometer.findAccelerometer() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YAccelerometer object, corresponding to an accelerometer currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more accelerometers to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAccelerometer.FirstAccelerometer
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of accelerometers currently accessible.
Use the method YAccelerometer.nextAccelerometer() to iterate on next accelerometers.
member.returns: a pointer to a YAccelerometer object, corresponding to the first accelerometer currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YAltitude
member.summary:
The YAltitude class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce altimeters.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure the barometric pressure adjusted to sea level (QNH) for barometric sensors.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAltitude.set_currentValue(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the current estimated altitude.
This allows one to compensate for ambient pressure variations and to work in relative mode. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the current estimated altitude
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAltitude.set_qnh(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the barometric pressure adjusted to sea level used to compute the altitude (QNH).
This enables you to compensate for atmospheric pressure changes due to weather conditions. Applicable to barometric altimeters only. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the barometric pressure adjusted to sea level used to compute the altitude (QNH)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAltitude.get_qnh
member.summary:
Returns the barometric pressure adjusted to sea level used to compute the altitude (QNH).
Applicable to barometric altimeters only.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the barometric pressure adjusted to sea level used to compute the altitude (QNH)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAltitude.QNH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAltitude.get_technology
member.summary:
Returns the technology used by the sesnor to compute altitude.
Possibles values are "barometric" and "gps"
member.returns: a string corresponding to the technology used by the sesnor to compute altitude
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAltitude.TECHNOLOGY_INVALID.

- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier

In case of ambiguity when looking for an altimeter by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YAnButton
member.summary:
The YAnButton class provide access to basic resistive inputs.
Such inputs can be used to measure the state of a simple button as well as to read an analog potentiometer (variable resistance). This can be use for instance with a continuous rotating knob, a throttle grip or a joystick. The module is capable to calibrate itself on min and max values, in order to compute a calibrated value that varies proportionally with the potentiometer position, regardless of its total resistance.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_calibratedValue
member.summary: Returns the current calibrated input value (between 0 and 1000, included).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current calibrated input value (between 0 and 1000, included)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.CALIBRATEDVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_rawValue
member.summary: Returns the current measured input value as-is (between 0 and 4095, included).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current measured input value as-is (between 0 and 4095, included)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.RAWVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_analogCalibration
member.summary: Tells if a calibration process is currently ongoing.
member.returns: either YAnButton.ANALOGCALIBRATION_OFF or YAnButton.ANALOGCALIBRATION_ON
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.ANALOGCALIBRATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.set_analogCalibration(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts or stops the calibration process.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module at the end of the calibration if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YAnButton.ANALOGCALIBRATION_OFF or YAnButton.ANALOGCALIBRATION_ON
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_calibrationMax
member.summary: Returns the maximal value measured during the calibration (between 0 and 4095, included).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the maximal value measured during the calibration (between 0 and 4095, included)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.CALIBRATIONMAX_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.set_calibrationMax(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the maximal calibration value for the input (between 0 and 4095, included), without actually starting the automated calibration.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the maximal calibration value for the input (between 0 and 4095, included), without actually starting the automated calibration
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_calibrationMin
member.summary: Returns the minimal value measured during the calibration (between 0 and 4095, included).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the minimal value measured during the calibration (between 0 and 4095, included)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.CALIBRATIONMIN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.set_calibrationMin(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the minimal calibration value for the input (between 0 and 4095, included), without actually starting the automated calibration.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the minimal calibration value for the input (between 0 and 4095, included), without actually starting the automated calibration
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_sensitivity
member.summary: Returns the sensibility for the input (between 1 and 1000) for triggering user callbacks.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the sensibility for the input (between 1 and 1000) for triggering user callbacks
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.SENSITIVITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.set_sensitivity(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the sensibility for the input (between 1 and 1000) for triggering user callbacks.
The sensibility is used to filter variations around a fixed value, but does not preclude the transmission of events when the input value evolves constantly in the same direction. Special case: when the value 1000 is used, the callback will only be thrown when the logical state of the input switches from pressed to released and back. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the sensibility for the input (between 1 and 1000) for triggering user callbacks
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_isPressed
member.summary: Returns true if the input (considered as binary) is active (closed contact), and false otherwise.
member.returns: either YAnButton.ISPRESSED_FALSE or YAnButton.ISPRESSED_TRUE, according to true if the input (considered as binary) is active (closed contact), and false otherwise
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.ISPRESSED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_lastTimePressed
member.summary: Returns the number of elapsed milliseconds between the module power on and the last time the input button was pressed (the input contact transitioned from open to closed).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of elapsed milliseconds between the module power on and the last time the input button was pressed (the input contact transitioned from open to closed)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.LASTTIMEPRESSED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_lastTimeReleased
member.summary: Returns the number of elapsed milliseconds between the module power on and the last time the input button was released (the input contact transitioned from closed to open).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of elapsed milliseconds between the module power on and the last time the input button was released (the input contact transitioned from closed to open)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.LASTTIMERELEASED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_pulseCounter
member.summary:
Returns the pulse counter value.
The value is a 32 bit integer. In case of overflow (>=2^32), the counter will wrap. To reset the counter, just call the resetCounter() method.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the pulse counter value
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.PULSECOUNTER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAnButton.get_pulseTimer
member.summary: Returns the timer of the pulses counter (ms).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the timer of the pulses counter (ms)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.PULSETIMER_INVALID.

member.summary: Returns the decoding method applied to the input (analog or multiplexed binary switches).
member.returns: a value among YAnButton.INPUTTYPE_ANALOG_FAST, YAnButton.INPUTTYPE_DIGITAL4 and YAnButton.INPUTTYPE_ANALOG_SMOOTH corresponding to the decoding method applied to the input (analog or multiplexed binary switches)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAnButton.INPUTTYPE_INVALID.

member.summary:

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor
member.summary:
The YArithmeticSensor class allows some Yoctopuce devices to compute in real-time values based on an arithmetic formula involving one or more measured signals as well as the temperature.
As for any physical sensor, the computed values can be read by callback and stored in the built-in datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the arithmetic sensor.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the arithmetic sensor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.get_description
member.summary: Returns a short informative description of the formula.
member.returns: a string corresponding to a short informative description of the formula
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YArithmeticSensor.DESCRIPTION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.FindArithmeticSensor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves an arithmetic sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the arithmetic sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YArithmeticSensor.isOnline() to test if the arithmetic sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an arithmetic sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the arithmetic sensor, for instance RXUVOLT1.arithmeticSensor1.
member.returns: a YArithmeticSensor object allowing you to drive the arithmetic sensor.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.defineExpression(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Defines the arithmetic function by means of an algebraic expression.
The expression may include references to device sensors, by their physical or logical name, to usual math functions and to auxiliary functions defined separately.
member.param: the algebraic expression defining the function.
short informative description of the expression.
member.returns: the current expression value if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YAPI.INVALID_DOUBLE.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.loadExpression
member.summary: Retrieves the algebraic expression defining the arithmetic function, as previously configured using the defineExpression function.
member.returns: a string containing the mathematical expression.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.defineAuxiliaryFunction(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double})
member.summary:
Defines a auxiliary function by means of a table of reference points.
Intermediate values will be interpolated between specified reference points. The reference points are given as pairs of floating point numbers. The auxiliary function will be available for use by all ArithmeticSensor objects of the device. Up to nine auxiliary function can be defined in a device, each containing up to 96 reference points.
member.param: auxiliary function name, up to 16 characters.
array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the function input value.
array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the output value desired for each of the input value, index by index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YArithmeticSensor.loadAuxiliaryFunction(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double})
member.summary: Retrieves the reference points table defining an auxiliary function previously configured using the defineAuxiliaryFunction function.
member.param: auxiliary function name, up to 16 characters.
array of floating point numbers, that is filled by the function with all the function reference input value.
array of floating point numbers, that is filled by the function output value for each of the input value, index by index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of arithmetic sensors started using yFirstArithmeticSensor().

Starts the enumeration of arithmetic sensors currently accessible.

- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the audio input is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YAudioIn.isOnline() to test if the audio input is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an audio input by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the audio input, for instance MyDevice.audioIn1.
member.returns: a YAudioIn object allowing you to drive the audio input.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAudioIn.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YAudioIn.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAudioIn.nextAudioIn
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of audio inputs started using yFirstAudioIn().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned audio inputs order. If you want to find a specific an audio input, use AudioIn.findAudioIn() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YAudioIn object, corresponding to an audio input currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more audio inputs to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YAudioIn.FirstAudioIn
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of audio inputs currently accessible.
Use the method YAudioIn.nextAudioIn() to iterate on next audio inputs.
member.returns: a pointer to a YAudioIn object, corresponding to the first audio input currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YBuzzer
member.summary:
The YBuzzer class allows you to drive a buzzer.
You can choose the frequency and the volume at which the buzzer must sound. You can also pre-program a play sequence.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.set_frequency(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the frequency of the signal sent to the buzzer.
A zero value stops the buzzer.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the frequency of the signal sent to the buzzer
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.get_frequency
member.summary: Returns the frequency of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the frequency of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YBuzzer.FREQUENCY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.get_volume
member.summary: Returns the volume of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the volume of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YBuzzer.VOLUME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.set_volume(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the volume of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the volume of the signal sent to the buzzer/speaker
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the current length of the playing sequence.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current length of the playing sequence
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YBuzzer.PLAYSEQSIZE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.get_playSeqMaxSize
member.summary: Returns the maximum length of the playing sequence.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the maximum length of the playing sequence
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YBuzzer.PLAYSEQMAXSIZE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.get_playSeqSignature
member.summary:
Returns the playing sequence signature.
As playing sequences cannot be read from the device, this can be used to detect if a specific playing sequence is already programmed.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the playing sequence signature
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YBuzzer.PLAYSEQSIGNATURE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.FindBuzzer(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a buzzer for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the buzzer is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YBuzzer.isOnline() to test if the buzzer is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a buzzer by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the buzzer, for instance YBUZZER2.buzzer.
member.returns: a YBuzzer object allowing you to drive the buzzer.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YBuzzer.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.addFreqMoveToPlaySeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new frequency transition to the playing sequence.
member.param: desired frequency when the transition is completed, in Hz
duration of the frequency transition, in milliseconds.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.addPulseToPlaySeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a pulse to the playing sequence.
member.param: pulse frequency, in Hz
pulse duration, in milliseconds.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.addVolMoveToPlaySeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a new volume transition to the playing sequence.
Frequency stays untouched: if frequency is at zero, the transition has no effect.
member.param: desired volume when the transition is completed, as a percentage.
duration of the volume transition, in milliseconds.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.addNotesToPlaySeq(System.String)
member.summary:
Adds notes to the playing sequence.
Notes are provided as text words, separated by spaces. The pitch is specified using the usual letter from A to G. The duration is specified as the divisor of a whole note: 4 for a fourth, 8 for an eight note, etc. Some modifiers are supported: # and b to alter a note pitch, ' and , to move to the upper/lower octave, . to enlarge the note duration.
member.param: notes to be played, as a text string.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.startPlaySeq
member.summary:
Starts the preprogrammed playing sequence.
The sequence runs in loop until it is stopped by stopPlaySeq or an explicit change. To play the sequence only once, use oncePlaySeq().
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.stopPlaySeq
member.summary: Stops the preprogrammed playing sequence and sets the frequency to zero.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.resetPlaySeq
member.summary: Resets the preprogrammed playing sequence and sets the frequency to zero.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.oncePlaySeq
member.summary: Starts the preprogrammed playing sequence and run it once only.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.savePlaySeq
member.summary: Saves the preprogrammed playing sequence to flash memory.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.reloadPlaySeq
member.summary: Reloads the preprogrammed playing sequence from the flash memory.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.pulse(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Activates the buzzer for a short duration.
member.param: pulse frequency, in hertz
pulse duration in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.freqMove(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes the buzzer frequency change over a period of time.
member.param: frequency to reach, in hertz. A frequency under 25Hz stops the buzzer.
pulse duration in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.volumeMove(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes the buzzer volume change over a period of time, frequency stays untouched.
member.param: volume to reach in %
change duration in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.playNotes(System.String)
member.summary:
Immediately play a note sequence.
Notes are provided as text words, separated by spaces. The pitch is specified using the usual letter from A to G. The duration is specified as the divisor of a whole note: 4 for a fourth, 8 for an eight note, etc. Some modifiers are supported: # and b to alter a note pitch, ' and , to move to the upper/lower octave, . to enlarge the note duration.
member.param: notes to be played, as a text string.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.nextBuzzer
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of buzzers started using yFirstBuzzer().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned buzzers order. If you want to find a specific a buzzer, use Buzzer.findBuzzer() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YBuzzer object, corresponding to a buzzer currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more buzzers to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YBuzzer.FirstBuzzer
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of buzzers currently accessible.
Use the method YBuzzer.nextBuzzer() to iterate on next buzzers.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide
member.summary:
The YCarbonDioxide class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce CO2 sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to perform manual calibration if required.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.get_abcPeriod
member.summary:
Returns the Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours.
A negative value means that automatic baseline calibration is disabled.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCarbonDioxide.ABCPERIOD_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.set_abcPeriod(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours.
If you need to disable automatic baseline calibration (for instance when using the sensor in an environment that is constantly above 400 ppm CO2), set the period to -1. For the Yocto-CO2-V2, the only possible values are 24 and -1. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.FindCarbonDioxide(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a CO2 sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the CO2 sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCarbonDioxide.isOnline() to test if the CO2 sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a CO2 sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the CO2 sensor, for instance YCO2MK02.carbonDioxide.
member.returns: a YCarbonDioxide object allowing you to drive the CO2 sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.triggerForcedCalibration(System.Double)
member.summary:
Triggers a forced calibration of the sensor at a given CO2 level, specified between 400ppm and 2000ppm.
Before invoking this command, the sensor must have been maintained within the specified CO2 density during at least two minutes.
member.param: reference CO2 density for the calibration
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.triggerBaselineCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers a baseline calibration at standard CO2 ambiant level (400ppm).
It is normally not necessary to manually calibrate the sensor, because the built-in automatic baseline calibration procedure will automatically fix any long-term drift based on the lowest level of CO2 observed over the automatic calibration period. However, if automatic baseline calibration is disabled, you may want to manually trigger a calibration from time to time. Before starting a baseline calibration, make sure to put the sensor in a standard environment (e.g. outside in fresh air) at around 400 ppm for at least two minutes.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.triggerZeroCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers a zero calibration of the sensor on carbon dioxide-free air - for use with first generation Yocto-CO2 only.
It is normally not necessary to manually calibrate the sensor, because the built-in automatic baseline calibration procedure will automatically fix any long-term drift based on the lowest level of CO2 observed over the automatic calibration period. However, if you disable automatic baseline calibration, you may want to manually trigger a calibration from time to time. Before starting a zero calibration, you should circulate carbon dioxide-free air within the sensor for a minute or two, using a small pipe connected to the sensor. Please contact support@yoctopuce.com for more details on the zero calibration procedure.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.nextCarbonDioxide
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of CO2 sensors started using yFirstCarbonDioxide().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned CO2 sensors order. If you want to find a specific a CO2 sensor, use CarbonDioxide.findCarbonDioxide() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCarbonDioxide object, corresponding to a CO2 sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more CO2 sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCarbonDioxide.FirstCarbonDioxide
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of CO2 sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YCarbonDioxide.nextCarbonDioxide() to iterate on next CO2 sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCarbonDioxide object, corresponding to the first CO2 sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

members.member: YCellRecord objects are used to describe a wireless network. These objects are used in particular in conjunction with the YCellular class.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_cellOperator
member.summary: Returns the name of the the cell operator, as received from the network.
member.returns: a string with the name of the the cell operator.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_mobileCountryCode
member.summary:
Returns the Mobile Country Code (MCC).
The MCC is a unique identifier for each country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Mobile Country Code (MCC).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_mobileNetworkCode
member.summary:
Returns the Mobile Network Code (MNC).
The MNC is a unique identifier for each phone operator within a country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Mobile Network Code (MNC).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_locationAreaCode
member.summary:
Returns the Location Area Code (LAC).
The LAC is a unique identifier for each place within a country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Location Area Code (LAC).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_cellId
member.summary:
Returns the Cell ID.
The Cell ID is a unique identifier for each base transmission station within a LAC.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Cell Id.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_signalStrength
member.summary: Returns the signal strength, measured in dBm.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the signal strength.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellRecord.get_timingAdvance
member.summary:
Returns the Timing Advance (TA).
The TA corresponds to the time necessary for the signal to reach the base station from the device. Each increment corresponds about to 550m of distance.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Timing Advance (TA).

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YCellular
member.summary:
The YCellular class provides control over cellular network parameters and status for devices that are GSM-enabled.
Note that TCP/IP parameters are configured separately, using class YNetwork.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_linkQuality
member.summary: Returns the link quality, expressed in percent.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the link quality, expressed in percent
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.LINKQUALITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_cellOperator
member.summary: Returns the name of the cell operator currently in use.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the name of the cell operator currently in use

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_cellIdentifier

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.CELLIDENTIFIER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_cellType
member.summary: Active cellular connection type.
member.returns: a value among YCellular.CELLTYPE_GPRS, YCellular.CELLTYPE_EGPRS, YCellular.CELLTYPE_WCDMA, YCellular.CELLTYPE_HSDPA, YCellular.CELLTYPE_NONE, YCellular.CELLTYPE_CDMA, YCellular.CELLTYPE_LTE_M, YCellular.CELLTYPE_NB_IOT and YCellular.CELLTYPE_EC_GSM_IOT
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.CELLTYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_imsi
member.summary:
Returns the International Mobile Subscriber Identity (MSI) that uniquely identifies the SIM card.
The first 3 digits represent the mobile country code (MCC), which is followed by the mobile network code (MNC), either 2-digit (European standard) or 3-digit (North American standard)
member.returns: a string corresponding to the International Mobile Subscriber Identity (MSI) that uniquely identifies the SIM card
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.IMSI_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_message
member.summary: Returns the latest status message from the wireless interface.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the latest status message from the wireless interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.MESSAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_pin
member.summary: Returns an opaque string if a PIN code has been configured in the device to access the SIM card, or an empty string if none has been configured or if the code provided was rejected by the SIM card.
member.returns: a string corresponding to an opaque string if a PIN code has been configured in the device to access the SIM card, or an empty string if none has been configured or if the code provided was rejected by the SIM card
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.PIN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_pin(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the PIN code used by the module to access the SIM card.
This function does not change the code on the SIM card itself, but only changes the parameter used by the device to try to get access to it. If the SIM code does not work immediately on first try, it will be automatically forgotten and the message will be set to "Enter SIM PIN". The method should then be invoked again with right correct PIN code. After three failed attempts in a row, the message is changed to "Enter SIM PUK" and the SIM card PUK code must be provided using method sendPUK.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module to save the new value in the device flash.
member.param: a string corresponding to the PIN code used by the module to access the SIM card
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_radioConfig
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.RADIOCONFIG_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_radioConfig(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_lockedOperator
member.summary: Returns the name of the only cell operator to use if automatic choice is disabled, or an empty string if the SIM card will automatically choose among available cell operators.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the name of the only cell operator to use if automatic choice is disabled, or an empty string if the SIM card will automatically choose among available cell operators
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.LOCKEDOPERATOR_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_lockedOperator(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the name of the cell operator to be used.
If the name is an empty string, the choice will be made automatically based on the SIM card. Otherwise, the selected operator is the only one that will be used. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the name of the cell operator to be used
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns true if the airplane mode is active (radio turned off).
member.returns: either YCellular.AIRPLANEMODE_OFF or YCellular.AIRPLANEMODE_ON, according to true if the airplane mode is active (radio turned off)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.AIRPLANEMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_airplaneMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the activation state of airplane mode (radio turned off).
member.param: either YCellular.AIRPLANEMODE_OFF or YCellular.AIRPLANEMODE_ON, according to the activation state of airplane mode (radio turned off)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_enableData
member.summary:
Returns the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS).
When data services are disabled, SMS are the only mean of communication.
member.returns: a value among YCellular.ENABLEDATA_HOMENETWORK, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_ROAMING, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEVER and YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEUTRALITY corresponding to the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.ENABLEDATA_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_enableData(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS).
The service can be either fully deactivated, or limited to the SIM home network, or enabled for all partner networks (roaming). Caution: enabling data services on roaming networks may cause prohibitive communication costs !
When data services are disabled, SMS are the only mean of communication. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YCellular.ENABLEDATA_HOMENETWORK, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_ROAMING, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEVER and YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEUTRALITY corresponding to the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.APN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_apn(System.String)

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.FindCellular(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a cellular interface for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the cellular interface is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCellular.isOnline() to test if the cellular interface is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a cellular interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the cellular interface, for instance YHUBGSM1.cellular.
member.returns: a YCellular object allowing you to drive the cellular interface.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YCellular.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.sendPUK(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a PUK code to unlock the SIM card after three failed PIN code attempts, and setup a new PIN into the SIM card.
Only ten consecutive tentatives are permitted: after that, the SIM card will be blocked permanently without any mean of recovery to use it again. Note that after calling this method, you have usually to invoke method set_pin() to tell the YoctoHub which PIN to use in the future.
member.param: the SIM PUK code
new PIN code to configure into the SIM card
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.set_apnAuth(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Configure authentication parameters to connect to the APN.
Both PAP and CHAP authentication are supported.
member.param: APN username
APN password
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.clearDataCounters
member.summary: Clear the transmitted data counters.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular._AT(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends an AT command to the GSM module and returns the command output.
The command will only execute when the GSM module is in standard command state, and should leave it in the exact same state. Use this function with great care !
member.param: the AT command to execute, like for instance: "+CCLK?".
member.returns: a string with the result of the commands. Empty lines are automatically removed from the output.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.get_availableOperators
member.summary:
Returns the list detected cell operators in the neighborhood.
This function will typically take between 30 seconds to 1 minute to return. Note that any SIM card can usually only connect to specific operators. All networks returned by this function might therefore not be available for connection.
member.returns: a list of string (cell operator names).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.quickCellSurvey
member.summary:
Returns a list of nearby cellular antennas, as required for quick geolocation of the device.
The first cell listed is the serving cell, and the next ones are the neighbor cells reported by the serving cell.
member.returns: a list of YCellRecords.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.decodePLMN(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cell operator brand for a given MCC/MNC pair.
member.param: a string starting with a MCC code followed by a MNC code,
member.returns: a string containing the corresponding cell operator brand name.

member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of cellular interfaces started using yFirstCellular().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned cellular interfaces order. If you want to find a specific a cellular interface, use Cellular.findCellular() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCellular object, corresponding to a cellular interface currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more cellular interfaces to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCellular.FirstCellular
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of cellular interfaces currently accessible.
Use the method YCellular.nextCellular() to iterate on next cellular interfaces.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCellular object, corresponding to the first cellular interface currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YColorLed
member.summary:
The ColorLed class allows you to drive a color LED.
The color can be specified using RGB coordinates as well as HSL coordinates. The module performs all conversions form RGB to HSL automatically. It is then self-evident to turn on a LED with a given hue and to progressively vary its saturation or lightness. If needed, you can find more information on the difference between RGB and HSL in the section following this one.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.get_rgbColor
member.summary: Returns the current RGB color of the LED.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current RGB color of the LED
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YColorLed.RGBCOLOR_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.set_rgbColor(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current color of the LED, using an RGB color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xRRGGBB.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the current color of the LED, using an RGB color
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.

member.summary:
Retrieves an RGB LED for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier

This function does not require that the RGB LED is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. In case of ambiguity when looking for an RGB LED by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RGB LED, for instance YRGBLED2.colorLed1.
member.returns: a YColorLed object allowing you to drive the RGB LED.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.

member.summary:
Starts the preprogrammed blinking sequence.
The sequence is run in a loop until it is stopped by stopBlinkSeq or an explicit change.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.stopBlinkSeq
member.summary: Stops the preprogrammed blinking sequence.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.resetBlinkSeq
member.summary: Resets the preprogrammed blinking sequence.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.nextColorLed
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of RGB LEDs started using yFirstColorLed().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned RGB LEDs order. If you want to find a specific an RGB LED, use ColorLed.findColorLed() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YColorLed object, corresponding to an RGB LED currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more RGB LEDs to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLed.FirstColorLed
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of RGB LEDs currently accessible.
Use the method YColorLed.nextColorLed() to iterate on next RGB LEDs.
member.returns: a pointer to a YColorLed object, corresponding to the first RGB LED currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster
member.summary:
The YColorLedCluster class allows you to drive a color LED cluster.
Unlike the ColorLed class, the YColorLedCluster class allows to handle several LEDs at once. Color changes can be done using RGB coordinates as well as HSL coordinates. The module performs all conversions form RGB to HSL automatically. It is then self-evident to turn on a LED with a given hue and to progressively vary its saturation or lightness. If needed, you can find more information on the difference between RGB and HSL in the section following this one.

member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of LEDs currently handled by the device

member.param: an integer corresponding to the number of LEDs currently handled by the device
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.FindColorLedCluster(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a RGB LED cluster for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the RGB LED cluster is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YColorLedCluster.isOnline() to test if the RGB LED cluster is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a RGB LED cluster by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RGB LED cluster, for instance YRGBLED2.colorLedCluster.
member.returns: a YColorLedCluster object allowing you to drive the RGB LED cluster.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

Changes the current color of consecutive LEDs in the cluster, using a RGB color.

affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

affected LED count.
new color.

affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

affected LED count.
new color.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.rgb_move(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the current color of a group of adjacent LEDs to another color, in a seamless and autonomous manner.
The transition is performed in the RGB space.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color (0xRRGGBB).
transition duration in ms
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.hsl_move(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the current color of a group of adjacent LEDs to another color, in a seamless and autonomous manner.
The transition is performed in the HSL space. In HSL, hue is a circular value (0..360). There are always two paths to perform the transition: by increasing or by decreasing the hue. The module selects the shortest transition. If the difference is exactly 180, the module selects the transition which increases the hue.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color (0xHHSSLL).
transition duration in ms
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.addRgbMoveToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds an RGB transition to a sequence.
A sequence is a transition list, which can be executed in loop by a group of LEDs. Sequences are persistent and are saved in the device flash memory as soon as the saveBlinkSeq() method is called.
member.param: sequence index.
target color (0xRRGGBB)
transition duration in ms
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.addHslMoveToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds an HSL transition to a sequence.
A sequence is a transition list, which can be executed in loop by an group of LEDs. Sequences are persistent and are saved in the device flash memory as soon as the saveBlinkSeq() method is called.
member.param: sequence index.
target color (0xHHSSLL)
transition duration in ms
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.addMirrorToBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a mirror ending to a sequence.
When the sequence will reach the end of the last transition, its running speed will automatically be reversed so that the sequence plays in the reverse direction, like in a mirror. After the first transition of the sequence is played at the end of the reverse execution, the sequence starts again in the initial direction.
member.param: sequence index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.addJumpToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds to a sequence a jump to another sequence.
When a pixel will reach this jump, it will be automatically relinked to the new sequence, and will run it starting from the beginning.
member.param: sequence index.
index of the sequence to chain.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.addUnlinkToBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a to a sequence a hard stop code.
When a pixel will reach this stop code, instead of restarting the sequence in a loop it will automatically be unlinked from the sequence.
member.param: sequence index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.linkLedToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence.
These LEDs start to execute the sequence as soon as startBlinkSeq is called. It is possible to add an offset in the execution: that way we can have several groups of LED executing the same sequence, with a temporal offset. A LED cannot be linked to more than one sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
execution offset in ms.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.linkLedToBlinkSeqAtPowerOn(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence at device power-on.
Don't forget to configure the sequence auto start flag as well and call saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn(). It is possible to add an offset in the execution: that way we can have several groups of LEDs executing the same sequence, with a temporal offset. A LED cannot be linked to more than one sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
execution offset in ms.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.linkLedToPeriodicBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence.
These LED start to execute the sequence as soon as startBlinkSeq is called. This function automatically introduces a shift between LEDs so that the specified number of sequence periods appears on the group of LEDs (wave effect).
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
number of periods to show on LEDs.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.unlinkLedFromBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unlinks adjacent LEDs from a sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.startBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts a sequence execution: every LED linked to that sequence starts to run it in a loop.
Note that a sequence with a zero duration can't be started.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

Stops a sequence execution.
If started again, the execution restarts from the beginning.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.resetBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stops a sequence execution and resets its contents.
LEDs linked to this sequence are not automatically updated anymore.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.set_blinkSeqStateAtPowerOn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures a sequence to make it start automatically at device startup.
Note that a sequence with a zero duration can't be started. Don't forget to call saveBlinkSeq() to make sure the modification is saved in the device flash memory.
member.param: index of the sequence to reset.
0 to keep the sequence turned off and 1 to start it automatically.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YColorLedCluster.set_blinkSeqSpeed(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the execution speed of a sequence.
The natural execution speed is 1000 per thousand. If you configure a slower speed, you can play the sequence in slow-motion. If you set a negative speed, you can play the sequence in reverse direction.
member.param: index of the sequence to start.
sequence running speed (-1000...1000).
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Saves the LEDs power-on configuration.

The YCompass class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce compass functions.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.
