- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the compass function is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCompass.isOnline() to test if the compass function is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a compass function by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the compass function, for instance Y3DMK002.compass.
member.returns: a YCompass object allowing you to drive the compass function.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCompass.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YCompass.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCompass.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YCompass.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCompass.nextCompass
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of compass functions started using yFirstCompass().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned compass functions order. If you want to find a specific a compass function, use Compass.findCompass() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCompass object, corresponding to a compass function currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more compass functions to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCompass.FirstCompass
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of compass functions currently accessible.
Use the method YCompass.nextCompass() to iterate on next compass functions.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCompass object, corresponding to the first compass function currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YCurrent
member.summary:
The YCurrent class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce current sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YCurrent.ENABLED_FALSE or YCurrent.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrent.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this voltage input.
When AC measurements are disabled, the device will always assume a DC signal, and vice-versa. When both AC and DC measurements are active, the device switches between AC and DC mode based on the relative amplitude of variations compared to the average value. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YCurrent.ENABLED_FALSE or YCurrent.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this voltage input
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.FindCurrent(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a current sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the current sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCurrent.isOnline() to test if the current sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a current sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the current sensor, for instance YAMPMK01.current1.
member.returns: a YCurrent object allowing you to drive the current sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YCurrent.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YCurrent.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.nextCurrent
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of current sensors started using yFirstCurrent().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned current sensors order. If you want to find a specific a current sensor, use Current.findCurrent() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCurrent object, corresponding to a current sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more current sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrent.FirstCurrent
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of current sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YCurrent.nextCurrent() to iterate on next current sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCurrent object, corresponding to the first current sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput
member.summary:
The YCurrentLoopOutput class allows you to drive a 4-20mA output by regulating the current flowing through the current loop.
It can also provide information about the power state of the current loop.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.set_current(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the current loop, the valid range is from 3 to 21mA.
If the loop is not properly powered, the target current is not reached and loopPower is set to LOWPWR.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the current loop, the valid range is from 3 to 21mA
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.get_current
member.summary: Returns the loop current set point in mA.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the loop current set point in mA
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.CURRENT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.set_currentAtStartUp(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the loop current at device start up.
Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call has no effect.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the loop current at device start up
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.get_currentAtStartUp
member.summary: Returns the current in the loop at device startup, in mA.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current in the loop at device startup, in mA
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.CURRENTATSTARTUP_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.get_loopPower
member.summary:
Returns the loop powerstate.
POWEROK: the loop is powered. NOPWR: the loop in not powered. LOWPWR: the loop is not powered enough to maintain the current required (insufficient voltage).
member.returns: a value among YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_NOPWR, YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_LOWPWR and YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_POWEROK corresponding to the loop powerstate
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.FindCurrentLoopOutput(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a 4-20mA output for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the 4-20mA output is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCurrentLoopOutput.isOnline() to test if the 4-20mA output is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a 4-20mA output by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the 4-20mA output, for instance TX420MA1.currentLoopOutput.
member.returns: a YCurrentLoopOutput object allowing you to drive the 4-20mA output.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.currentMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth transition of current flowing in the loop.
Any current explicit change cancels any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new current value at the end of the transition (floating-point number, representing the end current in mA)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.nextCurrentLoopOutput
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of 4-20mA outputs started using yFirstCurrentLoopOutput().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned 4-20mA outputs order. If you want to find a specific a 4-20mA output, use CurrentLoopOutput.findCurrentLoopOutput() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCurrentLoopOutput object, corresponding to a 4-20mA output currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more 4-20mA outputs to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YCurrentLoopOutput.FirstCurrentLoopOutput
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of 4-20mA outputs currently accessible.
Use the method YCurrentLoopOutput.nextCurrentLoopOutput() to iterate on next 4-20mA outputs.
member.returns: a pointer to a YCurrentLoopOutput object, corresponding to the first 4-20mA output currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain
member.summary: The YDaisyChain class can be used to verify that devices that are daisy-chained directly from device to device, without a hub, are detected properly.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain.get_daisyState
member.summary: Returns the state of the daisy-link between modules.
member.returns: a value among YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_READY, YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_IS_CHILD, YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_FIRMWARE_MISMATCH, YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_CHILD_MISSING and YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_CHILD_LOST corresponding to the state of the daisy-link between modules
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDaisyChain.DAISYSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain.get_childCount
member.summary: Returns the number of child nodes currently detected.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of child nodes currently detected
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDaisyChain.CHILDCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain.get_requiredChildCount
member.summary: Returns the number of child nodes expected in normal conditions.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of child nodes expected in normal conditions
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDaisyChain.REQUIREDCHILDCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain.set_requiredChildCount(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the number of child nodes expected in normal conditions.
If the value is zero, no check is performed. If it is non-zero, the number child nodes is checked on startup and the status will change to error if the count does not match. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the number of child nodes expected in normal conditions
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

In case of ambiguity when looking for a module chain by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDaisyChain.nextDaisyChain
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of module chains started using yFirstDaisyChain().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned module chains order. If you want to find a specific a module chain, use DaisyChain.findDaisyChain() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDaisyChain object, corresponding to a module chain currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more module chains to enumerate.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO
member.summary:
The YDigitalIO class allows you drive a Yoctopuce digital input/output port.
It can be used to setup the direction of each channel, to read the state of each channel and to switch the state of each channel configures as an output. You can work on all channels at once, or one by one. Most functions use a binary representation for channels where bit 0 matches channel #0 , bit 1 matches channel #1 and so on. If you are not familiar with numbers binary representation, you will find more information here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_number#Representation. It is also possible to automatically generate short pulses of a determined duration. Electrical behavior of each I/O can be modified (open drain and reverse polarity).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portState
member.summary:
Returns the digital IO port state as an integer with each bit representing a channel.
value 0 = 0b00000000 -> all channels are OFF value 1 = 0b00000001 -> channel #0 is ON value 2 = 0b00000010 -> channel #1 is ON value 3 = 0b00000011 -> channels #0 and #1 are ON value 4 = 0b00000100 -> channel #2 is ON and so on...
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the digital IO port state as an integer with each bit representing a channel
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_portState(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the state of all digital IO port's channels at once: the parameter is an integer where each bit represents a channel, with bit 0 matching channel #0.
To set all channels to 0 -> 0b00000000 -> parameter = 0 To set channel #0 to 1 -> 0b00000001 -> parameter = 1 To set channel #1 to 1 -> 0b00000010 -> parameter = 2 To set channel #0 and #1 -> 0b00000011 -> parameter = 3 To set channel #2 to 1 -> 0b00000100 -> parameter = 4 an so on.... Only channels configured as outputs will be affecter, according to the value configured using set_portDirection.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the state of all digital IO port's channels at once: the parameter is an integer where each bit represents a channel, with bit 0 matching channel #0
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portDirection
member.summary: Returns the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTDIRECTION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_portDirection(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting is kept after a reboot.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portOpenDrain
member.summary:
Returns the electrical interface for each bit of the port.
For each bit set to 0 the matching I/O works in the regular, intuitive way, for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the electrical interface for each bit of the port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTOPENDRAIN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_portOpenDrain(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the electrical interface for each bit of the port.
0 makes a bit a regular input/output, 1 makes it an open-drain (open-collector) input/output. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting is kept after a reboot.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the electrical interface for each bit of the port
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portPolarity
member.summary:
Returns the polarity of all the bits of the port.
For each bit set to 0, the matching I/O works the regular, intuitive way; for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the polarity of all the bits of the port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTPOLARITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_portPolarity(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the polarity of all the bits of the port: For each bit set to 0, the matching I/O works the regular, intuitive way; for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting will be kept after a reboot.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the polarity of all the bits of the port: For each bit set to 0, the matching I/O works the regular, intuitive way; for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portDiags
member.summary:
Returns the port state diagnostics (Yocto-IO and Yocto-MaxiIO-V2 only).
Bit 0 indicates a shortcut on output 0, etc. Bit 8 indicates a power failure, and bit 9 signals overheating (overcurrent). During normal use, all diagnostic bits should stay clear.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the port state diagnostics (Yocto-IO and Yocto-MaxiIO-V2 only)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTDIAGS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_portSize
member.summary:
Returns the number of bits (i.e.
channels)implemented in the I/O port.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of bits (i.e
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTSIZE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_outputVoltage
member.summary: Returns the voltage source used to drive output bits.
member.returns: a value among YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_USB_5V, YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_USB_3V and YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_EXT_V corresponding to the voltage source used to drive output bits
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_outputVoltage(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage source used to drive output bits.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting is kept after a reboot.
member.param: a value among YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_USB_5V, YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_USB_3V and YDigitalIO.OUTPUTVOLTAGE_EXT_V corresponding to the voltage source used to drive output bits
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.FindDigitalIO(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a digital IO port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the digital IO port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDigitalIO.isOnline() to test if the digital IO port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a digital IO port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the digital IO port, for instance YMINIIO0.digitalIO.
member.returns: a YDigitalIO object allowing you to drive the digital IO port.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.set_bitState(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets a single bit (i.e.
channel) of the I/O port.

channel) from the I/O port (0 means the bit is an input, 1 an output).

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.get_bitOpenDrain(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the type of electrical interface of a single bit from the I/O port.
(0 means the bit is an input, 1 an output).
member.param: the bit number; lowest bit has index 0
member.returns: 0 means the a bit is a regular input/output, 1 means the bit is an open-drain (open-collector) input/output.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.pulse(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Triggers a pulse on a single bit for a specified duration.
The specified bit will be turned to 1, and then back to 0 after the given duration.
member.param: the bit number; lowest bit has index 0
desired pulse duration in milliseconds. Be aware that the device time resolution is not guaranteed up to the millisecond.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.delayedPulse(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Schedules a pulse on a single bit for a specified duration.
The specified bit will be turned to 1, and then back to 0 after the given duration.
member.param: the bit number; lowest bit has index 0
waiting time before the pulse, in milliseconds
desired pulse duration in milliseconds. Be aware that the device time resolution is not guaranteed up to the millisecond.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.nextDigitalIO
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of digital IO ports started using yFirstDigitalIO().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned digital IO ports order. If you want to find a specific a digital IO port, use DigitalIO.findDigitalIO() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDigitalIO object, corresponding to a digital IO port currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more digital IO ports to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDigitalIO.FirstDigitalIO
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of digital IO ports currently accessible.
Use the method YDigitalIO.nextDigitalIO() to iterate on next digital IO ports.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDigitalIO object, corresponding to the first digital IO port currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer
member.summary:
Each DisplayLayer represents an image layer containing objects to display (bitmaps, text, etc.).
The content is displayed only when the layer is active on the screen (and not masked by other overlapping layers).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.reset
member.summary:
Reverts the layer to its initial state (fully transparent, default settings).
Reinitializes the drawing pointer to the upper left position, and selects the most visible pen color. If you only want to erase the layer content, use the method clear() instead.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.clear
member.summary:
Erases the whole content of the layer (makes it fully transparent).
This method does not change any other attribute of the layer. To reinitialize the layer attributes to defaults settings, use the method reset() instead.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.selectColorPen(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Selects the pen color for all subsequent drawing functions, including text drawing.
The pen color is provided as an RGB value. For grayscale or monochrome displays, the value is automatically converted to the proper range.
member.param: the desired pen color, as a 24-bit RGB value
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.selectGrayPen(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Selects the pen gray level for all subsequent drawing functions, including text drawing.
The gray level is provided as a number between 0 (black) and 255 (white, or whichever the lightest color is). For monochrome displays (without gray levels), any value lower than 128 is rendered as black, and any value equal or above to 128 is non-black.
member.param: the desired gray level, from 0 to 255
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.selectEraser
member.summary:
Selects an eraser instead of a pen for all subsequent drawing functions, except for bitmap copy functions.
Any point drawn using the eraser becomes transparent (as when the layer is empty), showing the other layers beneath it.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.setAntialiasingMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or disables anti-aliasing for drawing oblique lines and circles.
Anti-aliasing provides a smoother aspect when looked from far enough, but it can add fuzziness when the display is looked from very close. At the end of the day, it is your personal choice. Anti-aliasing is enabled by default on grayscale and color displays, but you can disable it if you prefer. This setting has no effect on monochrome displays.
member.param: true to enable anti-aliasing, false to disable it.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a single pixel at the specified position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer, in pixels
the distance from top of layer, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawRect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an empty rectangle at a specified position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from left of layer to the right border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the bottom border of the rectangle, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawBar(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a filled rectangular bar at a specified position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from left of layer to the right border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the bottom border of the rectangle, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawCircle(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an empty circle at a specified position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the center of the circle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the center of the circle, in pixels
the radius of the circle, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawDisc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a filled disc at a given position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the center of the disc, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the center of the disc, in pixels
the radius of the disc, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.selectFont(System.String)
member.summary:
Selects a font to use for the next text drawing functions, by providing the name of the font file.
You can use a built-in font as well as a font file that you have previously uploaded to the device built-in memory. If you experience problems selecting a font file, check the device logs for any error message such as missing font file or bad font file format.
member.param: the font file name, embedded fonts are 8x8.yfm, Small.yfm, Medium.yfm, Large.yfm (not available on Yocto-MiniDisplay).
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawText(System.Int32,System.Int32,YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.ALIGN,System.String)
member.summary:
Draws a text string at the specified position.
The point of the text that is aligned to the specified pixel position is called the anchor point, and can be chosen among several options. Text is rendered from left to right, without implicit wrapping.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the text anchor point, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the text anchor point, in pixels

the text anchor point, chosen among the YDisplayLayer.ALIGN enumeration: YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.TOP_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.CENTER_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BASELINE_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BOTTOM_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.TOP_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BASELINE_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BOTTOM_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.TOP_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.CENTER_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BASELINE_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BOTTOM_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.TOP_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.CENTER_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BASELINE_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN.BOTTOM_RIGHT.
the text string to draw
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Draws a GIF image at the specified position.
The GIF image must have been previously uploaded to the device built-in memory. If you experience problems using an image file, check the device logs for any error message such as missing image file or bad image file format.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left of the image, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top of the image, in pixels
the GIF file name
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.drawBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Draws a bitmap at the specified position.
The bitmap is provided as a binary object, where each pixel maps to a bit, from left to right and from top to bottom. The most significant bit of each byte maps to the leftmost pixel, and the least significant bit maps to the rightmost pixel. Bits set to 1 are drawn using the layer selected pen color. Bits set to 0 are drawn using the specified background gray level, unless -1 is specified, in which case they are not drawn at all (as if transparent).
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left of the bitmap, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top of the bitmap, in pixels
the width of the bitmap, in pixels
a binary object
the background gray level to use for zero bits (0 = black, 255 = white), or -1 to leave the pixels unchanged
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.moveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the drawing pointer of this layer to the specified position.
member.param: the distance from left of layer, in pixels
the distance from top of layer, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.lineTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Draws a line from current drawing pointer position to the specified position.
The specified destination pixel is included in the line. The pointer position is then moved to the end point of the line.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the end point of the line, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the end point of the line, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.consoleOut(System.String)
member.summary:
Outputs a message in the console area, and advances the console pointer accordingly.
The console pointer position is automatically moved to the beginning of the next line when a newline character is met, or when the right margin is hit. When the new text to display extends below the lower margin, the console area is automatically scrolled up.
member.param: the message to display
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.setConsoleMargins(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up display margins for the consoleOut function.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left margin, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top margin, in pixels
the distance from left of layer to the right margin, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the bottom margin, in pixels
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.setConsoleBackground(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up the background color used by the clearConsole function and by the console scrolling feature.
member.param: the background gray level to use when scrolling (0 = black, 255 = white), or -1 for transparent
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.setConsoleWordWrap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets up the wrapping behavior used by the consoleOut function.
member.param: true to wrap only between words, false to wrap on the last column anyway.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.clearConsole
member.summary: Blanks the console area within console margins, and resets the console pointer to the upper left corner of the console.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.setLayerPosition(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the position of the layer relative to the display upper left corner.
When smooth scrolling is used, the display offset of the layer is automatically updated during the next milliseconds to animate the move of the layer.
member.param: the distance from left of display to the upper left corner of the layer
the distance from top of display to the upper left corner of the layer
number of milliseconds to use for smooth scrolling, or 0 if the scrolling should be immediate.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.hide
member.summary:
Hides the layer.
The state of the layer is preserved but the layer is not displayed on the screen until the next call to unhide(). Hiding the layer can positively affect the drawing speed, since it postpones the rendering until all operations are completed (double-buffering).
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplayLayer.unhide
member.summary:
Shows the layer.
Shows the layer again after a hide command.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Gets parent YDisplay.
Returns the parent YDisplay object of the current YDisplayLayer.
member.returns: an YDisplay object

member.summary: Returns the display width, in pixels.

member.summary: Returns the display height, in pixels.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YDisplay
member.summary:
The YDisplay class allows to drive Yoctopuce displays.
Yoctopuce display interface has been designed to easily show information and images. The device provides built-in multi-layer rendering. Layers can be drawn offline, individually, and freely moved on the display. It can also replay recorded sequences (animations).
In order to draw on the screen, you should use the display.get_displayLayer method to retrieve the layer(s) on which you want to draw, and then use methods defined in YDisplayLayer to draw on the layers.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns true if the screen is powered, false otherwise.
member.returns: either YDisplay.ENABLED_FALSE or YDisplay.ENABLED_TRUE, according to true if the screen is powered, false otherwise
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDisplay.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the power state of the display.
member.param: either YDisplay.ENABLED_FALSE or YDisplay.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the power state of the display
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.get_startupSeq
member.summary: Returns the name of the sequence to play when the displayed is powered on.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the name of the sequence to play when the displayed is powered on
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDisplay.STARTUPSEQ_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.set_startupSeq(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the name of the sequence to play when the displayed is powered on.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the name of the sequence to play when the displayed is powered on
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the luminosity of the module informative LEDs (from 0 to 100).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the luminosity of the module informative LEDs (from 0 to 100)

The parameter is a value between 0 and 100. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the brightness of the display

member.param: a value among YDisplay.ORIENTATION_LEFT, YDisplay.ORIENTATION_UP, YDisplay.ORIENTATION_RIGHT and YDisplay.ORIENTATION_DOWN corresponding to the display orientation
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.returns: a value among YDisplay.DISPLAYTYPE_MONO, YDisplay.DISPLAYTYPE_GRAY and YDisplay.DISPLAYTYPE_RGB corresponding to the display type: monochrome, gray levels or full color

member.summary: Returns the number of available layers to draw on.
