member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.FindDisplay(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a display for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the display is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDisplay.isOnline() to test if the display is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a display by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the display, for instance YD128X32.display.
member.returns: a YDisplay object allowing you to drive the display.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YDisplay.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.resetAll
member.summary:
Clears the display screen and resets all display layers to their default state.
Using this function in a sequence will kill the sequence play-back. Don't use that function to reset the display at sequence start-up.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.fade(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Smoothly changes the brightness of the screen to produce a fade-in or fade-out effect.
member.param: the new screen brightness
duration of the brightness transition, in milliseconds.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.newSequence
member.summary:
Starts to record all display commands into a sequence, for later replay.
The name used to store the sequence is specified when calling saveSequence(), once the recording is complete.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.saveSequence(System.String)
member.summary:
Stops recording display commands and saves the sequence into the specified file on the display internal memory.
The sequence can be later replayed using playSequence().
member.param: the name of the newly created sequence
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.playSequence(System.String)
member.summary: Replays a display sequence previously recorded using newSequence() and saveSequence().
member.param: the name of the newly created sequence
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.pauseSequence(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Waits for a specified delay (in milliseconds) before playing next commands in current sequence.
This method can be used while recording a display sequence, to insert a timed wait in the sequence (without any immediate effect). It can also be used dynamically while playing a pre-recorded sequence, to suspend or resume the execution of the sequence. To cancel a delay, call the same method with a zero delay.
member.param: the duration to wait, in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.stopSequence
member.summary:
Stops immediately any ongoing sequence replay.
The display is left as is.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.upload(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Uploads an arbitrary file (for instance a GIF file) to the display, to the specified full path name.
If a file already exists with the same path name, its content is overwritten.
member.param: path and name of the new file to create
binary buffer with the content to set
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.copyLayerContent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Copies the whole content of a layer to another layer.
The color and transparency of all the pixels from the destination layer are set to match the source pixels. This method only affects the displayed content, but does not change any property of the layer object. Note that layer 0 has no transparency support (it is always completely opaque).
member.param: the identifier of the source layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
the identifier of the destination layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.swapLayerContent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Swaps the whole content of two layers.
The color and transparency of all the pixels from the two layers are swapped. This method only affects the displayed content, but does not change any property of the layer objects. In particular, the visibility of each layer stays unchanged. When used between one hidden layer and a visible layer, this method makes it possible to easily implement double-buffering. Note that layer 0 has no transparency support (it is always completely opaque).
member.param: the first layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
the second layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.get_displayLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a YDisplayLayer object that can be used to draw on the specified layer.
The content is displayed only when the layer is active on the screen (and not masked by other overlapping layers).
member.param: the identifier of the layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: an YDisplayLayer object
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns null.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.nextDisplay
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of displays started using yFirstDisplay().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned displays order. If you want to find a specific a display, use Display.findDisplay() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDisplay object, corresponding to a display currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more displays to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDisplay.FirstDisplay
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of displays currently accessible.
Use the method YDisplay.nextDisplay() to iterate on next displays.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDisplay object, corresponding to the first display currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YDualPower
member.summary:
The YDualPower class allows you to control the power source to use for module functions that require high current.
The module can also automatically disconnect the external power when a voltage drop is observed on the external power source (external battery running out of power).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.get_powerState
member.summary: Returns the current power source for module functions that require lots of current.
member.returns: a value among YDualPower.POWERSTATE_OFF, YDualPower.POWERSTATE_FROM_USB and YDualPower.POWERSTATE_FROM_EXT corresponding to the current power source for module functions that require lots of current
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDualPower.POWERSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.get_powerControl
member.summary: Returns the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current.
member.returns: a value among YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_AUTO, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_USB, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_EXT and YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_OFF corresponding to the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.set_powerControl(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_AUTO, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_USB, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_EXT and YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_OFF corresponding to the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.get_extVoltage
member.summary: Returns the measured voltage on the external power source, in millivolts.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measured voltage on the external power source, in millivolts
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDualPower.EXTVOLTAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.FindDualPower(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a dual power switch for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the dual power switch is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDualPower.isOnline() to test if the dual power switch is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a dual power switch by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the dual power switch, for instance SERVORC1.dualPower.
member.returns: a YDualPower object allowing you to drive the dual power switch.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YDualPower.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.nextDualPower
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of dual power switches started using yFirstDualPower().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned dual power switches order. If you want to find a specific a dual power switch, use DualPower.findDualPower() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDualPower object, corresponding to a dual power switch currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more dual power switches to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YDualPower.FirstDualPower
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of dual power switches currently accessible.
Use the method YDualPower.nextDualPower() to iterate on next dual power switches.
member.returns: a pointer to a YDualPower object, corresponding to the first dual power switch currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

members.member: YFileRecord objects are used to describe a file that is stored on a Yoctopuce device. These objects are used in particular in conjunction with the YFiles class.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFileRecord.get_name
member.summary: Returns the name of the file.
member.returns: a string with the name of the file.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFileRecord.get_size
member.summary: Returns the size of the file in bytes.
member.returns: the size of the file.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFileRecord.get_crc
member.summary: Returns the 32-bit CRC of the file content.
member.returns: the 32-bit CRC of the file content.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YFiles
member.summary:
The YFiles class is used to access the filesystem embedded on some Yoctopuce devices.
This filesystem makes it possible for instance to design a custom web UI (for networked devices) or to add fonts (on display devices).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.get_filesCount
member.summary: Returns the number of files currently loaded in the filesystem.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of files currently loaded in the filesystem
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFiles.FILESCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.get_freeSpace
member.summary: Returns the free space for uploading new files to the filesystem, in bytes.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the free space for uploading new files to the filesystem, in bytes
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFiles.FREESPACE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.FindFiles(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a filesystem for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the filesystem is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YFiles.isOnline() to test if the filesystem is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a filesystem by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the filesystem, for instance YRGBLED2.files.
member.returns: a YFiles object allowing you to drive the filesystem.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YFiles.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.format_fs
member.summary:
Reinitialize the filesystem to its clean, unfragmented, empty state.
All files previously uploaded are permanently lost.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.get_list(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of YFileRecord objects that describe files currently loaded in the filesystem.
member.param: an optional filter pattern, using star and question marks as wild cards. When an empty pattern is provided, all file records are returned.
member.returns: a list of YFileRecord objects, containing the file path and name, byte size and 32-bit CRC of the file content.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.fileExist(System.String)
member.summary: Test if a file exist on the filesystem of the module.
member.param: the file name to test.
member.returns: a true if the file exist, false otherwise.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.download(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the requested file and returns a binary buffer with its content.
member.param: path and name of the file to download
member.returns: a binary buffer with the file content
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty content.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.upload(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Uploads a file to the filesystem, to the specified full path name.
If a file already exists with the same path name, its content is overwritten.
member.param: path and name of the new file to create
binary buffer with the content to set
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.remove(System.String)
member.summary:
Deletes a file, given by its full path name, from the filesystem.
Because of filesystem fragmentation, deleting a file may not always free up the whole space used by the file. However, rewriting a file with the same path name will always reuse any space not freed previously. If you need to ensure that no space is taken by previously deleted files, you can use format_fs to fully reinitialize the filesystem.
member.param: path and name of the file to remove.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.nextFiles
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of filesystems started using yFirstFiles().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned filesystems order. If you want to find a specific a filesystem, use Files.findFiles() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YFiles object, corresponding to a filesystem currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more filesystems to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YFiles.FirstFiles
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of filesystems currently accessible.
Use the method YFiles.nextFiles() to iterate on next filesystems.
member.returns: a pointer to a YFiles object, corresponding to the first filesystem currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor
member.summary:
The YGenericSensor class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce signal transducers.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure the automatic conversion between the measured signal and the corresponding engineering unit.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured value.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured value
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_signalValue
member.summary: Returns the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_signalUnit
member.summary: Returns the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALUNIT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_signalRange
member.summary: Returns the input signal range used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the input signal range used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALRANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_signalRange(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the input signal range used by the sensor.
When the input signal gets out of the planned range, the output value will be set to an arbitrary large value, whose sign indicates the direction of the range overrun.
For a 4-20mA sensor, the default input signal range is "4...20". For a 0-10V sensor, the default input signal range is "0.1...10". For numeric communication interfaces, the default input signal range is "-999999.999...999999.999".
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the input signal range used by the sensor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_valueRange
member.summary: Returns the physical value range measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the physical value range measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.VALUERANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_valueRange(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the output value range, corresponding to the physical value measured by the sensor.
The default output value range is the same as the input signal range (1:1 mapping), but you can change it so that the function automatically computes the physical value encoded by the input signal. Be aware that, as a side effect, the range modification may automatically modify the display resolution.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the output value range, corresponding to the physical value measured by the sensor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_signalBias(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment.
If your electric signal reads positive when it should be zero, setup a positive signalBias of the same value to fix the zero shift. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_signalBias
member.summary:
Returns the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment.
A positive bias means that the signal is over-reporting the measure, while a negative bias means that the signal is under-reporting the measure.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALBIAS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_signalSampling
member.summary:
Returns the electric signal sampling method to use.
The HIGH_RATE method uses the highest sampling frequency, without any filtering. The HIGH_RATE_FILTERED method adds a windowed 7-sample median filter. The LOW_NOISE method uses a reduced acquisition frequency to reduce noise. The LOW_NOISE_FILTERED method combines a reduced frequency with the median filter to get measures as stable as possible when working on a noisy signal.
member.returns: a value among YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE_FILTERED, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE_FILTERED and YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGHEST_RATE corresponding to the electric signal sampling method to use
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_signalSampling(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the electric signal sampling method to use.
The HIGH_RATE method uses the highest sampling frequency, without any filtering. The HIGH_RATE_FILTERED method adds a windowed 7-sample median filter. The LOW_NOISE method uses a reduced acquisition frequency to reduce noise. The LOW_NOISE_FILTERED method combines a reduced frequency with the median filter to get measures as stable as possible when working on a noisy signal. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE_FILTERED, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE_FILTERED and YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGHEST_RATE corresponding to the electric signal sampling method to use
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YGenericSensor.ENABLED_FALSE or YGenericSensor.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this input.
When an input is disabled, its value is no more updated. On some devices, disabling an input can improve the refresh rate of the other active inputs. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YGenericSensor.ENABLED_FALSE or YGenericSensor.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.FindGenericSensor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a generic sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the generic sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGenericSensor.isOnline() to test if the generic sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a generic sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the generic sensor, for instance RX010V01.genericSensor1.
member.returns: a YGenericSensor object allowing you to drive the generic sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.zeroAdjust
member.summary:
Adjusts the signal bias so that the current signal value is need precisely as zero.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.nextGenericSensor
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of generic sensors started using yFirstGenericSensor().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned generic sensors order. If you want to find a specific a generic sensor, use GenericSensor.findGenericSensor() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGenericSensor object, corresponding to a generic sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more generic sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGenericSensor.FirstGenericSensor
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of generic sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YGenericSensor.nextGenericSensor() to iterate on next generic sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGenericSensor object, corresponding to the first generic sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YGps
member.summary:
The YGps class allows you to retrieve positioning data from a GPS/GNSS sensor.
This class can provides complete positioning information. However, if you wish to define callbacks on position changes or record the position in the datalogger, you should use the YLatitude et YLongitude classes.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_isFixed
member.summary: Returns TRUE if the receiver has found enough satellites to work.
member.returns: either YGps.ISFIXED_FALSE or YGps.ISFIXED_TRUE, according to TRUE if the receiver has found enough satellites to work
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.ISFIXED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_satCount
member.summary: Returns the total count of satellites used to compute GPS position.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total count of satellites used to compute GPS position
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.SATCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_satPerConst
member.summary:
Returns the count of visible satellites per constellation encoded on a 32 bit integer: bits 0..
5: GPS satellites count, bits 6..11 : Glonass, bits 12..17 : Galileo. this value is refreshed every 5 seconds only.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the count of visible satellites per constellation encoded on a 32 bit integer: bits 0.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.SATPERCONST_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_gpsRefreshRate
member.summary:
Returns effective GPS data refresh frequency.
this value is refreshed every 5 seconds only.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to effective GPS data refresh frequency
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.GPSREFRESHRATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_coordSystem
member.summary: Returns the representation system used for positioning data.
member.returns: a value among YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DMS, YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DM and YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_D corresponding to the representation system used for positioning data
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.COORDSYSTEM_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.set_coordSystem(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the representation system used for positioning data.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DMS, YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DM and YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_D corresponding to the representation system used for positioning data
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_constellation
member.summary: Returns the the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data.
member.returns: a value among YGps.CONSTELLATION_GNSS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GALILEO, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GALILEO and YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS_GALILEO corresponding to the the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.CONSTELLATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.set_constellation(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data.
Possible constellations are GNSS ( = all supported constellations), GPS, Glonass, Galileo , and the 3 possible pairs. This setting has no effect on Yocto-GPS (V1).
member.param: a value among YGps.CONSTELLATION_GNSS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GALILEO, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GALILEO and YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS_GALILEO corresponding to the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_latitude
member.summary: Returns the current latitude.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the current latitude
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.LATITUDE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_longitude
member.summary: Returns the current longitude.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the current longitude
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.LONGITUDE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_dilution
member.summary: Returns the current horizontal dilution of precision, the smaller that number is, the better .
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current horizontal dilution of precision, the smaller that number is, the better
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.DILUTION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_altitude
member.summary:
Returns the current altitude.
Beware: GPS technology is very inaccurate regarding altitude.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current altitude
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.ALTITUDE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_groundSpeed
member.summary: Returns the current ground speed in Km/h.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_direction
member.summary: Returns the current move bearing in degrees, zero is the true (geographic) north.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current move bearing in degrees, zero is the true (geographic) north
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.DIRECTION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_unixTime
member.summary: Returns the current time in Unix format (number of seconds elapsed since Jan 1st, 1970).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current time in Unix format (number of seconds elapsed since Jan 1st, 1970)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.UNIXTIME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_dateTime
member.summary: Returns the current time in the form "YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss".
member.returns: a string corresponding to the current time in the form "YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.DATETIME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.get_utcOffset
member.summary: Returns the number of seconds between current time and UTC time (time zone).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of seconds between current time and UTC time (time zone)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.UTCOFFSET_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.set_utcOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the number of seconds between current time and UTC time (time zone).
The timezone is automatically rounded to the nearest multiple of 15 minutes. If current UTC time is known, the current time is automatically be updated according to the selected time zone. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the number of seconds between current time and UTC time (time zone)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.FindGps(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a geolocalization module for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the geolocalization module is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGps.isOnline() to test if the geolocalization module is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a geolocalization module by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the geolocalization module, for instance YGNSSMK2.gps.
member.returns: a YGps object allowing you to drive the geolocalization module.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YGps.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.nextGps
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of geolocalization modules started using yFirstGps().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned geolocalization modules order. If you want to find a specific a geolocalization module, use Gps.findGps() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGps object, corresponding to a geolocalization module currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more geolocalization modules to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGps.FirstGps
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of geolocalization modules currently accessible.
Use the method YGps.nextGps() to iterate on next geolocalization modules.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGps object, corresponding to the first geolocalization module currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed
member.summary:
The YGroundSpeed class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce ground speed sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.FindGroundSpeed(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a ground speed sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the ground speed sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGroundSpeed.isOnline() to test if the ground speed sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a ground speed sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the ground speed sensor, for instance YGNSSMK2.groundSpeed.
member.returns: a YGroundSpeed object allowing you to drive the ground speed sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.nextGroundSpeed
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of ground speed sensors started using yFirstGroundSpeed().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned ground speed sensors order. If you want to find a specific a ground speed sensor, use GroundSpeed.findGroundSpeed() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGroundSpeed object, corresponding to a ground speed sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more ground speed sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGroundSpeed.FirstGroundSpeed
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of ground speed sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YGroundSpeed.nextGroundSpeed() to iterate on next ground speed sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGroundSpeed object, corresponding to the first ground speed sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YQt
member.summary:
The YQt class provides direct access to the 3D attitude estimation provided by Yoctopuce inertial sensors.
The four instances of YQt provide direct access to the individual quaternion components representing the orientation. It is usually not needed to use the YQt class directly, as the YGyro class provides a more convenient higher-level interface.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YQt.FindQt(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a quaternion component for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the quaternion component is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YQt.isOnline() to test if the quaternion component is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a quaternion component by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the quaternion component, for instance Y3DMK002.qt1.
member.returns: a YQt object allowing you to drive the quaternion component.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YQt.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YQt.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YQt.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YQt.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YQt.nextQt
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of quaternion components started using yFirstQt().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned quaternion components order. If you want to find a specific a quaternion component, use Qt.findQt() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YQt object, corresponding to a quaternion component currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more quaternion components to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YQt.FirstQt
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of quaternion components currently accessible.
Use the method YQt.nextQt() to iterate on next quaternion components.
member.returns: a pointer to a YQt object, corresponding to the first quaternion component currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YGyro
member.summary:
The YGyro class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce gyroscopes.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the possibility to access x, y and z components of the rotation vector separately, as well as the possibility to deal with quaternion-based orientation estimates.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGyro.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_xValue
member.summary: Returns the angular velocity around the X axis of the device, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the angular velocity around the X axis of the device, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGyro.XVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_yValue
member.summary: Returns the angular velocity around the Y axis of the device, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the angular velocity around the Y axis of the device, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGyro.YVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_zValue
member.summary: Returns the angular velocity around the Z axis of the device, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the angular velocity around the Z axis of the device, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGyro.ZVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.FindGyro(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a gyroscope for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the gyroscope is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGyro.isOnline() to test if the gyroscope is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a gyroscope by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the gyroscope, for instance Y3DMK002.gyro.
member.returns: a YGyro object allowing you to drive the gyroscope.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YGyro.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YGyro.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_roll
member.summary:
Returns the estimated roll angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the roll angle can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to roll angle in degrees, between -180 and +180.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_pitch
member.summary:
Returns the estimated pitch angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the pitch angle can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to pitch angle in degrees, between -90 and +90.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_heading
member.summary:
Returns the estimated heading angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the heading can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to heading in degrees, between 0 and 360.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_quaternionW
member.summary: Returns the w component (real part) of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the w component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_quaternionX
member.summary:
Returns the x component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The x component is mostly correlated with rotations on the roll axis.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the x component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_quaternionY
member.summary:
Returns the y component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The y component is mostly correlated with rotations on the pitch axis.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the y component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.get_quaternionZ
member.summary:
Returns the x component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The x component is mostly correlated with changes of heading.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the z component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.registerQuaternionCallback(YoctoLib.YGyro.YQuatCallback)
member.summary:
Registers a callback function that will be invoked each time that the estimated device orientation has changed.
The call frequency is typically around 95Hz during a move. The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to invoke, or a null pointer. The callback function should take five arguments: the YGyro object of the turning device, and the floating point values of the four components w, x, y and z (as floating-point numbers). @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.registerAnglesCallback(YoctoLib.YGyro.YAnglesCallback)
member.summary:
Registers a callback function that will be invoked each time that the estimated device orientation has changed.
The call frequency is typically around 95Hz during a move. The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to invoke, or a null pointer. The callback function should take four arguments: the YGyro object of the turning device, and the floating point values of the three angles roll, pitch and heading in degrees (as floating-point numbers). @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.nextGyro
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of gyroscopes started using yFirstGyro().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned gyroscopes order. If you want to find a specific a gyroscope, use Gyro.findGyro() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGyro object, corresponding to a gyroscope currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more gyroscopes to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YGyro.FirstGyro
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of gyroscopes currently accessible.
Use the method YGyro.nextGyro() to iterate on next gyroscopes.
member.returns: a pointer to a YGyro object, corresponding to the first gyro currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YHubPort
member.summary:
The YHubPort class provides control over the power supply for slave ports on a YoctoHub.
It provide information about the device connected to it. The logical name of a YHubPort is always automatically set to the unique serial number of the Yoctopuce device connected to it.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns true if the YoctoHub port is powered, false otherwise.
member.returns: either YHubPort.ENABLED_FALSE or YHubPort.ENABLED_TRUE, according to true if the YoctoHub port is powered, false otherwise
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation of the YoctoHub port.
If the port is enabled, the connected module is powered. Otherwise, port power is shut down.
member.param: either YHubPort.ENABLED_FALSE or YHubPort.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation of the YoctoHub port
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.get_portState
member.summary: Returns the current state of the YoctoHub port.
member.returns: a value among YHubPort.PORTSTATE_OFF, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_OVRLD, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_ON, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_RUN and YHubPort.PORTSTATE_PROG corresponding to the current state of the YoctoHub port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.PORTSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.get_baudRate
member.summary:
Returns the current baud rate used by this YoctoHub port, in kbps.
The default value is 1000 kbps, but a slower rate may be used if communication problems are encountered.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current baud rate used by this YoctoHub port, in kbps
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.BAUDRATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.FindHubPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a YoctoHub slave port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the YoctoHub slave port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YHubPort.isOnline() to test if the YoctoHub slave port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a YoctoHub slave port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the YoctoHub slave port, for instance YHUBETH1.hubPort1.
member.returns: a YHubPort object allowing you to drive the YoctoHub slave port.

member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of YoctoHub slave ports started using yFirstHubPort().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned YoctoHub slave ports order. If you want to find a specific a YoctoHub slave port, use HubPort.findHubPort() and a hardwareID or a logical name.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHubPort.FirstHubPort
member.summary:

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YHumidity
member.summary:
The YHumidity class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce humidity sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YHumidity.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the primary unit for measuring humidity.
That unit is a string. If that strings starts with the letter 'g', the primary measured value is the absolute humidity, in g/m3. Otherwise, the primary measured value will be the relative humidity (RH), in per cents.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the primary unit for measuring humidity
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YI2cPort
member.summary:
The YI2cPort classe allows you to fully drive a Yoctopuce I2C port.
It can be used to send and receive data, and to configure communication parameters (baud rate, etc). Note that Yoctopuce I2C ports are not exposed as virtual COM ports. They are meant to be used in the same way as all Yoctopuce devices.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_rxCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes received since last reset.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total number of bytes received since last reset
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.RXCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_txCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes transmitted since last reset.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total number of bytes transmitted since last reset
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.TXCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_errCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of communication errors detected since last reset.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total number of communication errors detected since last reset
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.ERRCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_rxMsgCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of messages received since last reset.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total number of messages received since last reset
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.RXMSGCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_txMsgCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of messages send since last reset.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total number of messages send since last reset
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.TXMSGCOUNT_INVALID.

member.returns: a string corresponding to the latest message fully received (for Line and Frame protocols)

Selects a job file to run immediately.

Changes the job to use when the device is powered on.

member.returns: an integer corresponding to maximum size allowed for job files
