member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used to send I2C messages, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for messages separated by LF or "Char" for continuous stream of codes.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used to send I2C messages, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used to send I2C messages.
Possible values are "Line" for messages separated by LF or "Char" for continuous stream of codes. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each message sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used to send I2C messages
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_i2cVoltageLevel
member.summary: Returns the voltage level used on the I2C bus.
member.returns: a value among YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_3V3 and YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_1V8 corresponding to the voltage level used on the I2C bus
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.set_i2cVoltageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage level used on the I2C bus.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_3V3 and YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_1V8 corresponding to the voltage level used on the I2C bus
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.get_i2cMode
member.summary:
Returns the I2C port communication parameters, as a string such as "400kbps,2000ms,NoRestart".
The string includes the baud rate, the recovery delay after communications errors, and if needed the option NoRestart to use a Stop/Start sequence instead of the Restart state when performing read on the I2C bus.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the I2C port communication parameters, as a string such as "400kbps,2000ms,NoRestart"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.I2CMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.set_i2cMode(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the I2C port communication parameters, with a string such as "400kbps,2000ms".
The string includes the baud rate, the recovery delay after communications errors, and if needed the option NoRestart to use a Stop/Start sequence instead of the Restart state when performing read on the I2C bus. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the I2C port communication parameters, with a string such as "400kbps,2000ms"
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.FindI2cPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves an I2C port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the I2C port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YI2cPort.isOnline() to test if the I2C port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an I2C port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the I2C port, for instance YI2CMK01.i2cPort.
member.returns: a YI2cPort object allowing you to drive the I2C port.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YI2cPort.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.uploadJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().
member.param: name of the job file to save on the device filesystem
a string containing a JSON definition of the job
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.selectJob(System.String)
member.summary:
Load and start processing the specified job file.
The file must have been previously created using the user interface or uploaded on the device filesystem using the uploadJob() function.
member.param: name of the job file (on the device filesystem)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.reset
member.summary: Clears the serial port buffer and resets counters to zero.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.i2cSendBin(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a a binary buffer) to a device on the I2C bus.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.
member.param: the 7-bit address of the slave device (without the direction bit)
the binary buffer to be sent
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.i2cSendArray(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a list of integer) to a device on the I2C bus.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.
member.param: the 7-bit address of the slave device (without the direction bit)
a list of data bytes to be sent
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.i2cSendAndReceiveBin(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a a binary buffer) to a device on the I2C bus, then read back the specified number of bytes from device.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.
member.param: the 7-bit address of the slave device (without the direction bit)
the binary buffer to be sent
the number of bytes to receive once the data bytes are sent
member.returns: a list of bytes with the data received from slave device.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty binary buffer.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.i2cSendAndReceiveArray(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a list of integer) to a device on the I2C bus, then read back the specified number of bytes from device.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.
member.param: the 7-bit address of the slave device (without the direction bit)
a list of data bytes to be sent
the number of bytes to receive once the data bytes are sent
member.returns: a list of bytes with the data received from slave device.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeStr(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a text-encoded I2C code stream to the I2C bus, as is.
An I2C code stream is a string made of hexadecimal data bytes, but that may also include the I2C state transitions code: "{S}" to emit a start condition, "{R}" for a repeated start condition, "{P}" for a stop condition, "xx" for receiving a data byte, "{A}" to ack a data byte received and "{N}" to nack a data byte received. If a newline ("\n") is included in the stream, the message will be terminated and a newline will also be added to the receive stream.
member.param: the code stream to send
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeLine(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a text-encoded I2C code stream to the I2C bus, and terminate the message en relchant le bus.
An I2C code stream is a string made of hexadecimal data bytes, but that may also include the I2C state transitions code: "{S}" to emit a start condition, "{R}" for a repeated start condition, "{P}" for a stop condition, "xx" for receiving a data byte, "{A}" to ack a data byte received and "{N}" to nack a data byte received. At the end of the stream, a stop condition is added if missing and a newline is added to the receive buffer as well.
member.param: the code stream to send
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeByte(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a single byte to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: the byte to send
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeHex(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a byte sequence (provided as a hexadecimal string) to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: a string of hexadecimal byte codes
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeBin(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Sends a binary buffer to the I2C bus, as is.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: the binary buffer to send
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.writeArray(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Sends a byte sequence (provided as a list of bytes) to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: a list of byte codes
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.snoopMessages(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Retrieves messages (both direction) in the I2C port buffer, starting at current position.
If no message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of YI2cSnoopingRecord objects containing the messages found, if any.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.nextI2cPort
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of I2C ports started using yFirstI2cPort().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned I2C ports order. If you want to find a specific an I2C port, use I2cPort.findI2cPort() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YI2cPort object, corresponding to an I2C port currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more I2C ports to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YI2cPort.FirstI2cPort
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of I2C ports currently accessible.
Use the method YI2cPort.nextI2cPort() to iterate on next I2C ports.
member.returns: a pointer to a YI2cPort object, corresponding to the first I2C port currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YLatitude
member.summary:
The YLatitude class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce latitude sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLatitude.FindLatitude(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a latitude sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the latitude sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YLatitude.isOnline() to test if the latitude sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a latitude sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the latitude sensor, for instance YGNSSMK2.latitude.
member.returns: a YLatitude object allowing you to drive the latitude sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLatitude.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YLatitude.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLatitude.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YLatitude.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLatitude.nextLatitude
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of latitude sensors started using yFirstLatitude().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned latitude sensors order. If you want to find a specific a latitude sensor, use Latitude.findLatitude() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YLatitude object, corresponding to a latitude sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more latitude sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLatitude.FirstLatitude
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of latitude sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YLatitude.nextLatitude() to iterate on next latitude sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YLatitude object, corresponding to the first latitude sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YLed
member.summary:
The YLed class allows you to drive a monocolor LED.
You can not only to drive the intensity of the LED, but also to have it blink at various preset frequencies.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.get_power
member.summary: Returns the current LED state.
member.returns: either YLed.POWER_OFF or YLed.POWER_ON, according to the current LED state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YLed.POWER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.set_power(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the state of the LED.
member.param: either YLed.POWER_OFF or YLed.POWER_ON, according to the state of the LED
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.get_luminosity
member.summary: Returns the current LED intensity (in per cent).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current LED intensity (in per cent)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YLed.LUMINOSITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.set_luminosity(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current LED intensity (in per cent).
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the current LED intensity (in per cent)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.get_blinking
member.summary: Returns the current LED signaling mode.
member.returns: a value among YLed.BLINKING_STILL, YLed.BLINKING_RELAX, YLed.BLINKING_AWARE, YLed.BLINKING_RUN, YLed.BLINKING_CALL and YLed.BLINKING_PANIC corresponding to the current LED signaling mode
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YLed.BLINKING_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.set_blinking(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the current LED signaling mode.
member.param: a value among YLed.BLINKING_STILL, YLed.BLINKING_RELAX, YLed.BLINKING_AWARE, YLed.BLINKING_RUN, YLed.BLINKING_CALL and YLed.BLINKING_PANIC corresponding to the current LED signaling mode
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.FindLed(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a monochrome LED for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the monochrome LED is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YLed.isOnline() to test if the monochrome LED is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a monochrome LED by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the monochrome LED, for instance YBUZZER2.led1.
member.returns: a YLed object allowing you to drive the monochrome LED.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YLed.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.nextLed
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of monochrome LEDs started using yFirstLed().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned monochrome LEDs order. If you want to find a specific a monochrome LED, use Led.findLed() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YLed object, corresponding to a monochrome LED currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more monochrome LEDs to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLed.FirstLed
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of monochrome LEDs currently accessible.
Use the method YLed.nextLed() to iterate on next monochrome LEDs.
member.returns: a pointer to a YLed object, corresponding to the first monochrome LED currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YLightSensor
member.summary:
The YLightSensor class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce light sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to easily perform a one-point linear calibration to compensate the effect of a glass or filter placed in front of the sensor. For some light sensors with several working modes, this class can select the desired working mode.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLightSensor.calibrate(System.Double)
member.summary: Changes the sensor-specific calibration parameter so that the current value matches a desired target (linear scaling).
member.param: the desired target value.
member.para: Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLightSensor.get_measureType
member.summary: Returns the type of light measure.
member.returns: a value among YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HUMAN_EYE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_WIDE_SPECTRUM, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INFRARED, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RATE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_ENERGY and YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RESOLUTION corresponding to the type of light measure
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLightSensor.set_measureType(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the light sensor type used in the device.
The measure can either approximate the response of the human eye, focus on a specific light spectrum, depending on the capabilities of the light-sensitive cell. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HUMAN_EYE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_WIDE_SPECTRUM, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INFRARED, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RATE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_ENERGY and YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RESOLUTION corresponding to the light sensor type used in the device
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLightSensor.FindLightSensor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a light sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the light sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YLightSensor.isOnline() to test if the light sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a light sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the light sensor, for instance LIGHTMK3.lightSensor.
member.returns: a YLightSensor object allowing you to drive the light sensor.

member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YLightSensor.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YLightSensor.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of light sensors started using yFirstLightSensor().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned light sensors order. If you want to find a specific a light sensor, use LightSensor.findLightSensor() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YLightSensor object, corresponding to a light sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more light sensors to enumerate.

member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of light sensors currently accessible.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YMagnetometer
member.summary:
The YSensor class is the parent class for all Yoctopuce sensor types.
It can be used to read the current value and unit of any sensor, read the min/max value, configure autonomous recording frequency and access recorded data. It also provide a function to register a callback invoked each time the observed value changes, or at a predefined interval. Using this class rather than a specific subclass makes it possible to create generic applications that work with any Yoctopuce sensor, even those that do not yet exist. Note: The YAnButton class is the only analog input which does not inherit from YSensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMagnetometer.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMagnetometer.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMagnetometer.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the X component of the magnetic field, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMagnetometer.XVALUE_INVALID.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMagnetometer.YVALUE_INVALID.

members.member: YSms objects are used to describe an SMS message, received or to be sent. These objects are used in particular in conjunction with the YMessageBox class.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSms.get_textData
member.summary: Returns the content of the message.
member.returns: a string with the content of the message.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSms.addText(System.String)
member.summary:
Add a regular text to the SMS.
This function support messages of more than 160 characters. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use the addUnicodeData method.
member.param: the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSms.addUnicodeData(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Add a unicode text to the SMS.
This function support messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation.
member.param: an array of special unicode characters
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSms.send
member.summary:
Sends the SMS to the recipient.
Messages of more than 160 characters are supported using SMS concatenation.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

In case of ambiguity when looking for a SMS message box interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.

member.summary: Clear the SMS units counters.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMessageBox.sendTextMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a regular text SMS, with standard parameters.
This function can send messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For sending messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use newMessage to create a new message and define the content of using methods addText and addUnicodeData.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMessageBox.sendFlashMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a Flash SMS (class 0 message).
Flash messages are displayed on the handset immediately and are usually not saved on the SIM card. This function can send messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For sending messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use newMessage to create a new message and define the content of using methods addText et addUnicodeData.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Creates a new empty SMS message, to be configured and sent later on.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Returns the list of messages received and not deleted.
This function will automatically decode concatenated SMS.
member.returns: an YSms object list.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

Continues the enumeration of SMS message box interfaces started using yFirstMessageBox().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned SMS message box interfaces order. If you want to find a specific a SMS message box interface, use MessageBox.findMessageBox() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YMessageBox object, corresponding to a SMS message box interface currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more SMS message box interfaces to enumerate.

Starts the enumeration of SMS message box interfaces currently accessible.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YMotor
member.summary:
The YMotor class allows you to drive a DC motor.
It can be used to configure the power sent to the motor to make it turn both ways, but also to drive accelerations and decelerations. The motor will then accelerate automatically: you will not have to monitor it. The API also allows to slow down the motor by shortening its terminals: the motor will then act as an electromagnetic brake.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_motorStatus
member.returns: a value among YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_IDLE, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_BRAKE, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_FORWD, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_BACKWD, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_LOVOLT, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_HICURR, YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_HIHEAT and YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_FAILSF
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_drivingForce(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes immediately the power sent to the motor.
The value is a percentage between -100% to 100%. If you want go easy on your mechanics and avoid excessive current consumption, try to avoid brutal power changes. For example, immediate transition from forward full power to reverse full power is a very bad idea. Each time the driving power is modified, the braking power is set to zero.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to immediately the power sent to the motor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_drivingForce
member.summary: Returns the power sent to the motor, as a percentage between -100% and +100%.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the power sent to the motor, as a percentage between -100% and +100%
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.DRIVINGFORCE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_brakingForce(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes immediately the braking force applied to the motor (in percents).
The value 0 corresponds to no braking (free wheel). When the braking force is changed, the driving power is set to zero. The value is a percentage.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to immediately the braking force applied to the motor (in percents)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_brakingForce
member.summary:
Returns the braking force applied to the motor, as a percentage.
The value 0 corresponds to no braking (free wheel).
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the braking force applied to the motor, as a percentage
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.BRAKINGFORCE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_cutOffVoltage(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw.
This setting prevent damage to a battery that can occur when drawing current from an "empty" battery. Note that whatever the cutoff threshold, the controller switches to undervoltage error state if the power supply goes under 3V, even for a very brief time. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_cutOffVoltage
member.summary:
Returns the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw.
This setting prevents damage to a battery that can occur when drawing current from an "empty" battery.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.CUTOFFVOLTAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_overCurrentLimit
member.summary:
Returns the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state.
A zero value means that there is no limit.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.OVERCURRENTLIMIT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_overCurrentLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state.
A zero value means that there is no limit. Note that whatever the current limit is, the controller switches to OVERCURRENT status if the current goes above 32A, even for a very brief time. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_frequency(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the PWM frequency used to control the motor.
Low frequency is usually more efficient and may help the motor to start, but an audible noise might be generated. A higher frequency reduces the noise, but more energy is converted into heat. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency used to control the motor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_frequency
member.summary: Returns the PWM frequency used to control the motor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency used to control the motor

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.get_failSafeTimeout
member.summary:
Returns the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process.
When this delay has elapsed, the controller automatically stops the motor and switches to FAILSAFE error. Failsafe security is disabled when the value is zero.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.FAILSAFETIMEOUT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.set_failSafeTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process.
When this delay has elapsed, the controller automatically stops the motor and switches to FAILSAFE error. Failsafe security is disabled when the value is zero. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.FindMotor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMotor.isOnline() to test if the motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the motor, for instance MOTORCTL.motor.
member.returns: a YMotor object allowing you to drive the motor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YMotor.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.keepALive
member.summary:
Rearms the controller failsafe timer.
When the motor is running and the failsafe feature is active, this function should be called periodically to prove that the control process is running properly. Otherwise, the motor is automatically stopped after the specified timeout. Calling a motor set function implicitly rearms the failsafe timer.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.resetStatus
member.summary:
Reset the controller state to IDLE.
This function must be invoked explicitly after any error condition is signaled.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.drivingForceMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes progressively the power sent to the motor for a specific duration.
member.param: desired motor power, in percents (between -100% and +100%)
duration (in ms) of the transition
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.brakingForceMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes progressively the braking force applied to the motor for a specific duration.
member.param: desired braking force, in percents
duration (in ms) of the transition
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.nextMotor
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of motors started using yFirstMotor().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned motors order. If you want to find a specific a motor, use Motor.findMotor() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YMotor object, corresponding to a motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more motors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMotor.FirstMotor
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of motors currently accessible.
Use the method YMotor.nextMotor() to iterate on next motors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YMotor object, corresponding to the first motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

Starts all motors synchronously to reach a given absolute position.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale
member.summary:
The YMultiCellWeighScale class provides a weight measurement from a set of ratiometric sensors.
It can be used to control the bridge excitation parameters, in order to avoid measure shifts caused by temperature variation in the electronics, and can also automatically apply an additional correction factor based on temperature to compensate for offsets in the load cells themselves.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the weight.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the weight
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the number of load cells in use.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of load cells in use
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.CELLCOUNT_INVALID.

member.summary:
Changes the number of load cells in use.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the number of load cells in use
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns true if entry 4 is used as external sense for 6-wires load cells.
member.returns: either YMultiCellWeighScale.EXTERNALSENSE_FALSE or YMultiCellWeighScale.EXTERNALSENSE_TRUE, according to true if entry 4 is used as external sense for 6-wires load cells
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.EXTERNALSENSE_INVALID.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.get_excitation
member.summary: Returns the current load cell bridge excitation method.
member.returns: a value among YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_OFF, YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_DC and YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_AC corresponding to the current load cell bridge excitation method
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.set_excitation(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current load cell bridge excitation method.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_OFF, YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_DC and YMultiCellWeighScale.EXCITATION_AC corresponding to the current load cell bridge excitation method
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.set_tempAvgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.get_tempAvgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.TEMPAVGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.set_tempChgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.get_tempChgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.TEMPCHGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.get_compTempAvg
member.summary: Returns the current averaged temperature, used for thermal compensation.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current averaged temperature, used for thermal compensation
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.COMPTEMPAVG_INVALID.

member.summary: Returns the current temperature variation, used for thermal compensation.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current temperature variation, used for thermal compensation
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.COMPTEMPCHG_INVALID.

member.summary: Returns the current current thermal compensation value.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current current thermal compensation value
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.COMPENSATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.set_zeroTracking(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the zero tracking threshold value.
When this threshold is larger than zero, any measure under the threshold will automatically be ignored and the zero compensation will be updated. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the zero tracking threshold value
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiCellWeighScale.get_zeroTracking
member.summary:
Returns the zero tracking threshold value.
When this threshold is larger than zero, any measure under the threshold will automatically be ignored and the zero compensation will be updated.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the zero tracking threshold value
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.ZEROTRACKING_INVALID.

member.summary:
Retrieves a multi-cell weighing scale sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier

The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.

Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiSensController.setupAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures the I2C address of the only sensor connected to the device.
It is recommended to put the the device in maintenance mode before changing sensor addresses. This method is only intended to work with a single sensor connected to the device, if several sensors are connected, the result is unpredictable. Note that the device is probably expecting to find a string of sensors with specific addresses. Check the device documentation to find out which addresses should be used.
member.param: new address of the connected sensor
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiSensController.nextMultiSensController
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of multi-sensor controllers started using yFirstMultiSensController().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned multi-sensor controllers order. If you want to find a specific a multi-sensor controller, use MultiSensController.findMultiSensController() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YMultiSensController object, corresponding to a multi-sensor controller currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more multi-sensor controllers to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YMultiSensController.FirstMultiSensController
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of multi-sensor controllers currently accessible.
Use the method YMultiSensController.nextMultiSensController() to iterate on next multi-sensor controllers.
member.returns: a pointer to a YMultiSensController object, corresponding to the first multi-sensor controller currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

members.member: YNetwork objects provide access to TCP/IP parameters of Yoctopuce devices that include a built-in network interface.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_readiness
member.summary:
Returns the current established working mode of the network interface.
Level zero (DOWN_0) means that no hardware link has been detected. Either there is no signal on the network cable, or the selected wireless access point cannot be detected. Level 1 (LIVE_1) is reached when the network is detected, but is not yet connected. For a wireless network, this shows that the requested SSID is present. Level 2 (LINK_2) is reached when the hardware connection is established. For a wired network connection, level 2 means that the cable is attached at both ends. For a connection to a wireless access point, it shows that the security parameters are properly configured. For an ad-hoc wireless connection, it means that there is at least one other device connected on the ad-hoc network. Level 3 (DHCP_3) is reached when an IP address has been obtained using DHCP. Level 4 (DNS_4) is reached when the DNS server is reachable on the network. Level 5 (WWW_5) is reached when global connectivity is demonstrated by properly loading the current time from an NTP server.
member.returns: a value among YNetwork.READINESS_DOWN, YNetwork.READINESS_EXISTS, YNetwork.READINESS_LINKED, YNetwork.READINESS_LAN_OK and YNetwork.READINESS_WWW_OK corresponding to the current established working mode of the network interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.READINESS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_macAddress
member.summary:
Returns the MAC address of the network interface.
The MAC address is also available on a sticker on the module, in both numeric and barcode forms.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the MAC address of the network interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.MACADDRESS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_ipAddress
member.summary:
Returns the IP address currently in use by the device.
The address may have been configured statically, or provided by a DHCP server.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the IP address currently in use by the device
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.IPADDRESS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_subnetMask
member.summary: Returns the subnet mask currently used by the device.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the subnet mask currently used by the device
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.SUBNETMASK_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_router
member.summary: Returns the IP address of the router on the device subnet (default gateway).
member.returns: a string corresponding to the IP address of the router on the device subnet (default gateway)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.ROUTER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_ipConfig
member.summary:
Returns the IP configuration of the network interface.
If the network interface is setup to use a static IP address, the string starts with "STATIC:" and is followed by three parameters, separated by "/". The first is the device IP address, followed by the subnet mask length, and finally the router IP address (default gateway). For instance: "STATIC:192.168.1.14/16/192.168.1.1"
If the network interface is configured to receive its IP from a DHCP server, the string start with "DHCP:" and is followed by three parameters separated by "/". The first is the fallback IP address, then the fallback subnet mask length and finally the fallback router IP address. These three parameters are used when no DHCP reply is received.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the IP configuration of the network interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.IPCONFIG_INVALID.

When using DHCP, if a value is specified, it overrides the value received from the DHCP server. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.

member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.set_httpPort(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the the TCP port used to serve the hub web UI.
The default value is port 80, which is the default for all Web servers. Regardless of the value set here, the hub will always reply on port 4444, which is used by default by Yoctopuce API library. When you change this parameter, remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.summary:
Changes the default HTML page returned by the hub.
If not value are set the hub return "index.html" which is the web interface of the hub. It is possible to change this page for file that has been uploaded on the hub. The maximum filename size is 15 characters. When you change this parameter, remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

Changes the allowed downtime of the WWW link (in seconds) before triggering an automated reboot to try to recover Internet connectivity.
A zero value disables automated reboot in case of Internet connectivity loss. The smallest valid non-zero timeout is 90 seconds. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.get_callbackCredentials
member.summary: Returns a hashed version of the notification callback credentials if set, or an empty string otherwise.
member.returns: a string corresponding to a hashed version of the notification callback credentials if set, or an empty string otherwise
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.CALLBACKCREDENTIALS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.set_callbackCredentials(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the credentials required to connect to the callback address.
The credentials must be provided as returned by function get_callbackCredentials, in the form username:hash. The method used to compute the hash varies according to the the authentication scheme implemented by the callback, For Basic authentication, the hash is the MD5 of the string username:password. For Digest authentication, the hash is the MD5 of the string username:realm:password. For a simpler way to configure callback credentials, use function callbackLogin instead. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the credentials required to connect to the callback address
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.callbackLogin(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Connects to the notification callback and saves the credentials required to log into it.
The password is not stored into the module, only a hashed copy of the credentials are saved. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: username required to log to the callback
password required to log to the callback
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Returns the current consumed by the module from Power-over-Ethernet (PoE), in milliamps.
The current consumption is measured after converting PoE source to 5 Volt, and should never exceed 1800 mA.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current consumed by the module from Power-over-Ethernet (PoE), in milliamps
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.POECURRENT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.FindNetwork(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a network interface for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the network interface is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YNetwork.isOnline() to test if the network interface is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a network interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the network interface, for instance YHUBETH1.network.
member.returns: a YNetwork object allowing you to drive the network interface.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YNetwork.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.useDHCP(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the network interface to enable the use of an IP address received from a DHCP server.
Until an address is received from a DHCP server, the module uses the IP parameters specified to this function. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.param: fallback IP address, to be used when no DHCP reply is received
fallback subnet mask length when no DHCP reply is received, as an integer (e.g. 24 means 255.255.255.0)
fallback router IP address, to be used when no DHCP reply is received
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.useDHCPauto
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the network interface to enable the use of an IP address received from a DHCP server.
Until an address is received from a DHCP server, the module uses an IP of the network 169.254.0.0/16 (APIPA). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.useStaticIP(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the network interface to use a static IP address.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.param: device IP address
subnet mask length, as an integer (e.g. 24 means 255.255.255.0)
router IP address (default gateway)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.ping(System.String)
member.summary:
Pings host to test the network connectivity.
Sends four ICMP ECHO_REQUEST requests from the module to the target host. This method returns a string with the result of the 4 ICMP ECHO_REQUEST requests.
member.param: the hostname or the IP address of the target
member.returns: a string with the result of the ping.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.triggerCallback
member.summary:
Trigger an HTTP callback quickly.
This function can even be called within an HTTP callback, in which case the next callback will be triggered 5 seconds after the end of the current callback, regardless if the minimum time between callbacks configured in the device.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.set_periodicCallbackSchedule(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Setup periodic HTTP callbacks (simplified function).
member.param: a string representing the callback periodicity, expressed in seconds, minutes or hours, eg. "60s", "5m", "1h", "48h".
an integer representing the time offset relative to the period when the callback should occur. For instance, if the periodicity is 24h, an offset of 7 will make the callback occur each day at 7AM.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.nextNetwork
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of network interfaces started using yFirstNetwork().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned network interfaces order. If you want to find a specific a network interface, use Network.findNetwork() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YNetwork object, corresponding to a network interface currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more network interfaces to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YNetwork.FirstNetwork
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of network interfaces currently accessible.
Use the method YNetwork.nextNetwork() to iterate on next network interfaces.
member.returns: a pointer to a YNetwork object, corresponding to the first network interface currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YOsControl
member.summary:
The YOScontrol class provides some control over the operating system running a VirtualHub.
YOsControl is available on VirtualHub software only. This feature must be activated at the VirtualHub start up with -o option.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.get_shutdownCountdown
member.summary: Returns the remaining number of seconds before the OS shutdown, or zero when no shutdown has been scheduled.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the remaining number of seconds before the OS shutdown, or zero when no shutdown has been scheduled
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YOsControl.SHUTDOWNCOUNTDOWN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.FindOsControl(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves OS control for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the OS control is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YOsControl.isOnline() to test if the OS control is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for OS control by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the OS control, for instance MyDevice.osControl.
member.returns: a YOsControl object allowing you to drive the OS control.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YOsControl.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.shutdown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Schedules an OS shutdown after a given number of seconds.
member.param: number of seconds before shutdown
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.nextOsControl
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of OS control started using yFirstOsControl().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned OS control order. If you want to find a specific OS control, use OsControl.findOsControl() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YOsControl object, corresponding to OS control currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more OS control to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YOsControl.FirstOsControl
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of OS control currently accessible.
Use the method YOsControl.nextOsControl() to iterate on next OS control.
