member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "StxEtx" for ASCII messages delimited by STX/ETX codes, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Modbus-ASCII" for MODBUS messages in ASCII mode, "Modbus-RTU" for MODBUS messages in RTU mode, "Wiegand-ASCII" for Wiegand messages in ASCII mode, "Wiegand-26","Wiegand-34", etc for Wiegand messages in byte mode, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "StxEtx" for ASCII messages delimited by STX/ETX codes, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Modbus-ASCII" for MODBUS messages in ASCII mode, "Modbus-RTU" for MODBUS messages in RTU mode, "Wiegand-ASCII" for Wiegand messages in ASCII mode, "Wiegand-26","Wiegand-34", etc for Wiegand messages in byte mode, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.get_voltageLevel
member.summary: Returns the voltage level used on the serial line.
member.returns: a value among YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage level used on the serial line
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.set_voltageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage type used on the serial line.
Valid values will depend on the Yoctopuce device model featuring the serial port feature. Check your device documentation to find out which values are valid for that specific model. Trying to set an invalid value will have no effect. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage type used on the serial line
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.get_serialMode
member.summary:
Returns the serial port communication parameters, as a string such as "9600,8N1".
The string includes the baud rate, the number of data bits, the parity, and the number of stop bits. An optional suffix is included if flow control is active: "CtsRts" for hardware handshake, "XOnXOff" for logical flow control and "Simplex" for acquiring a shared bus using the RTS line (as used by some RS485 adapters for instance).
member.returns: a string corresponding to the serial port communication parameters, as a string such as "9600,8N1"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.SERIALMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.set_serialMode(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the serial port communication parameters, with a string such as "9600,8N1".
The string includes the baud rate, the number of data bits, the parity, and the number of stop bits. An optional suffix can be added to enable flow control: "CtsRts" for hardware handshake, "XOnXOff" for logical flow control and "Simplex" for acquiring a shared bus using the RTS line (as used by some RS485 adapters for instance). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the serial port communication parameters, with a string such as "9600,8N1"
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.FindSerialPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a serial port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the serial port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YSerialPort.isOnline() to test if the serial port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a serial port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the serial port, for instance RS232MK1.serialPort.
member.returns: a YSerialPort object allowing you to drive the serial port.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YSerialPort.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.uploadJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().
member.param: name of the job file to save on the device filesystem
a string containing a JSON definition of the job
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSerialPort.selectJob(System.String)

Load and start processing the specified job file.
The file must have been previously created using the user interface or uploaded on the device filesystem using the uploadJob() function.
member.param: name of the job file (on the device filesystem)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

Reads one byte from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.

member.summary:
Retrieves messages (both direction) in the serial port buffer, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
If no message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).

the relative address of the first bit/coil to read (zero-based)
the number of bits/coils to read

member.summary:
Reads one or more contiguous input bits (or discrete inputs) from a MODBUS serial device.

the relative address of the first bit/input to read (zero-based)
the number of bits/inputs to read

Sets several contiguous internal bits (or coils) on a MODBUS serial device.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YServo
member.summary:
The YServo class is designed to drive remote-control servo motors outputs.
This class allows you not only to move a servo to a given position, but also to specify the time interval in which the move should be performed. This makes it possible to synchronize two servos involved in a same move.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.get_position
member.summary: Returns the current servo position.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current servo position
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.POSITION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.set_position(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes immediately the servo driving position.
member.param: an integer corresponding to immediately the servo driving position
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the state of the RC servo motors.
member.returns: either YServo.ENABLED_FALSE or YServo.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the state of the RC servo motors
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops or starts the RC servo motor.
member.param: either YServo.ENABLED_FALSE or YServo.ENABLED_TRUE
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.get_range
member.summary: Returns the current range of use of the servo.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current range of use of the servo
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.RANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.set_range(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the range of use of the servo, specified in per cents.
A range of 100% corresponds to a standard control signal, that varies from 1 [ms] to 2 [ms], When using a servo that supports a double range, from 0.5 [ms] to 2.5 [ms], you can select a range of 200%. Be aware that using a range higher than what is supported by the servo is likely to damage the servo. Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call will have no effect.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the range of use of the servo, specified in per cents
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.get_neutral
member.summary: Returns the duration in microseconds of a neutral pulse for the servo.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the duration in microseconds of a neutral pulse for the servo
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.NEUTRAL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.set_neutral(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the duration of the pulse corresponding to the neutral position of the servo.
The duration is specified in microseconds, and the standard value is 1500 [us]. This setting makes it possible to shift the range of use of the servo. Be aware that using a range higher than what is supported by the servo is likely to damage the servo. Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call will have no effect.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the duration of the pulse corresponding to the neutral position of the servo
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a smooth move at constant speed toward a given position.
member.param: new position at the end of the move
total duration of the move, in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

Configure the servo signal generator state at power up.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.FindServo(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a RC servo motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the RC servo motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YServo.isOnline() to test if the RC servo motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a RC servo motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RC servo motor, for instance SERVORC1.servo1.
member.returns: a YServo object allowing you to drive the RC servo motor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YServo.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.nextServo
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of RC servo motors started using yFirstServo().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned RC servo motors order. If you want to find a specific a RC servo motor, use Servo.findServo() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YServo object, corresponding to a RC servo motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more RC servo motors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YServo.FirstServo
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of RC servo motors currently accessible.
Use the method YServo.nextServo() to iterate on next RC servo motors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YServo object, corresponding to the first RC servo motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YSpiPort
member.summary:
The YSpiPort class allows you to fully drive a Yoctopuce SPI port.
It can be used to send and receive data, and to configure communication parameters (baud rate, bit count, parity, flow control and protocol). Note that Yoctopuce SPI ports are not exposed as virtual COM ports. They are meant to be used in the same way as all Yoctopuce devices.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_rxCount

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_voltageLevel
member.summary: Returns the voltage level used on the serial line.
member.returns: a value among YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage level used on the serial line
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.set_voltageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage type used on the serial line.
Valid values will depend on the Yoctopuce device model featuring the serial port feature. Check your device documentation to find out which values are valid for that specific model. Trying to set an invalid value will have no effect. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage type used on the serial line
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_spiMode
member.summary:
Returns the SPI port communication parameters, as a string such as "125000,0,msb".
The string includes the baud rate, the SPI mode (between 0 and 3) and the bit order.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the SPI port communication parameters, as a string such as "125000,0,msb"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.SPIMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.set_spiMode(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the SPI port communication parameters, with a string such as "125000,0,msb".
The string includes the baud rate, the SPI mode (between 0 and 3) and the bit order. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the SPI port communication parameters, with a string such as "125000,0,msb"
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_ssPolarity
member.summary: Returns the SS line polarity.
member.returns: either YSpiPort.SSPOLARITY_ACTIVE_LOW or YSpiPort.SSPOLARITY_ACTIVE_HIGH, according to the SS line polarity
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.SSPOLARITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.set_ssPolarity(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the SS line polarity.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YSpiPort.SSPOLARITY_ACTIVE_LOW or YSpiPort.SSPOLARITY_ACTIVE_HIGH, according to the SS line polarity
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.get_shiftSampling
member.summary: Returns true when the SDI line phase is shifted with regards to the SDO line.
member.returns: either YSpiPort.SHIFTSAMPLING_OFF or YSpiPort.SHIFTSAMPLING_ON, according to true when the SDI line phase is shifted with regards to the SDO line
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.SHIFTSAMPLING_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.set_shiftSampling(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the SDI line sampling shift.
When disabled, SDI line is sampled in the middle of data output time. When enabled, SDI line is samples at the end of data output time. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YSpiPort.SHIFTSAMPLING_OFF or YSpiPort.SHIFTSAMPLING_ON, according to the SDI line sampling shift
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.FindSpiPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a SPI port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the SPI port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YSpiPort.isOnline() to test if the SPI port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a SPI port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the SPI port, for instance YSPIMK01.spiPort.
member.returns: a YSpiPort object allowing you to drive the SPI port.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YSpiPort.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.uploadJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().
member.param: name of the job file to save on the device filesystem
a string containing a JSON definition of the job
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.selectJob(System.String)
member.summary:
Load and start processing the specified job file.
The file must have been previously created using the user interface or uploaded on the device filesystem using the uploadJob() function.
member.param: name of the job file (on the device filesystem)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.readByte
member.summary:
Reads one byte from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, or if there is no data available yet, the function returns YAPI.NO_MORE_DATA.
member.returns: the next byte
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.readStr(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a string, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of characters to read
member.returns: a string with receive buffer contents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.readBin(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a binary buffer, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to read
member.returns: a binary object with receive buffer contents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a list of bytes, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to read

If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.

member.summary:

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.nextSpiPort
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of SPI ports started using yFirstSpiPort().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned SPI ports order. If you want to find a specific a SPI port, use SpiPort.findSpiPort() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YSpiPort object, corresponding to a SPI port currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more SPI ports to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YSpiPort.FirstSpiPort
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of SPI ports currently accessible.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.set_stepPos(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the current logical motor position, measured in steps.
This command does not cause any motor move, as its purpose is only to setup the origin of the position counter. The fractional part of the position, that corresponds to the physical position of the rotor, is not changed. To trigger a motor move, use methods moveTo() or moveRel() instead.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the current logical motor position, measured in steps
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Returns the current logical motor position, measured in steps.
The value may include a fractional part when micro-stepping is in use.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.STEPPOS_INVALID.

member.param: an integer corresponding to the torque regulation current when the motor is running, measured in mA
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.get_auxSignal
member.summary: Returns the current value of the signal generated on the auxiliary output.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current value of the signal generated on the auxiliary output
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.AUXSIGNAL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.set_auxSignal(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the value of the signal generated on the auxiliary output.
Acceptable values depend on the auxiliary output signal type configured.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the value of the signal generated on the auxiliary output
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.FindStepperMotor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a stepper motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the stepper motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YStepperMotor.isOnline() to test if the stepper motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a stepper motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the stepper motor, for instance MyDevice.stepperMotor1.
member.returns: a YStepperMotor object allowing you to drive the stepper motor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.reset
member.summary: Reinitialize the controller and clear all alert flags.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.findHomePosition(System.Double)
member.summary: Starts the motor backward at the specified speed, to search for the motor home position.
member.param: desired speed, in steps per second.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.changeSpeed(System.Double)
member.summary:
Starts the motor at a given speed.
The time needed to reach the requested speed will depend on the acceleration parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: desired speed, in steps per second. The minimal non-zero speed is 0.001 pulse per second.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.moveTo(System.Double)
member.summary:
Starts the motor to reach a given absolute position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration and max speed parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: absolute position, measured in steps from the origin.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.moveRel(System.Double)
member.summary:
Starts the motor to reach a given relative position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration and max speed parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: relative position, measured in steps from the current position.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.moveRelSlow(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Starts the motor to reach a given relative position, keeping the speed under the specified limit.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: relative position, measured in steps from the current position.
limit speed, in steps per second.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.pause(System.Int32)
member.summary: Keep the motor in the same state for the specified amount of time, before processing next command.
member.param: wait time, specified in milliseconds.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.emergencyStop
member.summary: Stops the motor with an emergency alert, without taking any additional precaution.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.alertStepOut
member.summary:
Move one step in the direction opposite the direction set when the most recent alert was raised.
The move occurs even if the system is still in alert mode (end switch depressed). Caution. use this function with great care as it may cause mechanical damages !
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.alertStepDir(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Move one single step in the selected direction without regards to end switches.
The move occurs even if the system is still in alert mode (end switch depressed). Caution. use this function with great care as it may cause mechanical damages !
member.param: Value +1 or -1, according to the desired direction of the move
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.abortAndBrake
member.summary: Stops the motor smoothly as soon as possible, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.abortAndHiZ
member.summary: Turn the controller into Hi-Z mode immediately, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.nextStepperMotor
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of stepper motors started using yFirstStepperMotor().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned stepper motors order. If you want to find a specific a stepper motor, use StepperMotor.findStepperMotor() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YStepperMotor object, corresponding to a stepper motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more stepper motors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YStepperMotor.FirstStepperMotor
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of stepper motors currently accessible.
Use the method YStepperMotor.nextStepperMotor() to iterate on next stepper motors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YStepperMotor object, corresponding to the first stepper motor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YTemperature
member.summary:
The YTemperature class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce temperature sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure some specific parameters for some sensors (connection type, temperature mapping table).

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured temperature.
That unit is a string. If that strings end with the letter F all temperatures values will returned in Fahrenheit degrees. If that String ends with the letter K all values will be returned in Kelvin degrees. If that string ends with the letter C all values will be returned in Celsius degrees. If the string ends with any other character the change will be ignored. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept. WARNING: if a specific calibration is defined for the temperature function, a unit system change will probably break it.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured temperature
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.get_sensorType
member.summary: Returns the temperature sensor type.
member.returns: a value among YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_DIGITAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_K, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_E, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_J, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_N, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_R, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_S, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_T, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_4WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_3WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_2WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_OHM, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_NTC, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_LINEAR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_INTERNAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_IR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_PT1000 and YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_CHANNEL_OFF corresponding to the temperature sensor type
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.set_sensorType(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the temperature sensor type.
This function is used to define the type of thermocouple (K,E...) used with the device. It has no effect if module is using a digital sensor or a thermistor. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_DIGITAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_K, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_E, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_J, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_N, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_R, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_S, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_T, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_4WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_3WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_2WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_OHM, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_NTC, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_LINEAR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_INTERNAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_IR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_PT1000 and YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_CHANNEL_OFF corresponding to the temperature sensor type
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.get_signalValue
member.summary: Returns the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SIGNALVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.get_signalUnit
member.summary: Returns the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SIGNALUNIT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.FindTemperature(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a temperature sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the temperature sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YTemperature.isOnline() to test if the temperature sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a temperature sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the temperature sensor, for instance METEOMK2.temperature.
member.returns: a YTemperature object allowing you to drive the temperature sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YTemperature.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YTemperature.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.set_ntcParameters(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Configures NTC thermistor parameters in order to properly compute the temperature from the measured resistance.
For increased precision, you can enter a complete mapping table using set_thermistorResponseTable. This function can only be used with a temperature sensor based on thermistors.
member.param: thermistor resistance at 25 degrees Celsius
Beta value
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.set_thermistorResponseTable(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double})
member.summary:
Records a thermistor response table, in order to interpolate the temperature from the measured resistance.
This function can only be used with a temperature sensor based on thermistors.
member.param: array of floating point numbers, corresponding to all temperatures (in degrees Celsius) for which the resistance of the thermistor is specified.
array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the resistance values (in Ohms) for each of the temperature included in the first argument, index by index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.loadThermistorResponseTable(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double})
member.summary:
Retrieves the thermistor response table previously configured using the set_thermistorResponseTable function.
This function can only be used with a temperature sensor based on thermistors.
member.param: array of floating point numbers, that is filled by the function with all temperatures (in degrees Celsius) for which the resistance of the thermistor is specified.
array of floating point numbers, that is filled by the function with the value (in Ohms) for each of the temperature included in the first argument, index by index.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.nextTemperature
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of temperature sensors started using yFirstTemperature().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned temperature sensors order. If you want to find a specific a temperature sensor, use Temperature.findTemperature() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YTemperature object, corresponding to a temperature sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more temperature sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTemperature.FirstTemperature
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of temperature sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YTemperature.nextTemperature() to iterate on next temperature sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YTemperature object, corresponding to the first temperature sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YTilt
member.summary:
The YSensor class is the parent class for all Yoctopuce sensor types.
It can be used to read the current value and unit of any sensor, read the min/max value, configure autonomous recording frequency and access recorded data. It also provide a function to register a callback invoked each time the observed value changes, or at a predefined interval. Using this class rather than a specific subclass makes it possible to create generic applications that work with any Yoctopuce sensor, even those that do not yet exist. Note: The YAnButton class is the only analog input which does not inherit from YSensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTilt.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.FindTilt(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a tilt sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the tilt sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YTilt.isOnline() to test if the tilt sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a tilt sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the tilt sensor, for instance Y3DMK002.tilt1.
member.returns: a YTilt object allowing you to drive the tilt sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YTilt.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YTilt.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.calibrateToZero
member.summary:
Performs a zero calibration for the tilt measurement (Yocto-Inclinometer only).
When this method is invoked, a simple shift (translation) is applied so that the current position is reported as a zero angle. Be aware that this shift will also affect the measurement boundaries.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.restoreZeroCalibration
member.summary:
Cancels any previous zero calibration for the tilt measurement (Yocto-Inclinometer only).
This function restores the factory zero calibration.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.nextTilt
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of tilt sensors started using yFirstTilt().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned tilt sensors order. If you want to find a specific a tilt sensor, use Tilt.findTilt() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YTilt object, corresponding to a tilt sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more tilt sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YTilt.FirstTilt
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of tilt sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YTilt.nextTilt() to iterate on next tilt sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YTilt object, corresponding to the first tilt sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YVoltage
member.summary:
The YVoltage class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce voltage sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YVoltage.ENABLED_FALSE or YVoltage.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YVoltage.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this voltage input.
When AC measurements are disabled, the device will always assume a DC signal, and vice-versa. When both AC and DC measurements are active, the device switches between AC and DC mode based on the relative amplitude of variations compared to the average value. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YVoltage.ENABLED_FALSE or YVoltage.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this voltage input
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.FindVoltage(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a voltage sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the voltage sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YVoltage.isOnline() to test if the voltage sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a voltage sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the voltage sensor, for instance MOTORCTL.voltage.
member.returns: a YVoltage object allowing you to drive the voltage sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.registerValueCallback(YoctoLib.YVoltage.ValueCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.registerTimedReportCallback(YoctoLib.YVoltage.TimedReportCallback)
member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every periodic timed notification.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and an YMeasure object describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.nextVoltage
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of voltage sensors started using yFirstVoltage().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned voltage sensors order. If you want to find a specific a voltage sensor, use Voltage.findVoltage() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YVoltage object, corresponding to a voltage sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more voltage sensors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltage.FirstVoltage
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of voltage sensors currently accessible.
Use the method YVoltage.nextVoltage() to iterate on next voltage sensors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YVoltage object, corresponding to the first voltage sensor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YVoltageOutput
member.summary: The YVoltageOutput class allows you to drive a voltage output.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltageOutput.set_currentVoltage(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the output voltage, in V.
Valid range is from 0 to 10V.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the output voltage, in V
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the output voltage set point, in V.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the output voltage set point, in V

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltageOutput.set_voltageAtStartUp(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the output voltage at device start up.
Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call has no effect.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the output voltage at device start up
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltageOutput.get_voltageAtStartUp

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YVoltageOutput.VOLTAGEATSTARTUP_INVALID.

Retrieves a voltage output for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:

- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier

This function does not require that the voltage output is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YVoltageOutput.isOnline() to test if the voltage output is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a voltage output by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.

member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YVoltageOutput.voltageMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth transition of output voltage.
Any explicit voltage change cancels any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new output voltage value at the end of the transition (floating-point number, representing the end voltage in V)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS when the call succeeds.

member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of voltage outputs started using yFirstVoltageOutput().

Retrieves a wake-up monitor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName

In case of ambiguity when looking for a wake-up monitor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.

member.summary:
Registers the callback function that is invoked on every change of advertised value.
The callback is invoked only during the execution of ySleep or yHandleEvents. This provides control over the time when the callback is triggered. For good responsiveness, remember to call one of these two functions periodically. To unregister a callback, pass a null pointer as argument.
member.param: the callback function to call, or a null pointer. The callback function should take two arguments: the function object of which the value has changed, and the character string describing the new advertised value. @noreturn

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.wakeUp
member.summary: Forces a wake up.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Goes to sleep until the next wake up condition is met, the RTC time must have been set before calling this function.
member.param: number of seconds before going into sleep mode,
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.sleepFor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Goes to sleep for a specific duration or until the next wake up condition is met, the RTC time must have been set before calling this function.
The count down before sleep can be canceled with resetSleepCountDown.
member.param: number of seconds before next wake up
number of seconds before going into sleep mode
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.sleepUntil(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Go to sleep until a specific date is reached or until the next wake up condition is met, the RTC time must have been set before calling this function.
The count down before sleep can be canceled with resetSleepCountDown.
member.param: wake-up datetime (UNIX format)
number of seconds before going into sleep mode
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.resetSleepCountDown
member.summary: Resets the sleep countdown.
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.nextWakeUpMonitor
member.summary:
Continues the enumeration of wake-up monitors started using yFirstWakeUpMonitor().
Caution: You can't make any assumption about the returned wake-up monitors order. If you want to find a specific a wake-up monitor, use WakeUpMonitor.findWakeUpMonitor() and a hardwareID or a logical name.
member.returns: a pointer to a YWakeUpMonitor object, corresponding to a wake-up monitor currently online, or a null pointer if there are no more wake-up monitors to enumerate.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWakeUpMonitor.FirstWakeUpMonitor
member.summary:
Starts the enumeration of wake-up monitors currently accessible.
Use the method YWakeUpMonitor.nextWakeUpMonitor() to iterate on next wake-up monitors.
member.returns: a pointer to a YWakeUpMonitor object, corresponding to the first wake-up monitor currently online, or a null pointer if there are none.

member.name: T:YoctoLib.YWatchdog
member.summary:
The YWatchdog class allows you to drive a Yoctopuce watchdog.
A watchdog works like a relay, with an extra timer that can automatically trigger a brief power cycle to an appliance after a preset delay, to force this appliance to reset if a problem occurs. During normal use, the watchdog timer is reset periodically by the application to prevent the automated power cycle. Whenever the application dies, the watchdog will automatically trigger the power cycle. The watchdog can also be driven directly with pulse and delayedPulse methods to switch off an appliance for a given duration.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.get_state
member.summary: Returns the state of the watchdog (A for the idle position, B for the active position).
member.returns: either YWatchdog.STATE_A or YWatchdog.STATE_B, according to the state of the watchdog (A for the idle position, B for the active position)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWatchdog.STATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.set_state(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the state of the watchdog (A for the idle position, B for the active position).
member.param: either YWatchdog.STATE_A or YWatchdog.STATE_B, according to the state of the watchdog (A for the idle position, B for the active position)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.get_stateAtPowerOn
member.summary: Returns the state of the watchdog at device startup (A for the idle position, B for the active position, UNCHANGED to leave the relay state as is).
member.returns: a value among YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_UNCHANGED, YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_A and YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_B corresponding to the state of the watchdog at device startup (A for the idle position, B for the active position, UNCHANGED to leave the relay state as is)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.set_stateAtPowerOn(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the state of the watchdog at device startup (A for the idle position, B for the active position, UNCHANGED to leave the relay state as is).
Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call will have no effect.
member.param: a value among YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_UNCHANGED, YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_A and YWatchdog.STATEATPOWERON_B corresponding to the state of the watchdog at device startup (A for the idle position, B for the active position, UNCHANGED to leave the relay state as is)
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.get_maxTimeOnStateA
member.summary:
Returns the maximum time (ms) allowed for the watchdog to stay in state A before automatically switching back in to B state.
Zero means no time limit.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the maximum time (ms) allowed for the watchdog to stay in state A before automatically switching back in to B state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWatchdog.MAXTIMEONSTATEA_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.set_maxTimeOnStateA(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Changes the maximum time (ms) allowed for the watchdog to stay in state A before automatically switching back in to B state.
Use zero for no time limit. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the maximum time (ms) allowed for the watchdog to stay in state A before automatically switching back in to B state
member.returns: YAPI.SUCCESS if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.get_maxTimeOnStateB
member.summary:
Retourne the maximum time (ms) allowed for the watchdog to stay in state B before automatically switching back in to A state.
Zero means no time limit.
member.returns: an integer
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWatchdog.MAXTIMEONSTATEB_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoLib.YWatchdog.set_maxTimeOnStateB(System.Int64)
member.summary:
