member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YBuzzerProxy
member.summary:
The YBuzzer class allows you to drive a buzzer.
You can choose the frequency and the volume at which the buzzer must sound. You can also pre-program a play sequence.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YBuzzerProxy.FindBuzzer(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a buzzer for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the buzzer is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YBuzzer.isOnline() to test if the buzzer is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a buzzer by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the buzzer, for instance YBUZZER2.buzzer.
member.returns: a YBuzzer object allowing you to drive the buzzer.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YBuzzerProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Buzzer available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YBuzzer.FindBuzzer to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.

member.summary:
Adds notes to the playing sequence.
Notes are provided as text words, separated by spaces. The pitch is specified using the usual letter from A to G. The duration is specified as the divisor of a whole note: 4 for a fourth, 8 for an eight note, etc. Some modifiers are supported: # and b to alter a note pitch, ' and , to move to the upper/lower octave, . to enlarge the note duration.
member.param: notes to be played, as a text string.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy
member.summary:
The YCarbonDioxide class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce CO2 sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to perform manual calibration if required.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.FindCarbonDioxide(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a CO2 sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the CO2 sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCarbonDioxide.isOnline() to test if the CO2 sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a CO2 sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the CO2 sensor, for instance YCO2MK02.carbonDioxide.
member.returns: a YCarbonDioxide object allowing you to drive the CO2 sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type CarbonDioxide available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YCarbonDioxide.FindCarbonDioxide to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.get_abcPeriod
member.summary:
Returns the Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours.
A negative value means that automatic baseline calibration is disabled.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCarbonDioxide.ABCPERIOD_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.set_abcPeriod(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours.
If you need to disable automatic baseline calibration (for instance when using the sensor in an environment that is constantly above 400 ppm CO2), set the period to -1. For the Yocto-CO2-V2, the only possible values are 24 and -1. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.AbcPeriod
member.value: Automatic Baseline Calibration period, in hours. A negative value

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.triggerForcedCalibration(System.Double)
member.summary:
Triggers a forced calibration of the sensor at a given CO2 level, specified between 400ppm and 2000ppm.
Before invoking this command, the sensor must have been maintained within the specified CO2 density during at least two minutes.
member.param: reference CO2 density for the calibration
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.triggerBaselineCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers a baseline calibration at standard CO2 ambiant level (400ppm).
It is normally not necessary to manually calibrate the sensor, because the built-in automatic baseline calibration procedure will automatically fix any long-term drift based on the lowest level of CO2 observed over the automatic calibration period. However, if automatic baseline calibration is disabled, you may want to manually trigger a calibration from time to time. Before starting a baseline calibration, make sure to put the sensor in a standard environment (e.g. outside in fresh air) at around 400 ppm for at least two minutes.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCarbonDioxideProxy.triggerZeroCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers a zero calibration of the sensor on carbon dioxide-free air - for use with first generation Yocto-CO2 only.
It is normally not necessary to manually calibrate the sensor, because the built-in automatic baseline calibration procedure will automatically fix any long-term drift based on the lowest level of CO2 observed over the automatic calibration period. However, if you disable automatic baseline calibration, you may want to manually trigger a calibration from time to time. Before starting a zero calibration, you should circulate carbon dioxide-free air within the sensor for a minute or two, using a small pipe connected to the sensor. Please contact support@yoctopuce.com for more details on the zero calibration procedure.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy
member.summary:
The YCellular class provides control over cellular network parameters and status for devices that are GSM-enabled.
Note that TCP/IP parameters are configured separately, using class YNetwork.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.FindCellular(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a cellular interface for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the cellular interface is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCellular.isOnline() to test if the cellular interface is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a cellular interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the cellular interface, for instance YHUBGSM1.cellular.
member.returns: a YCellular object allowing you to drive the cellular interface.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Cellular available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YCellular.FindCellular to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.CELLTYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.get_imsi
member.summary:
Returns the International Mobile Subscriber Identity (MSI) that uniquely identifies the SIM card.
The first 3 digits represent the mobile country code (MCC), which is followed by the mobile network code (MNC), either 2-digit (European standard) or 3-digit (North American standard)
member.returns: a string corresponding to the International Mobile Subscriber Identity (MSI) that uniquely identifies the SIM card
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.IMSI_INVALID.

member.summary: Returns the latest status message from the wireless interface.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the latest status message from the wireless interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.MESSAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.get_pin
member.summary: Returns an opaque string if a PIN code has been configured in the device to access the SIM card, or an empty string if none has been configured or if the code provided was rejected by the SIM card.
member.returns: a string corresponding to an opaque string if a PIN code has been configured in the device to access the SIM card, or an empty string if none has been configured or if the code provided was rejected by the SIM card
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.PIN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.set_pin(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the PIN code used by the module to access the SIM card.
This function does not change the code on the SIM card itself, but only changes the parameter used by the device to try to get access to it. If the SIM code does not work immediately on first try, it will be automatically forgotten and the message will be set to "Enter SIM PIN". The method should then be invoked again with right correct PIN code. After three failed attempts in a row, the message is changed to "Enter SIM PUK" and the SIM card PUK code must be provided using method sendPUK.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module to save the new value in the device flash.
member.param: a string corresponding to the PIN code used by the module to access the SIM card
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.Pin
member.value: N opaque string if a PIN code has been configured in the device to access

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.get_radioConfig
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.RADIOCONFIG_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.set_radioConfig(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.RadioConfig
member.value: Type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.

member.returns: a string corresponding to the name of the only cell operator to use if automatic choice is disabled, or an empty string if the SIM card will automatically choose among available cell operators
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.LOCKEDOPERATOR_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.set_lockedOperator(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the name of the cell operator to be used.
If the name is an empty string, the choice will be made automatically based on the SIM card. Otherwise, the selected operator is the only one that will be used. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Returns the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS).
When data services are disabled, SMS are the only mean of communication.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCellular.ENABLEDATA_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.set_enableData(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS).
The service can be either fully deactivated, or limited to the SIM home network, or enabled for all partner networks (roaming). Caution: enabling data services on roaming networks may cause prohibitive communication costs !
When data services are disabled, SMS are the only mean of communication. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YCellular.ENABLEDATA_HOMENETWORK, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_ROAMING, YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEVER and YCellular.ENABLEDATA_NEUTRALITY corresponding to the condition for enabling IP data services (GPRS)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.sendPUK(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a PUK code to unlock the SIM card after three failed PIN code attempts, and setup a new PIN into the SIM card.
Only ten consecutive tentatives are permitted: after that, the SIM card will be blocked permanently without any mean of recovery to use it again. Note that after calling this method, you have usually to invoke method set_pin() to tell the YoctoHub which PIN to use in the future.
member.param: the SIM PUK code
new PIN code to configure into the SIM card
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Configure authentication parameters to connect to the APN.
Both PAP and CHAP authentication are supported.

APN password
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy._AT(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends an AT command to the GSM module and returns the command output.
The command will only execute when the GSM module is in standard command state, and should leave it in the exact same state. Use this function with great care !
member.param: the AT command to execute, like for instance: "+CCLK?".
member.returns: a string with the result of the commands. Empty lines are automatically removed from the output.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.get_availableOperators
member.summary:
Returns the list detected cell operators in the neighborhood.
This function will typically take between 30 seconds to 1 minute to return. Note that any SIM card can usually only connect to specific operators. All networks returned by this function might therefore not be available for connection.
member.returns: a list of string (cell operator names).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.quickCellSurvey
member.summary:
Returns a list of nearby cellular antennas, as required for quick geolocation of the device.
The first cell listed is the serving cell, and the next ones are the neighbor cells reported by the serving cell.
member.returns: a list of YCellRecords.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellularProxy.decodePLMN(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cell operator brand for a given MCC/MNC pair.
member.param: a string starting with a MCC code followed by a MNC code,
member.returns: a string containing the corresponding cell operator brand name.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedProxy
member.summary:
The ColorLed class allows you to drive a color LED.
The color can be specified using RGB coordinates as well as HSL coordinates. The module performs all conversions form RGB to HSL automatically. It is then self-evident to turn on a LED with a given hue and to progressively vary its saturation or lightness. If needed, you can find more information on the difference between RGB and HSL in the section following this one.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedProxy.FindColorLed(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves an RGB LED for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the RGB LED is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YColorLed.isOnline() to test if the RGB LED is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an RGB LED by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RGB LED, for instance YRGBLED2.colorLed1.
member.returns: a YColorLed object allowing you to drive the RGB LED.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type ColorLed available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YColorLed.FindColorLed to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary: Returns the current RGB color of the LED.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current RGB color of the LED
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YColorLed.RGBCOLOR_INVALID.

member.summary:
Changes the current color of the LED, using an RGB color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xRRGGBB.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the current color of the LED, using an RGB color
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedProxy.HslColor

duration of the color transition, in milliseconds.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy
member.summary:
The YColorLedCluster class allows you to drive a color LED cluster.
Unlike the ColorLed class, the YColorLedCluster class allows to handle several LEDs at once. Color changes can be done using RGB coordinates as well as HSL coordinates. The module performs all conversions form RGB to HSL automatically. It is then self-evident to turn on a LED with a given hue and to progressively vary its saturation or lightness. If needed, you can find more information on the difference between RGB and HSL in the section following this one.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.FindColorLedCluster(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a RGB LED cluster for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the RGB LED cluster is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YColorLedCluster.isOnline() to test if the RGB LED cluster is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a RGB LED cluster by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RGB LED cluster, for instance YRGBLED2.colorLedCluster.
member.returns: a YColorLedCluster object allowing you to drive the RGB LED cluster.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type ColorLedCluster available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YColorLedCluster.FindColorLedCluster to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.set_rgbColor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current color of consecutive LEDs in the cluster, using a RGB color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xRRGGBB.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Changes the color at device startup of consecutive LEDs in the cluster, using a RGB color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xRRGGBB. Don't forget to call saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn() to make sure the modification is saved in the device flash memory.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.set_hslColorAtPowerOn(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the color at device startup of consecutive LEDs in the cluster, using a HSL color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xHHSSLL. Don't forget to call saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn() to make sure the modification is saved in the device flash memory.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.set_hslColor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current color of consecutive LEDs in the cluster, using a HSL color.
Encoding is done as follows: 0xHHSSLL.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.rgb_move(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the current color of a group of adjacent LEDs to another color, in a seamless and autonomous manner.
The transition is performed in the RGB space.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color (0xRRGGBB).
transition duration in ms
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.hsl_move(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the current color of a group of adjacent LEDs to another color, in a seamless and autonomous manner.
The transition is performed in the HSL space. In HSL, hue is a circular value (0..360). There are always two paths to perform the transition: by increasing or by decreasing the hue. The module selects the shortest transition. If the difference is exactly 180, the module selects the transition which increases the hue.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
new color (0xHHSSLL).
transition duration in ms
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.addRgbMoveToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds an RGB transition to a sequence.
A sequence is a transition list, which can be executed in loop by a group of LEDs. Sequences are persistent and are saved in the device flash memory as soon as the saveBlinkSeq() method is called.
member.param: sequence index.
target color (0xRRGGBB)
transition duration in ms
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.addHslMoveToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds an HSL transition to a sequence.
A sequence is a transition list, which can be executed in loop by an group of LEDs. Sequences are persistent and are saved in the device flash memory as soon as the saveBlinkSeq() method is called.
member.param: sequence index.
target color (0xHHSSLL)
transition duration in ms
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.addMirrorToBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a mirror ending to a sequence.
When the sequence will reach the end of the last transition, its running speed will automatically be reversed so that the sequence plays in the reverse direction, like in a mirror. After the first transition of the sequence is played at the end of the reverse execution, the sequence starts again in the initial direction.
member.param: sequence index.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.addJumpToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds to a sequence a jump to another sequence.
When a pixel will reach this jump, it will be automatically relinked to the new sequence, and will run it starting from the beginning.
member.param: sequence index.
index of the sequence to chain.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.addUnlinkToBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a to a sequence a hard stop code.
When a pixel will reach this stop code, instead of restarting the sequence in a loop it will automatically be unlinked from the sequence.
member.param: sequence index.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.linkLedToBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence.
These LEDs start to execute the sequence as soon as startBlinkSeq is called. It is possible to add an offset in the execution: that way we can have several groups of LED executing the same sequence, with a temporal offset. A LED cannot be linked to more than one sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
execution offset in ms.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.linkLedToBlinkSeqAtPowerOn(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence at device power-on.
Don't forget to configure the sequence auto start flag as well and call saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn(). It is possible to add an offset in the execution: that way we can have several groups of LEDs executing the same sequence, with a temporal offset. A LED cannot be linked to more than one sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
execution offset in ms.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.linkLedToPeriodicBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Links adjacent LEDs to a specific sequence.
These LED start to execute the sequence as soon as startBlinkSeq is called. This function automatically introduces a shift between LEDs so that the specified number of sequence periods appears on the group of LEDs (wave effect).
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
sequence index.
number of periods to show on LEDs.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.unlinkLedFromBlinkSeq(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unlinks adjacent LEDs from a sequence.
member.param: index of the first affected LED.
affected LED count.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.startBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts a sequence execution: every LED linked to that sequence starts to run it in a loop.
Note that a sequence with a zero duration can't be started.
member.param: index of the sequence to start.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.stopBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stops a sequence execution.
If started again, the execution restarts from the beginning.
member.param: index of the sequence to stop.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.resetBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stops a sequence execution and resets its contents.
LEDs linked to this sequence are not automatically updated anymore.
member.param: index of the sequence to reset
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.set_blinkSeqStateAtPowerOn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures a sequence to make it start automatically at device startup.
Note that a sequence with a zero duration can't be started. Don't forget to call saveBlinkSeq() to make sure the modification is saved in the device flash memory.
member.param: index of the sequence to reset.
0 to keep the sequence turned off and 1 to start it automatically.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.set_blinkSeqSpeed(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the execution speed of a sequence.
The natural execution speed is 1000 per thousand. If you configure a slower speed, you can play the sequence in slow-motion. If you set a negative speed, you can play the sequence in reverse direction.
member.param: index of the sequence to start.
sequence running speed (-1000...1000).
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn
member.summary:
Saves the LEDs power-on configuration.
This includes the start-up color or sequence binding for all LEDs. Warning: if some LEDs are linked to a sequence, the method saveBlinkSeq() must also be called to save the sequence definition.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YColorLedClusterProxy.saveBlinkSeq(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Saves the definition of a sequence.
Warning: only sequence steps and flags are saved. to save the LEDs startup bindings, the method saveLedsConfigAtPowerOn() must be called.
member.param: index of the sequence to start.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy
member.summary:
The YCompass class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce compass functions.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.FindCompass(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a compass function for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the compass function is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCompass.isOnline() to test if the compass function is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a compass function by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the compass function, for instance Y3DMK002.compass.
member.returns: a YCompass object allowing you to drive the compass function.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Compass available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YCompass.FindCompass to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCompass.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.Bandwidth
member.value: Measure update frequency, measured in Hz.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCompassProxy.get_magneticHeading
member.summary: Returns the magnetic heading, regardless of the configured bearing.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the magnetic heading, regardless of the configured bearing
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCompass.MAGNETICHEADING_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy
member.summary:
The YCurrent class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce current sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy.FindCurrent(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a current sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the current sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCurrent.isOnline() to test if the current sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a current sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the current sensor, for instance YAMPMK01.current1.
member.returns: a YCurrent object allowing you to drive the current sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Current available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YCurrent.FindCurrent to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YCurrent.ENABLED_FALSE or YCurrent.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrent.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this voltage input.
When AC measurements are disabled, the device will always assume a DC signal, and vice-versa. When both AC and DC measurements are active, the device switches between AC and DC mode based on the relative amplitude of variations compared to the average value. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YCurrent.ENABLED_FALSE or YCurrent.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this voltage input
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentProxy.Enabled
member.value: Activation state of this input.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy
member.summary:
The YCurrentLoopOutput class allows you to drive a 4-20mA output by regulating the current flowing through the current loop.
It can also provide information about the power state of the current loop.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.FindCurrentLoopOutput(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a 4-20mA output for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the 4-20mA output is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YCurrentLoopOutput.isOnline() to test if the 4-20mA output is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a 4-20mA output by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the 4-20mA output, for instance TX420MA1.currentLoopOutput.
member.returns: a YCurrentLoopOutput object allowing you to drive the 4-20mA output.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type CurrentLoopOutput available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YCurrentLoopOutput.FindCurrentLoopOutput to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.set_current(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the current loop, the valid range is from 3 to 21mA.
If the loop is not properly powered, the target current is not reached and loopPower is set to LOWPWR.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the current loop, the valid range is from 3 to 21mA
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.get_current
member.summary: Returns the loop current set point in mA.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the loop current set point in mA
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.CURRENT_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.Current
member.value: Loop current set point in mA.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.LoopPower
member.value: POWEROK when the loop is powered, NOPWR when the loop is not powered, LOWPWR when the loop is not powered enough to maintain requested current.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.set_currentAtStartUp(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the loop current at device start up.
Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call has no effect.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the loop current at device start up
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.get_currentAtStartUp
member.summary: Returns the current in the loop at device startup, in mA.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current in the loop at device startup, in mA
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.CURRENTATSTARTUP_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.CurrentAtStartUp
member.value: Current in the loop at device startup, in mA.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.get_loopPower
member.summary:
Returns the loop powerstate.
POWEROK: the loop is powered. NOPWR: the loop in not powered. LOWPWR: the loop is not powered enough to maintain the current required (insufficient voltage).
member.returns: a value among YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_NOPWR, YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_LOWPWR and YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_POWEROK corresponding to the loop powerstate
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YCurrentLoopOutput.LOOPPOWER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCurrentLoopOutputProxy.currentMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth transition of current flowing in the loop.
Any current explicit change cancels any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new current value at the end of the transition (floating-point number, representing the end current in mA)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.

Changes the number of child nodes expected in normal conditions.
If the value is zero, no check is performed. If it is non-zero, the number child nodes is checked on startup and the status will change to error if the count does not match. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YDataLoggerProxy
member.summary:
A non-volatile memory for storing ongoing measured data is available on most Yoctopuce sensors.
Recording can happen automatically, without requiring a permanent connection to a computer. The YDataLogger class controls the global parameters of the internal data logger. Recording control (start/stop) as well as data retreival is done at sensor objects level.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDataLoggerProxy.FindDataLogger(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a data logger for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the data logger is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDataLogger.isOnline() to test if the data logger is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a data logger by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the data logger, for instance LIGHTMK3.dataLogger.
member.returns: a YDataLogger object allowing you to drive the data logger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDataLoggerProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type DataLogger available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YDataLogger.FindDataLogger to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary: Returns the current run number, corresponding to the number of times the module was powered on with the dataLogger enabled at some point.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current run number, corresponding to the number of times the module was powered on with the dataLogger enabled at some point
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDataLogger.CURRENTRUNINDEX_INVALID.

This method also resets the current run index to zero.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDataLoggerProxy.get_dataSets
member.summary:
Returns a list of YDataSet objects that can be used to retrieve all measures stored by the data logger.
This function only works if the device uses a recent firmware, as YDataSet objects are not supported by firmwares older than version 13000.
member.returns: a list of YDataSet object.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy
member.summary:
The YDigitalIO class allows you drive a Yoctopuce digital input/output port.
It can be used to setup the direction of each channel, to read the state of each channel and to switch the state of each channel configures as an output. You can work on all channels at once, or one by one. Most functions use a binary representation for channels where bit 0 matches channel #0 , bit 1 matches channel #1 and so on. If you are not familiar with numbers binary representation, you will find more information here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_number#Representation. It is also possible to automatically generate short pulses of a determined duration. Electrical behavior of each I/O can be modified (open drain and reverse polarity).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.FindDigitalIO(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a digital IO port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the digital IO port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDigitalIO.isOnline() to test if the digital IO port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a digital IO port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the digital IO port, for instance YMINIIO0.digitalIO.
member.returns: a YDigitalIO object allowing you to drive the digital IO port.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type DigitalIO available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YDigitalIO.FindDigitalIO to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.get_portState
member.summary:
Returns the digital IO port state as an integer with each bit representing a channel.
value 0 = 0b00000000 -> all channels are OFF value 1 = 0b00000001 -> channel #0 is ON value 2 = 0b00000010 -> channel #1 is ON value 3 = 0b00000011 -> channels #0 and #1 are ON value 4 = 0b00000100 -> channel #2 is ON and so on...
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the digital IO port state as an integer with each bit representing a channel
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.set_portState(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the state of all digital IO port's channels at once: the parameter is an integer where each bit represents a channel, with bit 0 matching channel #0.
To set all channels to 0 -> 0b00000000 -> parameter = 0 To set channel #0 to 1 -> 0b00000001 -> parameter = 1 To set channel #1 to 1 -> 0b00000010 -> parameter = 2 To set channel #0 and #1 -> 0b00000011 -> parameter = 3 To set channel #2 to 1 -> 0b00000100 -> parameter = 4 an so on.... Only channels configured as outputs will be affecter, according to the value configured using set_portDirection.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the state of all digital IO port's channels at once: the parameter is an integer where each bit represents a channel, with bit 0 matching channel #0
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.PortState
member.value: Digital IO port state as an integer with each bit

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.get_portDirection
member.summary: Returns the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTDIRECTION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.set_portDirection(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting is kept after a reboot.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.PortDirection
member.value: I/O direction of all channels of the port (bitmap): 0 makes a bit an input, 1 makes it an output.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.get_portOpenDrain
member.summary:
Returns the electrical interface for each bit of the port.
For each bit set to 0 the matching I/O works in the regular, intuitive way, for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the electrical interface for each bit of the port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTOPENDRAIN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.set_portOpenDrain(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the electrical interface for each bit of the port.
0 makes a bit a regular input/output, 1 makes it an open-drain (open-collector) input/output. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method to make sure the setting is kept after a reboot.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the electrical interface for each bit of the port
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.PortOpenDrain
member.value: Electrical interface for each bit of the port. For each bit set to 0 the matching I/O works in the regular,

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.get_portPolarity
member.summary:
Returns the polarity of all the bits of the port.
For each bit set to 0, the matching I/O works the regular, intuitive way; for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the polarity of all the bits of the port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTPOLARITY_INVALID.

Changes the polarity of all the bits of the port: For each bit set to 0, the matching I/O works the regular, intuitive way; for each bit set to 1, the I/O works in reverse mode.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDigitalIOProxy.get_portDiags
member.summary:
Returns the port state diagnostics (Yocto-IO and Yocto-MaxiIO-V2 only).
Bit 0 indicates a shortcut on output 0, etc. Bit 8 indicates a power failure, and bit 9 signals overheating (overcurrent). During normal use, all diagnostic bits should stay clear.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the port state diagnostics (Yocto-IO and Yocto-MaxiIO-V2 only)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDigitalIO.PORTDIAGS_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy
member.summary:
The YDisplay class allows to drive Yoctopuce displays.
Yoctopuce display interface has been designed to easily show information and images. The device provides built-in multi-layer rendering. Layers can be drawn offline, individually, and freely moved on the display. It can also replay recorded sequences (animations).
In order to draw on the screen, you should use the display.get_displayLayer method to retrieve the layer(s) on which you want to draw, and then use methods defined in YDisplayLayer to draw on the layers.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.FindDisplay(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a display for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the display is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDisplay.isOnline() to test if the display is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a display by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the display, for instance YD128X32.display.
member.returns: a YDisplay object allowing you to drive the display.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Display available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YDisplay.FindDisplay to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.resetAll
member.summary:
Clears the display screen and resets all display layers to their default state.
Using this function in a sequence will kill the sequence play-back. Don't use that function to reset the display at sequence start-up.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.fade(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Smoothly changes the brightness of the screen to produce a fade-in or fade-out effect.
member.param: the new screen brightness
duration of the brightness transition, in milliseconds.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.newSequence
member.summary:
Starts to record all display commands into a sequence, for later replay.
The name used to store the sequence is specified when calling saveSequence(), once the recording is complete.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.saveSequence(System.String)
member.summary:
Stops recording display commands and saves the sequence into the specified file on the display internal memory.
The sequence can be later replayed using playSequence().
member.param: the name of the newly created sequence
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.playSequence(System.String)
member.summary: Replays a display sequence previously recorded using newSequence() and saveSequence().
member.param: the name of the newly created sequence
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.pauseSequence(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Waits for a specified delay (in milliseconds) before playing next commands in current sequence.
This method can be used while recording a display sequence, to insert a timed wait in the sequence (without any immediate effect). It can also be used dynamically while playing a pre-recorded sequence, to suspend or resume the execution of the sequence. To cancel a delay, call the same method with a zero delay.
member.param: the duration to wait, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.stopSequence
member.summary:
Stops immediately any ongoing sequence replay.
The display is left as is.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.upload(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Uploads an arbitrary file (for instance a GIF file) to the display, to the specified full path name.
If a file already exists with the same path name, its content is overwritten.
member.param: path and name of the new file to create
binary buffer with the content to set
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.copyLayerContent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Copies the whole content of a layer to another layer.
The color and transparency of all the pixels from the destination layer are set to match the source pixels. This method only affects the displayed content, but does not change any property of the layer object. Note that layer 0 has no transparency support (it is always completely opaque).
member.param: the identifier of the source layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
the identifier of the destination layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.swapLayerContent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Swaps the whole content of two layers.
The color and transparency of all the pixels from the two layers are swapped. This method only affects the displayed content, but does not change any property of the layer objects. In particular, the visibility of each layer stays unchanged. When used between one hidden layer and a visible layer, this method makes it possible to easily implement double-buffering. Note that layer 0 has no transparency support (it is always completely opaque).
member.param: the first layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
the second layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayProxy.get_displayLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a YDisplayLayer object that can be used to draw on the specified layer.
The content is displayed only when the layer is active on the screen (and not masked by other overlapping layers).
member.param: the identifier of the layer (a number in range 0..layerCount-1)
member.returns: an YDisplayLayer object
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns null.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy
member.summary:
The YDualPower class allows you to control the power source to use for module functions that require high current.
The module can also automatically disconnect the external power when a voltage drop is observed on the external power source (external battery running out of power).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.FindDualPower(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a dual power switch for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the dual power switch is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YDualPower.isOnline() to test if the dual power switch is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a dual power switch by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the dual power switch, for instance SERVORC1.dualPower.
member.returns: a YDualPower object allowing you to drive the dual power switch.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type DualPower available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YDualPower.FindDualPower to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.get_powerState
member.summary: Returns the current power source for module functions that require lots of current.
member.returns: a value among YDualPower.POWERSTATE_OFF, YDualPower.POWERSTATE_FROM_USB and YDualPower.POWERSTATE_FROM_EXT corresponding to the current power source for module functions that require lots of current
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDualPower.POWERSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.PowerState
member.value: Current power source for module functions that require lots of current.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.get_powerControl
member.summary: Returns the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current.
member.returns: a value among YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_AUTO, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_USB, YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_FROM_EXT and YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_OFF corresponding to the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YDualPower.POWERCONTROL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.set_powerControl(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the selected power source for module functions that require lots of current.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.PowerControl
member.value: Selected power source for module functions that require lots of current.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDualPowerProxy.get_extVoltage
member.summary: Returns the measured voltage on the external power source, in millivolts.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measured voltage on the external power source, in millivolts
