member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy
member.summary:
The YFiles class is used to access the filesystem embedded on some Yoctopuce devices.
This filesystem makes it possible for instance to design a custom web UI (for networked devices) or to add fonts (on display devices).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.FindFiles(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a filesystem for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the filesystem is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YFiles.isOnline() to test if the filesystem is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a filesystem by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the filesystem, for instance YRGBLED2.files.
member.returns: a YFiles object allowing you to drive the filesystem.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Files available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YFiles.FindFiles to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.get_filesCount
member.summary: Returns the number of files currently loaded in the filesystem.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of files currently loaded in the filesystem
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFiles.FILESCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.FilesCount
member.value: Number of files currently loaded in the filesystem.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.get_freeSpace
member.summary: Returns the free space for uploading new files to the filesystem, in bytes.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the free space for uploading new files to the filesystem, in bytes
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFiles.FREESPACE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.format_fs
member.summary:
Reinitialize the filesystem to its clean, unfragmented, empty state.
All files previously uploaded are permanently lost.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.get_list(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of YFileRecord objects that describe files currently loaded in the filesystem.
member.param: an optional filter pattern, using star and question marks as wild cards. When an empty pattern is provided, all file records are returned.
member.returns: a list of YFileRecord objects, containing the file path and name, byte size and 32-bit CRC of the file content.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.fileExist(System.String)
member.summary: Test if a file exist on the filesystem of the module.
member.param: the file name to test.
member.returns: a true if the file exist, false otherwise.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.download(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the requested file and returns a binary buffer with its content.
member.param: path and name of the file to download
member.returns: a binary buffer with the file content
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty content.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.upload(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Uploads a file to the filesystem, to the specified full path name.
If a file already exists with the same path name, its content is overwritten.
member.param: path and name of the new file to create
binary buffer with the content to set
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFilesProxy.remove(System.String)
member.summary:
Deletes a file, given by its full path name, from the filesystem.
Because of filesystem fragmentation, deleting a file may not always free up the whole space used by the file. However, rewriting a file with the same path name will always reuse any space not freed previously. If you need to ensure that no space is taken by previously deleted files, you can use format_fs to fully reinitialize the filesystem.
member.param: path and name of the file to remove.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy
member.summary:
The YGenericSensor class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce signal transducers.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure the automatic conversion between the measured signal and the corresponding engineering unit.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.FindGenericSensor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a generic sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the generic sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGenericSensor.isOnline() to test if the generic sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a generic sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the generic sensor, for instance RX010V01.genericSensor1.
member.returns: a YGenericSensor object allowing you to drive the generic sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type GenericSensor available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YGenericSensor.FindGenericSensor to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured value.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured value
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_signalValue
member.summary: Returns the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_signalUnit
member.summary: Returns the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALUNIT_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.SignalUnit
member.value: Measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_signalRange
member.summary: Returns the input signal range used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the input signal range used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALRANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_signalRange(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the input signal range used by the sensor.
When the input signal gets out of the planned range, the output value will be set to an arbitrary large value, whose sign indicates the direction of the range overrun.
For a 4-20mA sensor, the default input signal range is "4...20". For a 0-10V sensor, the default input signal range is "0.1...10". For numeric communication interfaces, the default input signal range is "-999999.999...999999.999".
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the input signal range used by the sensor
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.SignalRange
member.value: Input signal range used by the sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_valueRange
member.summary: Returns the physical value range measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the physical value range measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.VALUERANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_valueRange(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the output value range, corresponding to the physical value measured by the sensor.
The default output value range is the same as the input signal range (1:1 mapping), but you can change it so that the function automatically computes the physical value encoded by the input signal. Be aware that, as a side effect, the range modification may automatically modify the display resolution.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the output value range, corresponding to the physical value measured by the sensor
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.ValueRange
member.value: Physical value range measured by the sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_signalBias(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment.
If your electric signal reads positive when it should be zero, setup a positive signalBias of the same value to fix the zero shift. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_signalBias
member.summary:
Returns the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment.
A positive bias means that the signal is over-reporting the measure, while a negative bias means that the signal is under-reporting the measure.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALBIAS_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.SignalBias
member.value: Electric signal bias for zero shift adjustment.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_signalSampling
member.summary:
Returns the electric signal sampling method to use.
The HIGH_RATE method uses the highest sampling frequency, without any filtering. The HIGH_RATE_FILTERED method adds a windowed 7-sample median filter. The LOW_NOISE method uses a reduced acquisition frequency to reduce noise. The LOW_NOISE_FILTERED method combines a reduced frequency with the median filter to get measures as stable as possible when working on a noisy signal.
member.returns: a value among YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE_FILTERED, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE_FILTERED and YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGHEST_RATE corresponding to the electric signal sampling method to use
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_signalSampling(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the electric signal sampling method to use.
The HIGH_RATE method uses the highest sampling frequency, without any filtering. The HIGH_RATE_FILTERED method adds a windowed 7-sample median filter. The LOW_NOISE method uses a reduced acquisition frequency to reduce noise. The LOW_NOISE_FILTERED method combines a reduced frequency with the median filter to get measures as stable as possible when working on a noisy signal. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGH_RATE_FILTERED, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE, YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_LOW_NOISE_FILTERED and YGenericSensor.SIGNALSAMPLING_HIGHEST_RATE corresponding to the electric signal sampling method to use
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.SignalSampling
member.value: Electric signal sampling method to use.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YGenericSensor.ENABLED_FALSE or YGenericSensor.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGenericSensor.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this input.
When an input is disabled, its value is no more updated. On some devices, disabling an input can improve the refresh rate of the other active inputs. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YGenericSensor.ENABLED_FALSE or YGenericSensor.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.Enabled
member.value: Activation state of this input.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGenericSensorProxy.zeroAdjust
member.summary:
Adjusts the signal bias so that the current signal value is need precisely as zero.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy
member.summary:
The YGps class allows you to retrieve positioning data from a GPS/GNSS sensor.
This class can provides complete positioning information. However, if you wish to define callbacks on position changes or record the position in the datalogger, you should use the YLatitude et YLongitude classes.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.FindGps(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a geolocalization module for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the geolocalization module is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGps.isOnline() to test if the geolocalization module is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a geolocalization module by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the geolocalization module, for instance YGNSSMK2.gps.
member.returns: a YGps object allowing you to drive the geolocalization module.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Gps available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YGps.FindGps to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.get_isFixed
member.summary: Returns TRUE if the receiver has found enough satellites to work.
member.returns: either YGps.ISFIXED_FALSE or YGps.ISFIXED_TRUE, according to TRUE if the receiver has found enough satellites to work
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.ISFIXED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.get_satCount
member.summary: Returns the total count of satellites used to compute GPS position.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the total count of satellites used to compute GPS position
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.SATCOUNT_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.SatCount
member.value: Total count of satellites used to compute GPS position.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.IsFixed
member.value: True if the receiver has found enough satellites to work.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.get_satPerConst
member.summary:
Returns the count of visible satellites per constellation encoded on a 32 bit integer: bits 0..
5: GPS satellites count, bits 6..11 : Glonass, bits 12..17 : Galileo. this value is refreshed every 5 seconds only.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the count of visible satellites per constellation encoded on a 32 bit integer: bits 0.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.SATPERCONST_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.get_gpsRefreshRate
member.summary:
Returns effective GPS data refresh frequency.
this value is refreshed every 5 seconds only.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to effective GPS data refresh frequency
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.GPSREFRESHRATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.get_coordSystem
member.summary: Returns the representation system used for positioning data.
member.returns: a value among YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DMS, YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DM and YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_D corresponding to the representation system used for positioning data
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.COORDSYSTEM_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.set_coordSystem(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the representation system used for positioning data.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DMS, YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_DM and YGps.COORDSYSTEM_GPS_D corresponding to the representation system used for positioning data

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.CoordSystem

member.summary: Returns the the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data.
member.returns: a value among YGps.CONSTELLATION_GNSS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GALILEO, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GALILEO and YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS_GALILEO corresponding to the the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YGps.CONSTELLATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGpsProxy.set_constellation(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data.
Possible constellations are GNSS ( = all supported constellations), GPS, Glonass, Galileo , and the 3 possible pairs. This setting has no effect on Yocto-GPS (V1).
member.param: a value among YGps.CONSTELLATION_GNSS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GALILEO, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GLONASS, YGps.CONSTELLATION_GPS_GALILEO and YGps.CONSTELLATION_GLONASS_GALILEO corresponding to the satellites constellation used to compute positioning data

member.summary:
Changes the number of seconds between current time and UTC time (time zone).
The timezone is automatically rounded to the nearest multiple of 15 minutes. If current UTC time is known, the current time is automatically be updated according to the selected time zone. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YGroundSpeedProxy
member.summary:
The YGroundSpeed class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce ground speed sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGroundSpeedProxy.FindGroundSpeed(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a ground speed sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the ground speed sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGroundSpeed.isOnline() to test if the ground speed sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a ground speed sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the ground speed sensor, for instance YGNSSMK2.groundSpeed.
member.returns: a YGroundSpeed object allowing you to drive the ground speed sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGroundSpeedProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type GroundSpeed available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YGroundSpeed.FindGroundSpeed to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy
member.summary:
The YGyro class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce gyroscopes.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the possibility to access x, y and z components of the rotation vector separately, as well as the possibility to deal with quaternion-based orientation estimates.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.FindGyro(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a gyroscope for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the gyroscope is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YGyro.isOnline() to test if the gyroscope is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a gyroscope by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the gyroscope, for instance Y3DMK002.gyro.
member.returns: a YGyro object allowing you to drive the gyroscope.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Gyro available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_roll
member.summary:
Returns the estimated roll angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the roll angle can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to roll angle in degrees, between -180 and +180.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_pitch
member.summary:
Returns the estimated pitch angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the pitch angle can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to pitch angle in degrees, between -90 and +90.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_heading
member.summary:
Returns the estimated heading angle, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The axis corresponding to the heading can be mapped to any of the device X, Y or Z physical directions using methods of the class YRefFrame.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to heading in degrees, between 0 and 360.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_quaternionW
member.summary: Returns the w component (real part) of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the w component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_quaternionX
member.summary:
Returns the x component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The x component is mostly correlated with rotations on the roll axis.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the x component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_quaternionY
member.summary:
Returns the y component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The y component is mostly correlated with rotations on the pitch axis.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the y component of the quaternion.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YGyroProxy.get_quaternionZ
member.summary:
Returns the x component of the quaternion describing the device estimated orientation, based on the integration of gyroscopic measures combined with acceleration and magnetic field measurements.
The x component is mostly correlated with changes of heading.
member.returns: a floating-point number corresponding to the z component of the quaternion.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy
member.summary:
The YHubPort class provides control over the power supply for slave ports on a YoctoHub.
It provide information about the device connected to it. The logical name of a YHubPort is always automatically set to the unique serial number of the Yoctopuce device connected to it.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.FindHubPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a YoctoHub slave port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the YoctoHub slave port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YHubPort.isOnline() to test if the YoctoHub slave port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a YoctoHub slave port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the YoctoHub slave port, for instance YHUBETH1.hubPort1.
member.returns: a YHubPort object allowing you to drive the YoctoHub slave port.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type HubPort available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YHubPort.FindHubPort to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns true if the YoctoHub port is powered, false otherwise.
member.returns: either YHubPort.ENABLED_FALSE or YHubPort.ENABLED_TRUE, according to true if the YoctoHub port is powered, false otherwise
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation of the YoctoHub port.
If the port is enabled, the connected module is powered. Otherwise, port power is shut down.
member.param: either YHubPort.ENABLED_FALSE or YHubPort.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation of the YoctoHub port
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.get_portState
member.summary: Returns the current state of the YoctoHub port.
member.returns: a value among YHubPort.PORTSTATE_OFF, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_OVRLD, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_ON, YHubPort.PORTSTATE_RUN and YHubPort.PORTSTATE_PROG corresponding to the current state of the YoctoHub port
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.PORTSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.PortState
member.value: Current state of the YoctoHub port.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.Enabled
member.value: True if the port output is enabled.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHubPortProxy.get_baudRate
member.summary:
Returns the current baud rate used by this YoctoHub port, in kbps.
The default value is 1000 kbps, but a slower rate may be used if communication problems are encountered.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current baud rate used by this YoctoHub port, in kbps
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHubPort.BAUDRATE_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy
member.summary:
The YHumidity class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce humidity sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy.FindHumidity(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a humidity sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the humidity sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YHumidity.isOnline() to test if the humidity sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a humidity sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the humidity sensor, for instance YCO2MK02.humidity.
member.returns: a YHumidity object allowing you to drive the humidity sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Humidity available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YHumidity.FindHumidity to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the primary unit for measuring humidity.
That unit is a string. If that strings starts with the letter 'g', the primary measured value is the absolute humidity, in g/m3. Otherwise, the primary measured value will be the relative humidity (RH), in per cents.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the primary unit for measuring humidity
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy.get_relHum
member.summary: Returns the current relative humidity, in per cents.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current relative humidity, in per cents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHumidity.RELHUM_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YHumidityProxy.get_absHum
member.summary: Returns the current absolute humidity, in grams per cubic meter of air.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current absolute humidity, in grams per cubic meter of air
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YHumidity.ABSHUM_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy
member.summary:
The YI2cPort classe allows you to fully drive a Yoctopuce I2C port.
It can be used to send and receive data, and to configure communication parameters (baud rate, etc). Note that Yoctopuce I2C ports are not exposed as virtual COM ports. They are meant to be used in the same way as all Yoctopuce devices.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.FindI2cPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves an I2C port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the I2C port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YI2cPort.isOnline() to test if the I2C port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for an I2C port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the I2C port, for instance YI2CMK01.i2cPort.
member.returns: a YI2cPort object allowing you to drive the I2C port.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type I2cPort available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YI2cPort.FindI2cPort to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used to send I2C messages, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for messages separated by LF or "Char" for continuous stream of codes.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used to send I2C messages, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used to send I2C messages.
Possible values are "Line" for messages separated by LF or "Char" for continuous stream of codes. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each message sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used to send I2C messages
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.Protocol
member.value: Type of protocol used to send I2C messages, as a string.

member.summary: Returns the voltage level used on the I2C bus.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.I2CVOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.set_i2cVoltageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage level used on the I2C bus.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.I2cVoltageLevel

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.get_i2cMode
member.summary:
Returns the I2C port communication parameters, as a string such as "400kbps,2000ms,NoRestart".
The string includes the baud rate, the recovery delay after communications errors, and if needed the option NoRestart to use a Stop/Start sequence instead of the Restart state when performing read on the I2C bus.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the I2C port communication parameters, as a string such as "400kbps,2000ms,NoRestart"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YI2cPort.I2CMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.set_i2cMode(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the I2C port communication parameters, with a string such as "400kbps,2000ms".
The string includes the baud rate, the recovery delay after communications errors, and if needed the option NoRestart to use a Stop/Start sequence instead of the Restart state when performing read on the I2C bus. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the I2C port communication parameters, with a string such as "400kbps,2000ms"
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.I2cMode
member.value: I2C port communication parameters, as a string such as

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.uploadJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().
member.param: name of the job file to save on the device filesystem
a string containing a JSON definition of the job
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.selectJob(System.String)
member.summary:
Load and start processing the specified job file.
The file must have been previously created using the user interface or uploaded on the device filesystem using the uploadJob() function.
member.param: name of the job file (on the device filesystem)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.reset
member.summary: Clears the serial port buffer and resets counters to zero.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a a binary buffer) to a device on the I2C bus.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.
member.param: the 7-bit address of the slave device (without the direction bit)
the binary buffer to be sent
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.

a list of data bytes to be sent

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.i2cSendAndReceiveBin(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a a binary buffer) to a device on the I2C bus, then read back the specified number of bytes from device.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.

the binary buffer to be sent
the number of bytes to receive once the data bytes are sent

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.i2cSendAndReceiveArray(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a one-way message (provided as a list of integer) to a device on the I2C bus, then read back the specified number of bytes from device.
This function checks and reports communication errors on the I2C bus.

a list of data bytes to be sent
the number of bytes to receive once the data bytes are sent

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeStr(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a text-encoded I2C code stream to the I2C bus, as is.
An I2C code stream is a string made of hexadecimal data bytes, but that may also include the I2C state transitions code: "{S}" to emit a start condition, "{R}" for a repeated start condition, "{P}" for a stop condition, "xx" for receiving a data byte, "{A}" to ack a data byte received and "{N}" to nack a data byte received. If a newline ("\n") is included in the stream, the message will be terminated and a newline will also be added to the receive stream.
member.param: the code stream to send
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeLine(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a text-encoded I2C code stream to the I2C bus, and terminate the message en relchant le bus.
An I2C code stream is a string made of hexadecimal data bytes, but that may also include the I2C state transitions code: "{S}" to emit a start condition, "{R}" for a repeated start condition, "{P}" for a stop condition, "xx" for receiving a data byte, "{A}" to ack a data byte received and "{N}" to nack a data byte received. At the end of the stream, a stop condition is added if missing and a newline is added to the receive buffer as well.
member.param: the code stream to send
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeByte(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a single byte to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: the byte to send
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeHex(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a byte sequence (provided as a hexadecimal string) to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: a string of hexadecimal byte codes
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeBin(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Sends a binary buffer to the I2C bus, as is.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: the binary buffer to send
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.writeArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Sends a byte sequence (provided as a list of bytes) to the I2C bus.
Depending on the I2C bus state, the first byte will be interpreted as an address byte or a data byte.
member.param: a list of byte codes
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YI2cPortProxy.snoopMessages(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Retrieves messages (both direction) in the I2C port buffer, starting at current position.
If no message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of YI2cSnoopingRecord objects containing the messages found, if any.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YLatitudeProxy
member.summary:
The YLatitude class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce latitude sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLatitudeProxy.FindLatitude(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a latitude sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the latitude sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YLatitude.isOnline() to test if the latitude sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a latitude sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the latitude sensor, for instance YGNSSMK2.latitude.
member.returns: a YLatitude object allowing you to drive the latitude sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLatitudeProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Latitude available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YLatitude.FindLatitude to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YLightSensorProxy
member.summary:
The YLightSensor class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce light sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to easily perform a one-point linear calibration to compensate the effect of a glass or filter placed in front of the sensor. For some light sensors with several working modes, this class can select the desired working mode.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLightSensorProxy.FindLightSensor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a light sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the light sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YLightSensor.isOnline() to test if the light sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a light sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the light sensor, for instance LIGHTMK3.lightSensor.
member.returns: a YLightSensor object allowing you to drive the light sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLightSensorProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type LightSensor available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YLightSensor.FindLightSensor to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary: Changes the sensor-specific calibration parameter so that the current value matches a desired target (linear scaling).
member.param: the desired target value.
member.para: Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLightSensorProxy.get_measureType
member.summary: Returns the type of light measure.
member.returns: a value among YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HUMAN_EYE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_WIDE_SPECTRUM, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INFRARED, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RATE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_ENERGY and YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RESOLUTION corresponding to the type of light measure
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YLightSensorProxy.set_measureType(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the light sensor type used in the device.
The measure can either approximate the response of the human eye, focus on a specific light spectrum, depending on the capabilities of the light-sensitive cell. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HUMAN_EYE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_WIDE_SPECTRUM, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_INFRARED, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RATE, YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_ENERGY and YLightSensor.MEASURETYPE_HIGH_RESOLUTION corresponding to the light sensor type used in the device
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YMagnetometerProxy
member.summary:
The YSensor class is the parent class for all Yoctopuce sensor types.
It can be used to read the current value and unit of any sensor, read the min/max value, configure autonomous recording frequency and access recorded data. It also provide a function to register a callback invoked each time the observed value changes, or at a predefined interval. Using this class rather than a specific subclass makes it possible to create generic applications that work with any Yoctopuce sensor, even those that do not yet exist. Note: The YAnButton class is the only analog input which does not inherit from YSensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMagnetometerProxy.FindMagnetometer(System.String)

This function does not require that the magnetometer is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMagnetometer.isOnline() to test if the magnetometer is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a magnetometer by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the magnetometer, for instance Y3DMK002.magnetometer.
member.returns: a YMagnetometer object allowing you to drive the magnetometer.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMessageBoxProxy.sendTextMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a regular text SMS, with standard parameters.
This function can send messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For sending messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use newMessage to create a new message and define the content of using methods addText and addUnicodeData.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMessageBoxProxy.sendFlashMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a Flash SMS (class 0 message).
Flash messages are displayed on the handset immediately and are usually not saved on the SIM card. This function can send messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For sending messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use newMessage to create a new message and define the content of using methods addText et addUnicodeData.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Creates a new empty SMS message, to be configured and sent later on.
member.param: a text string with the recipient phone number, either as a national number, or in international format starting with a plus sign
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMessageBoxProxy.get_messages
member.summary:
Returns the list of messages received and not deleted.
This function will automatically decode concatenated SMS.
member.returns: an YSms object list.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy
member.summary:
The YMotor class allows you to drive a DC motor.
It can be used to configure the power sent to the motor to make it turn both ways, but also to drive accelerations and decelerations. The motor will then accelerate automatically: you will not have to monitor it. The API also allows to slow down the motor by shortening its terminals: the motor will then act as an electromagnetic brake.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.FindMotor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMotor.isOnline() to test if the motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the motor, for instance MOTORCTL.motor.
member.returns: a YMotor object allowing you to drive the motor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Motor available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YMotor.FindMotor to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.MOTORSTATUS_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.MotorStatus
member.value: Return the controller state. Possible states are:

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.set_drivingForce(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes immediately the power sent to the motor.
The value is a percentage between -100% to 100%. If you want go easy on your mechanics and avoid excessive current consumption, try to avoid brutal power changes. For example, immediate transition from forward full power to reverse full power is a very bad idea. Each time the driving power is modified, the braking power is set to zero.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to immediately the power sent to the motor
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.get_drivingForce
member.summary: Returns the power sent to the motor, as a percentage between -100% and +100%.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the power sent to the motor, as a percentage between -100% and +100%
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.DRIVINGFORCE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.set_brakingForce(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes immediately the braking force applied to the motor (in percents).
The value 0 corresponds to no braking (free wheel). When the braking force is changed, the driving power is set to zero. The value is a percentage.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to immediately the braking force applied to the motor (in percents)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.get_brakingForce
member.summary:
Returns the braking force applied to the motor, as a percentage.
The value 0 corresponds to no braking (free wheel).
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the braking force applied to the motor, as a percentage
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.BRAKINGFORCE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.set_cutOffVoltage(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw.
This setting prevent damage to a battery that can occur when drawing current from an "empty" battery. Note that whatever the cutoff threshold, the controller switches to undervoltage error state if the power supply goes under 3V, even for a very brief time. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.get_cutOffVoltage
member.summary:
Returns the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw.
This setting prevents damage to a battery that can occur when drawing current from an "empty" battery.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state and prevents further current draw
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.CUTOFFVOLTAGE_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.CutOffVoltage
member.value: Threshold voltage under which the controller automatically switches to error state

A zero value means that there is no limit.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.OVERCURRENTLIMIT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.set_overCurrentLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current threshold (in mA) above which the controller automatically switches to error state.
A zero value means that there is no limit. Note that whatever the current limit is, the controller switches to OVERCURRENT status if the current goes above 32A, even for a very brief time. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.set_frequency(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the PWM frequency used to control the motor.
Low frequency is usually more efficient and may help the motor to start, but an audible noise might be generated. A higher frequency reduces the noise, but more energy is converted into heat. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency used to control the motor
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the PWM frequency used to control the motor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency used to control the motor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.FREQUENCY_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.Frequency
member.value: PWM frequency used to control the motor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.get_failSafeTimeout
member.summary:
Returns the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process.
When this delay has elapsed, the controller automatically stops the motor and switches to FAILSAFE error. Failsafe security is disabled when the value is zero.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMotor.FAILSAFETIMEOUT_INVALID.

member.param: an integer corresponding to the delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without receiving any instruction from the control process
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.value: Delay in milliseconds allowed for the controller to run autonomously without

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.keepALive
member.summary:
Rearms the controller failsafe timer.
When the motor is running and the failsafe feature is active, this function should be called periodically to prove that the control process is running properly. Otherwise, the motor is automatically stopped after the specified timeout. Calling a motor set function implicitly rearms the failsafe timer.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMotorProxy.resetStatus
member.summary:
Reset the controller state to IDLE.
This function must be invoked explicitly after any error condition is signaled.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy
member.summary: The YMultiAxisController class allows you to drive multiple stepper motors synchronously.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.FindMultiAxisController(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a multi-axis controller for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the multi-axis controller is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMultiAxisController.isOnline() to test if the multi-axis controller is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a multi-axis controller by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the multi-axis controller, for instance MyDevice.multiAxisController.
member.returns: a YMultiAxisController object allowing you to drive the multi-axis controller.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type MultiAxisController available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YMultiAxisController.FindMultiAxisController to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.get_nAxis
member.summary: Returns the number of synchronized controllers.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of synchronized controllers
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiAxisController.NAXIS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.set_nAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the number of synchronized controllers.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the number of synchronized controllers
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.get_globalState
member.summary: Returns the stepper motor set overall state.
member.returns: a value among YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_ABSENT, YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_ALERT, YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_HI_Z, YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_STOP, YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_RUN and YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_BATCH corresponding to the stepper motor set overall state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiAxisController.GLOBALSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.reset
member.summary: Reinitialize all controllers and clear all alert flags.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.findHomePosition(System.Double[])
member.summary: Starts all motors backward at the specified speeds, to search for the motor home position.
member.param: desired speed for all axis, in steps per second.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.moveTo(System.Double[])
member.summary:
Starts all motors synchronously to reach a given absolute position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the lowest acceleration and max speed parameters configured for all motors. The final position will be reached on all axis at the same time.
member.param: absolute position, measured in steps from each origin.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.moveRel(System.Double[])
member.summary:
Starts all motors synchronously to reach a given relative position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the lowest acceleration and max speed parameters configured for all motors. The final position will be reached on all axis at the same time.
member.param: relative position, measured in steps from the current position.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.pause(System.Int32)
member.summary: Keep the motor in the same state for the specified amount of time, before processing next command.
member.param: wait time, specified in milliseconds.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.emergencyStop
member.summary: Stops the motor with an emergency alert, without taking any additional precaution.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.abortAndBrake
member.summary: Stops the motor smoothly as soon as possible, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiAxisControllerProxy.abortAndHiZ
member.summary: Turn the controller into Hi-Z mode immediately, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy
member.summary:
The YMultiCellWeighScale class provides a weight measurement from a set of ratiometric sensors.
It can be used to control the bridge excitation parameters, in order to avoid measure shifts caused by temperature variation in the electronics, and can also automatically apply an additional correction factor based on temperature to compensate for offsets in the load cells themselves.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.FindMultiCellWeighScale(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a multi-cell weighing scale sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the multi-cell weighing scale sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMultiCellWeighScale.isOnline() to test if the multi-cell weighing scale sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a multi-cell weighing scale sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the multi-cell weighing scale sensor, for instance YWMBRDG1.multiCellWeighScale.
member.returns: a YMultiCellWeighScale object allowing you to drive the multi-cell weighing scale sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type MultiCellWeighScale available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YMultiCellWeighScale.FindMultiCellWeighScale to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.
