member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.set_tempAvgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.get_tempAvgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.TEMPAVGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.TempAvgAdaptRatio
member.value: Averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.set_tempChgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.get_tempChgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YMultiCellWeighScale.TEMPCHGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiCellWeighScaleProxy.TempChgAdaptRatio
member.value: Temperature change update rate, in per mille.

member.summary: The YMultiSensController class allows you to setup a customized sensor chain on devices featuring that functionality.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiSensControllerProxy.FindMultiSensController(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a multi-sensor controller for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the multi-sensor controller is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YMultiSensController.isOnline() to test if the multi-sensor controller is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a multi-sensor controller by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiSensControllerProxy.set_maintenanceMode(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the device mode to enable maintenance and to stop sensor polling.
This way, the device does not automatically restart when it cannot communicate with one of the sensors.
member.param: either YMultiSensController.MAINTENANCEMODE_FALSE or YMultiSensController.MAINTENANCEMODE_TRUE, according to the device mode to enable maintenance and to stop sensor polling
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YMultiSensControllerProxy.setupAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures the I2C address of the only sensor connected to the device.
It is recommended to put the the device in maintenance mode before changing sensor addresses. This method is only intended to work with a single sensor connected to the device, if several sensors are connected, the result is unpredictable. Note that the device is probably expecting to find a string of sensors with specific addresses. Check the device documentation to find out which addresses should be used.
member.param: new address of the connected sensor
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

members.member: YNetwork objects provide access to TCP/IP parameters of Yoctopuce devices that include a built-in network interface.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.FindNetwork(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a network interface for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the network interface is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YNetwork.isOnline() to test if the network interface is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a network interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the network interface, for instance YHUBETH1.network.
member.returns: a YNetwork object allowing you to drive the network interface.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Network available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YNetwork.FindNetwork to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.get_readiness
member.summary:
Returns the current established working mode of the network interface.
Level zero (DOWN_0) means that no hardware link has been detected. Either there is no signal on the network cable, or the selected wireless access point cannot be detected. Level 1 (LIVE_1) is reached when the network is detected, but is not yet connected. For a wireless network, this shows that the requested SSID is present. Level 2 (LINK_2) is reached when the hardware connection is established. For a wired network connection, level 2 means that the cable is attached at both ends. For a connection to a wireless access point, it shows that the security parameters are properly configured. For an ad-hoc wireless connection, it means that there is at least one other device connected on the ad-hoc network. Level 3 (DHCP_3) is reached when an IP address has been obtained using DHCP. Level 4 (DNS_4) is reached when the DNS server is reachable on the network. Level 5 (WWW_5) is reached when global connectivity is demonstrated by properly loading the current time from an NTP server.
member.returns: a value among YNetwork.READINESS_DOWN, YNetwork.READINESS_EXISTS, YNetwork.READINESS_LINKED, YNetwork.READINESS_LAN_OK and YNetwork.READINESS_WWW_OK corresponding to the current established working mode of the network interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.READINESS_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.Readiness
member.value: Current established working mode of the network interface.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.IpAddress
member.value: IP address currently in use by the device.

The MAC address is also available on a sticker on the module, in both numeric and barcode forms.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.MACADDRESS_INVALID.

The address may have been configured statically, or provided by a DHCP server.

member.summary: Returns the IP address of the router on the device subnet (default gateway).
member.returns: a string corresponding to the IP address of the router on the device subnet (default gateway)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.ROUTER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.get_ipConfig
member.summary:
Returns the IP configuration of the network interface.
If the network interface is setup to use a static IP address, the string starts with "STATIC:" and is followed by three parameters, separated by "/". The first is the device IP address, followed by the subnet mask length, and finally the router IP address (default gateway). For instance: "STATIC:192.168.1.14/16/192.168.1.1"
If the network interface is configured to receive its IP from a DHCP server, the string start with "DHCP:" and is followed by three parameters separated by "/". The first is the fallback IP address, then the fallback subnet mask length and finally the fallback router IP address. These three parameters are used when no DHCP reply is received.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the IP configuration of the network interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YNetwork.IPCONFIG_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.set_callbackCredentials(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the credentials required to connect to the callback address.
The credentials must be provided as returned by function get_callbackCredentials, in the form username:hash. The method used to compute the hash varies according to the the authentication scheme implemented by the callback, For Basic authentication, the hash is the MD5 of the string username:password. For Digest authentication, the hash is the MD5 of the string username:realm:password. For a simpler way to configure callback credentials, use function callbackLogin instead. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the credentials required to connect to the callback address
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.value: Hashed version of the notification callback credentials if set,

The password is not stored into the module, only a hashed copy of the credentials are saved. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

password required to log to the callback

Changes the configuration of the network interface to enable the use of an IP address received from a DHCP server.
Until an address is received from a DHCP server, the module uses the IP parameters specified to this function. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YNetworkProxy.triggerCallback
member.summary:
Trigger an HTTP callback quickly.
This function can even be called within an HTTP callback, in which case the next callback will be triggered 5 seconds after the end of the current callback, regardless if the minimum time between callbacks configured in the device.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

an integer representing the time offset relative to the period when the callback should occur. For instance, if the periodicity is 24h, an offset of 7 will make the callback occur each day at 7AM.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YOsControlProxy
member.summary:
The YOScontrol class provides some control over the operating system running a VirtualHub.
YOsControl is available on VirtualHub software only. This feature must be activated at the VirtualHub start up with -o option.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YOsControlProxy.FindOsControl(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves OS control for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the OS control is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YOsControl.isOnline() to test if the OS control is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for OS control by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the OS control, for instance MyDevice.osControl.
member.returns: a YOsControl object allowing you to drive the OS control.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YOsControlProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type OsControl available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YOsControl.FindOsControl to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YOsControlProxy.get_shutdownCountdown
member.summary: Returns the remaining number of seconds before the OS shutdown, or zero when no shutdown has been scheduled.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the remaining number of seconds before the OS shutdown, or zero when no shutdown has been scheduled
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YOsControl.SHUTDOWNCOUNTDOWN_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YOsControlProxy.shutdown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Schedules an OS shutdown after a given number of seconds.
member.param: number of seconds before shutdown
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YPowerProxy
member.summary:
The YPower class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce electrical power sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to access the energy counter and the power factor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPowerProxy.FindPower(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a electrical power sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the electrical power sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YPower.isOnline() to test if the electrical power sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a electrical power sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the electrical power sensor, for instance YWATTMK1.power.
member.returns: a YPower object allowing you to drive the electrical power sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPowerProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Power available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YPower.FindPower to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPowerProxy.get_cosPhi
member.summary: Returns the power factor (the ratio between the real power consumed, measured in W, and the apparent power provided, measured in VA).
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the power factor (the ratio between the real power consumed, measured in W, and the apparent power provided, measured in VA)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPower.COSPHI_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPowerProxy.get_meter
member.summary:
Returns the energy counter, maintained by the wattmeter by integrating the power consumption over time, but only when positive.
Note that this counter is reset at each start of the device.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPower.METER_INVALID.

Returns the energy counter, maintained by the wattmeter by integrating the power consumption over time, but only when positive.

Returns the energy counter, maintained by the wattmeter by integrating the power consumption over time, but only when negative.

member.summary:
Changes the parameter type (sensor value, presence or pulse count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks.
The edge count value is limited to the 6 lowest digits. For values greater than one million, use get_pulseCounter(). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YProximity.PROXIMITYREPORTMODE_NUMERIC, YProximity.PROXIMITYREPORTMODE_PRESENCE and YProximity.PROXIMITYREPORTMODE_PULSECOUNT corresponding to the parameter type (sensor value, presence or pulse count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy
member.summary:
The YPwmInput class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce PWM inputs.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure the signal parameter used to transmit information: the duty cycle, the frequency or the pulse width.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.FindPwmInput(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a PWM input for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the PWM input is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YPwmInput.isOnline() to test if the PWM input is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a PWM input by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the PWM input, for instance YPWMRX01.pwmInput1.
member.returns: a YPwmInput object allowing you to drive the PWM input.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type PwmInput available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YPwmInput.FindPwmInput to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured quantity.
That unit is just a string which is automatically initialized each time the measurement mode is changed. But is can be set to an arbitrary value. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured quantity
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_dutyCycle
member.summary: Returns the PWM duty cycle, in per cents.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM duty cycle, in per cents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.DUTYCYCLE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_pulseDuration
member.summary: Returns the PWM pulse length in milliseconds, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM pulse length in milliseconds, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.PULSEDURATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_frequency
member.summary: Returns the PWM frequency in Hz.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.FREQUENCY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_period
member.summary: Returns the PWM period in milliseconds.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM period in milliseconds
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.PERIOD_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_pulseCounter
member.summary:
Returns the pulse counter value.
Actually that counter is incremented twice per period. That counter is limited to 1 billion.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the pulse counter value
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.PULSECOUNTER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_pulseTimer
member.summary: Returns the timer of the pulses counter (ms).
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the timer of the pulses counter (ms)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.PULSETIMER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_pwmReportMode
member.summary:
Returns the parameter (frequency/duty cycle, pulse width, edges count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks.
Attention
member.returns: a value among YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_DUTYCYCLE, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQUENCY, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PULSEDURATION, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_EDGECOUNT, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PULSECOUNT, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_CPS, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_CPM, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_STATE, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQ_CPS, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQ_CPM and YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PERIODCOUNT corresponding to the parameter (frequency/duty cycle, pulse width, edges count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.set_pwmReportMode(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the parameter type (frequency/duty cycle, pulse width, or edge count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks.
The edge count value is limited to the 6 lowest digits. For values greater than one million, use get_pulseCounter(). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_DUTYCYCLE, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQUENCY, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PULSEDURATION, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_EDGECOUNT, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PULSECOUNT, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_CPS, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_CPM, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_STATE, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQ_CPS, YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_FREQ_CPM and YPwmInput.PWMREPORTMODE_PWM_PERIODCOUNT corresponding to the parameter type (frequency/duty cycle, pulse width, or edge count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.PwmReportMode
member.value: Parameter (frequency/duty cycle, pulse width, edges count) returned by the get_currentValue function and callbacks. Attention

member.summary:
Changes the shortest expected pulse duration, in ms.
Any shorter pulse will be automatically ignored (debounce). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the input signal sampling rate, in kHz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the input signal sampling rate, in kHz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the input signal sampling rate, measured in kHz.
A lower sampling frequency can be used to hide hide-frequency bounce effects, for instance on electromechanical contacts, but limits the measure resolution. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the input signal sampling rate, measured in kHz
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.get_edgesPerPeriod
member.summary:
Returns the number of edges detected per preiod.
For a clean PWM signal, this should be exactly two, but in cas the signal is created by a mechanical contact with bounces, it can get higher.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the number of edges detected per preiod
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmInput.EDGESPERPERIOD_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmInputProxy.resetCounter
member.summary: Returns the pulse counter value as well as its timer.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy
member.summary:
The YPwmOutput class allows you to drive a pulse-width modulated output (PWM).
You can configure the frequency as well as the duty cycle, and setup progressive transitions.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.FindPwmOutput(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a PWM generator for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the PWM generator is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YPwmOutput.isOnline() to test if the PWM generator is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a PWM generator by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the PWM generator, for instance YPWMTX01.pwmOutput1.
member.returns: a YPwmOutput object allowing you to drive the PWM generator.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type PwmOutput available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YPwmOutput.FindPwmOutput to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the state of the PWM generators.
member.returns: either YPwmOutput.ENABLED_FALSE or YPwmOutput.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the state of the PWM generators
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops or starts the PWM.
member.param: either YPwmOutput.ENABLED_FALSE or YPwmOutput.ENABLED_TRUE
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.set_frequency(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the PWM frequency.
The duty cycle is kept unchanged thanks to an automatic pulse width change, in other words, the change will not be applied before the end of the current period. This can significantly affect reaction time at low frequencies. If you call the matching module saveToFlash() method, the frequency will be kept after a device power cycle. To stop the PWM signal, do not set the frequency to zero, use the set_enabled() method instead.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.get_frequency
member.summary: Returns the PWM frequency in Hz.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM frequency in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.FREQUENCY_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.Frequency
member.value: PWM frequency in Hz.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.set_period(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the PWM period in milliseconds.
Caution: in order to avoid random truncation of the current pulse, the change will not be applied before the end of the current period. This can significantly affect reaction time at low frequencies. If you call the matching module saveToFlash() method, the frequency will be kept after a device power cycle.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM period in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.get_period
member.summary: Returns the PWM period in milliseconds.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM period in milliseconds
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.PERIOD_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.Period
member.value: PWM period in milliseconds.

member.summary: Changes the PWM duty cycle, in per cents.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM duty cycle, in per cents
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.get_dutyCycle
member.summary: Returns the PWM duty cycle, in per cents.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the PWM duty cycle, in per cents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.DUTYCYCLE_INVALID.

member.value: PWM duty cycle, in per cents.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.Enabled

member.summary:
Changes the PWM pulse length, in milliseconds.
A pulse length cannot be longer than period, otherwise it is truncated.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the PWM pulse length in milliseconds, as a floating point number.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.PULSEDURATION_INVALID.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

Changes the PWM duty cycle at device power on.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.summary: Returns the PWM generators duty cycle at device power on as a floating point number between 0 and 100.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmOutput.DUTYCYCLEATPOWERON_INVALID.

member.value: PWM generators duty cycle at device power on as a floating point number between 0 and 100.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.pulseDurationMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth transition of the pulse duration toward a given value.
Any period, frequency, duty cycle or pulse width change will cancel any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new pulse duration at the end of the transition (floating-point number, representing the pulse duration in milliseconds)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.dutyCycleMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth change of the duty cycle toward a given value.
Any period, frequency, duty cycle or pulse width change will cancel any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new duty cycle at the end of the transition (percentage, floating-point number between 0 and 100)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.frequencyMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth frequency change toward a given value.
Any period, frequency, duty cycle or pulse width change will cancel any ongoing transition process.
member.param: new frequency at the end of the transition (floating-point number)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.phaseMove(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs a smooth transition toward a specified value of the phase shift between this channel and the other channel.
The phase shift is executed by slightly changing the frequency temporarily during the specified duration. This function only makes sense when both channels are running, either at the same frequency, or at a multiple of the channel frequency. Any period, frequency, duty cycle or pulse width change will cancel any ongoing transition process.
member.param: phase shift at the end of the transition, in milliseconds (floating-point number)
total duration of the transition, in milliseconds
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.triggerPulsesByDuration(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Trigger a given number of pulses of specified duration, at current frequency.
At the end of the pulse train, revert to the original state of the PWM generator.
member.param: desired pulse duration (floating-point number, representing the pulse duration in milliseconds)
desired pulse count
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.triggerPulsesByDutyCycle(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Trigger a given number of pulses of specified duration, at current frequency.
At the end of the pulse train, revert to the original state of the PWM generator.
member.param: desired duty cycle for the generated pulses (percentage, floating-point number between 0 and 100)
desired pulse count
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmOutputProxy.triggerPulsesByFrequency(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Trigger a given number of pulses at the specified frequency, using current duty cycle.
At the end of the pulse train, revert to the original state of the PWM generator.
member.param: desired frequency for the generated pulses (floating-point number)
desired pulse count
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy
member.summary: The YPwmPowerSource class allows you to configure the voltage source used by all PWM outputs on the same device.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy.FindPwmPowerSource(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a PWM generator power source for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the PWM generator power source is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YPwmPowerSource.isOnline() to test if the PWM generator power source is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a PWM generator power source by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the PWM generator power source, for instance YPWMTX01.pwmPowerSource.
member.returns: a YPwmPowerSource object allowing you to drive the PWM generator power source.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type PwmPowerSource available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YPwmPowerSource.FindPwmPowerSource to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy.get_powerMode
member.summary: Returns the selected power source for the PWM on the same device.
member.returns: a value among YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_USB_5V, YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_USB_3V, YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_EXT_V and YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_OPNDRN corresponding to the selected power source for the PWM on the same device
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy.set_powerMode(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the PWM power source.
PWM can use isolated 5V from USB, isolated 3V from USB or voltage from an external power source. The PWM can also work in open drain mode. In that mode, the PWM actively pulls the line down. Warning: this setting is common to all PWM on the same device. If you change that parameter, all PWM located on the same device are affected. If you want the change to be kept after a device reboot, make sure to call the matching module saveToFlash().
member.param: a value among YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_USB_5V, YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_USB_3V, YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_EXT_V and YPwmPowerSource.POWERMODE_OPNDRN corresponding to the PWM power source
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YPwmPowerSourceProxy.PowerMode
member.value: Selected power source for the PWM on the same device.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YQtProxy
member.summary:
The YQt class provides direct access to the 3D attitude estimation provided by Yoctopuce inertial sensors.
The four instances of YQt provide direct access to the individual quaternion components representing the orientation. It is usually not needed to use the YQt class directly, as the YGyro class provides a more convenient higher-level interface.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YQtProxy.FindQt(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a quaternion component for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the quaternion component is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YQt.isOnline() to test if the quaternion component is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a quaternion component by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the quaternion component, for instance Y3DMK002.qt1.
member.returns: a YQt object allowing you to drive the quaternion component.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YQtProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Qt available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YQt.FindQt to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary:
The YQuadratureDecoder class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce quadrature decoders.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.summary:
Retrieves a quadrature decoder for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the quadrature decoder is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YQuadratureDecoder.isOnline() to test if the quadrature decoder is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a quadrature decoder by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the quadrature decoder, for instance YPWMRX01.quadratureDecoder.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YQuadratureDecoderProxy.GetSimilarFunctions

Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YQuadratureDecoder.FindQuadratureDecoder to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.

Changes the current expected position of the quadrature decoder.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy
member.summary:
The YRangeFinder class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce range finders.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to easily perform a one-point linear calibration to compensate the effect of a glass or filter placed in front of the sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.FindRangeFinder(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a range finder for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the range finder is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YRangeFinder.isOnline() to test if the range finder is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a range finder by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the range finder, for instance YRNGFND1.rangeFinder1.
member.returns: a YRangeFinder object allowing you to drive the range finder.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type RangeFinder available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YRangeFinder.FindRangeFinder to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.IsPresent
member.value: True if the sensor detected an object

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured range.
That unit is a string. String value can be " or mm. Any other value is ignored. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept. WARNING: if a specific calibration is defined for the rangeFinder function, a unit system change will probably break it.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured range
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.get_rangeFinderMode
member.summary:
Returns the range finder running mode.
The rangefinder running mode allows you to put priority on precision, speed or maximum range.
member.returns: a value among YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_DEFAULT, YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_LONG_RANGE, YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_HIGH_ACCURACY and YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_HIGH_SPEED corresponding to the range finder running mode
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.set_rangeFinderMode(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the rangefinder running mode, allowing you to put priority on precision, speed or maximum range.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_DEFAULT, YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_LONG_RANGE, YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_HIGH_ACCURACY and YRangeFinder.RANGEFINDERMODE_HIGH_SPEED corresponding to the rangefinder running mode, allowing you to put priority on precision, speed or maximum range
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.RangeFinderMode
member.value: Range finder running mode. The rangefinder running mode

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.get_timeFrame
member.summary:
Returns the time frame used to measure the distance and estimate the measure reliability.
The time frame is expressed in milliseconds.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the time frame used to measure the distance and estimate the measure reliability
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRangeFinder.TIMEFRAME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.set_timeFrame(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Changes the time frame used to measure the distance and estimate the measure reliability.
The time frame is expressed in milliseconds. A larger timeframe improves stability and reliability, at the cost of higher latency, but prevents the detection of events shorter than the time frame. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the time frame used to measure the distance and estimate the measure reliability
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Returns the current sensor temperature, as a floating point number.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current sensor temperature, as a floating point number
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRangeFinder.CURRENTTEMPERATURE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.get_hardwareCalibrationTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature at the time when the latest calibration was performed.
This function can be used to determine if a new calibration for ambient temperature is required.
member.returns: a temperature, as a floating point number. On failure, throws an exception or return YAPI.INVALID_DOUBLE.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.triggerTemperatureCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers a sensor calibration according to the current ambient temperature.
That calibration process needs no physical interaction with the sensor. It is performed automatically at device startup, but it is recommended to start it again when the temperature delta since the latest calibration exceeds 8C.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.triggerSpadCalibration
member.summary:
Triggers the photon detector hardware calibration.
This function is part of the calibration procedure to compensate for the the effect of a cover glass. Make sure to read the chapter about hardware calibration for details on the calibration procedure for proper results.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.triggerOffsetCalibration(System.Double)
member.summary:
Triggers the hardware offset calibration of the distance sensor.
This function is part of the calibration procedure to compensate for the the effect of a cover glass. Make sure to read the chapter about hardware calibration for details on the calibration procedure for proper results.
member.param: true distance of the calibration target, in mm or inches, depending on the unit selected in the device
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.triggerXTalkCalibration(System.Double)
member.summary:
Triggers the hardware cross-talk calibration of the distance sensor.
This function is part of the calibration procedure to compensate for the the effect of a cover glass. Make sure to read the chapter about hardware calibration for details on the calibration procedure for proper results.
member.param: true distance of the calibration target, in mm or inches, depending on the unit selected in the device
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRangeFinderProxy.cancelCoverGlassCalibrations
member.summary:
Cancels the effect of previous hardware calibration procedures to compensate for cover glass, and restores factory settings.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YRealTimeClockProxy
member.summary:
The YRealTimeClock class provide access to the embedded real-time clock available on some Yoctopuce devices.
It can provide current date and time, even after a power outage lasting several days. It is the base for automated wake-up functions provided by the WakeUpScheduler. The current time may represent a local time as well as an UTC time, but no automatic time change will occur to account for daylight saving time.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRealTimeClockProxy.FindRealTimeClock(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a real-time clock for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the real-time clock is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YRealTimeClock.isOnline() to test if the real-time clock is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a real-time clock by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the real-time clock, for instance YHUBGSM3.realTimeClock.
member.returns: a YRealTimeClock object allowing you to drive the real-time clock.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRealTimeClockProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type RealTimeClock available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YRealTimeClock.FindRealTimeClock to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRealTimeClock.DATETIME_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy
member.summary:
The YRefFrame class is used to setup the base orientation of the Yoctopuce inertial sensors.
Thanks to this, orientation functions relative to the earth surface plane can use the proper reference frame. For some devices, the class also implements a tridimensional sensor calibration process, which can compensate for local variations of standard gravity and improve the precision of the tilt sensors.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.FindRefFrame(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a reference frame for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the reference frame is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YRefFrame.isOnline() to test if the reference frame is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a reference frame by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the reference frame, for instance Y3DMK002.refFrame.
member.returns: a YRefFrame object allowing you to drive the reference frame.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type RefFrame available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YRefFrame.FindRefFrame to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.set_bearing(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the reference bearing used by the compass.
The relative bearing indicated by the compass is the difference between the measured magnetic heading and the reference bearing indicated here.
For instance, if you setup as reference bearing the value of the earth magnetic declination, the compass will provide the orientation relative to the geographic North.
Similarly, when the sensor is not mounted along the standard directions because it has an additional yaw angle, you can set this angle in the reference bearing so that the compass provides the expected natural direction.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the reference bearing used by the compass
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_bearing
member.summary:
Returns the reference bearing used by the compass.
The relative bearing indicated by the compass is the difference between the measured magnetic heading and the reference bearing indicated here.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the reference bearing used by the compass
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRefFrame.BEARING_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.Bearing
member.value: Reference bearing used by the compass. The relative bearing

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_fusionMode
member.summary:
Returns the sensor fusion mode.
Note that available sensor fusion modes depend on the sensor type.
member.returns: a value among YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_NDOF, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_NDOF_FMC_OFF, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_M4G, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_COMPASS, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_IMU, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_90DEG_1G8, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_90DEG_3G6 and YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_10DEG corresponding to the sensor fusion mode
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.set_fusionMode(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Change the sensor fusion mode.
Note that available sensor fusion modes depend on the sensor type. Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method to save the setting permanently.
member.param: a value among YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_NDOF, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_NDOF_FMC_OFF, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_M4G, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_COMPASS, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_IMU, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_90DEG_1G8, YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_90DEG_3G6 and YRefFrame.FUSIONMODE_INCLIN_10DEG
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.FusionMode
member.value: Sensor fusion mode. Note that available sensor fusion modes depend on the sensor type.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_mountPosition
member.summary: Returns the installation position of the device, as configured in order to define the reference frame for the compass and the pitch/roll tilt sensors.
member.returns: a value among the YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION enumeration (YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_BOTTOM, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_TOP, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_FRONT, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_RIGHT, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_REAR, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_LEFT), corresponding to the installation in a box, on one of the six faces.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns refframe._Mountposition_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_mountOrientation
member.summary: Returns the installation orientation of the device, as configured in order to define the reference frame for the compass and the pitch/roll tilt sensors.
member.returns: a value among the enumeration YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION (YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_TWELVE, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_THREE, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_SIX, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_NINE) corresponding to the orientation of the "X" arrow on the device, as on a clock dial seen from an observer in the center of the box. On the bottom face, the 12H orientation points to the front, while on the top face, the 12H orientation points to the rear.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns refframe._Mountorientation_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.set_mountPosition(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the compass and tilt sensor frame of reference.
The magnetic compass and the tilt sensors (pitch and roll) naturally work in the plane parallel to the earth surface. In case the device is not installed upright and horizontally, you must select its reference orientation (parallel to the earth surface) so that the measures are made relative to this position.
member.param: a value among the YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION enumeration (YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_BOTTOM, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_TOP, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_FRONT, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_RIGHT, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_REAR, YRefFrame.MOUNTPOSITION_LEFT), corresponding to the installation in a box, on one of the six faces.

a value among the enumeration YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION (YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_TWELVE, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_THREE, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_SIX, YRefFrame.MOUNTORIENTATION_NINE) corresponding to the orientation of the "X" arrow on the device, as on a clock dial seen from an observer in the center of the box. On the bottom face, the 12H orientation points to the front, while on the top face, the 12H orientation points to the rear.
member.para: Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_calibrationState
member.summary:
Returns the 3D sensor calibration state (Yocto-3D-V2 only).
This function returns an integer representing the calibration state of the 3 inertial sensors of the BNO055 chip, found in the Yocto-3D-V2. Hundredths show the calibration state of the accelerometer, tenths show the calibration state of the magnetometer while units show the calibration state of the gyroscope. For each sensor, the value 0 means no calibration and the value 3 means full calibration.
member.returns: an integer representing the calibration state of Yocto-3D-V2: 333 when fully calibrated, 0 when not calibrated at all.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code. For the Yocto-3D (V1), this function always return -3 (unsupported function).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_measureQuality
member.summary:
Returns estimated quality of the orientation (Yocto-3D-V2 only).
This function returns an integer between 0 and 3 representing the degree of confidence of the position estimate. When the value is 3, the estimation is reliable. Below 3, one should expect sudden corrections, in particular for heading (compass function). The most frequent causes for values below 3 are magnetic interferences, and accelerations or rotations beyond the sensor range.
member.returns: an integer between 0 and 3 (3 when the measure is reliable)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code. For the Yocto-3D (V1), this function always return -3 (unsupported function).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.start3DCalibration
member.summary:
Initiates the sensors tridimensional calibration process.
This calibration is used at low level for inertial position estimation and to enhance the precision of the tilt sensors.
After calling this method, the device should be moved according to the instructions provided by method get_3DCalibrationHint, and more3DCalibration should be invoked about 5 times per second. The calibration procedure is completed when the method get_3DCalibrationProgress returns 100. At this point, the computed calibration parameters can be applied using method save3DCalibration. The calibration process can be cancelled at any time using method cancel3DCalibration.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.more3DCalibration
member.summary:
Continues the sensors tridimensional calibration process previously initiated using method start3DCalibration.
This method should be called approximately 5 times per second, while positioning the device according to the instructions provided by method get_3DCalibrationHint. Note that the instructions change during the calibration process.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_3DCalibrationHint
member.summary: Returns instructions to proceed to the tridimensional calibration initiated with method start3DCalibration.
member.returns: a character string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_3DCalibrationProgress
member.summary: Returns the global process indicator for the tridimensional calibration initiated with method start3DCalibration.
member.returns: an integer between 0 (not started) and 100 (stage completed).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_3DCalibrationStage
member.summary: Returns index of the current stage of the calibration initiated with method start3DCalibration.
member.returns: an integer, growing each time a calibration stage is completed.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_3DCalibrationStageProgress
member.summary: Returns the process indicator for the current stage of the calibration initiated with method start3DCalibration.
member.returns: an integer between 0 (not started) and 100 (stage completed).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.get_3DCalibrationLogMsg
member.summary:
Returns the latest log message from the calibration process.
When no new message is available, returns an empty string.
member.returns: a character string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.save3DCalibration
member.summary:
Applies the sensors tridimensional calibration parameters that have just been computed.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the changes must be kept when the device is restarted.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRefFrameProxy.cancel3DCalibration
member.summary:
Aborts the sensors tridimensional calibration process et restores normal settings.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YRelayProxy
member.summary:
The YRelay class allows you to drive a Yoctopuce relay or optocoupled output.
It can be used to simply switch the output on or off, but also to automatically generate short pulses of determined duration. On devices with two output for each relay (double throw), the two outputs are named A and B, with output A corresponding to the idle position (normally closed) and the output B corresponding to the active state (normally open).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRelayProxy.FindRelay(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a relay for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the relay is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YRelay.isOnline() to test if the relay is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a relay by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the relay, for instance YLTCHRL1.relay1.
member.returns: a YRelay object allowing you to drive the relay.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRelayProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Relay available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YRelay.FindRelay to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary: Returns the state of the relays (A for the idle position, B for the active position).
member.returns: either YRelay.STATE_A or YRelay.STATE_B, according to the state of the relays (A for the idle position, B for the active position)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YRelay.STATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YRelayProxy.set_state(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the state of the relays (A for the idle position, B for the active position).
member.param: either YRelay.STATE_A or YRelay.STATE_B, according to the state of the relays (A for the idle position, B for the active position)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YRelayProxy.State

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YSegmentedDisplayProxy
member.summary: The SegmentedDisplay class allows you to drive segmented displays.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSegmentedDisplayProxy.FindSegmentedDisplay(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a segmented display for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the segmented display is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YSegmentedDisplay.isOnline() to test if the segmented display is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a segmented display by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the segmented display, for instance MyDevice.segmentedDisplay.
member.returns: a YSegmentedDisplay object allowing you to drive the segmented display.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSegmentedDisplayProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type SegmentedDisplay available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YSegmentedDisplay.FindSegmentedDisplay to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSegmentedDisplayProxy.get_displayedText
member.summary: Returns the text currently displayed on the screen.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the text currently displayed on the screen
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSegmentedDisplay.DISPLAYEDTEXT_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSegmentedDisplayProxy.set_displayedText(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the text currently displayed on the screen.
member.param: a string corresponding to the text currently displayed on the screen
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy
member.summary:
The YSerialPort class allows you to fully drive a Yoctopuce serial port.
It can be used to send and receive data, and to configure communication parameters (baud rate, bit count, parity, flow control and protocol). Note that Yoctopuce serial ports are not exposed as virtual COM ports. They are meant to be used in the same way as all Yoctopuce devices.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.FindSerialPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a serial port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the serial port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YSerialPort.isOnline() to test if the serial port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a serial port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the serial port, for instance RS232MK1.serialPort.
member.returns: a YSerialPort object allowing you to drive the serial port.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type SerialPort available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YSerialPort.FindSerialPort to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "StxEtx" for ASCII messages delimited by STX/ETX codes, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Modbus-ASCII" for MODBUS messages in ASCII mode, "Modbus-RTU" for MODBUS messages in RTU mode, "Wiegand-ASCII" for Wiegand messages in ASCII mode, "Wiegand-26","Wiegand-34", etc for Wiegand messages in byte mode, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "StxEtx" for ASCII messages delimited by STX/ETX codes, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Modbus-ASCII" for MODBUS messages in ASCII mode, "Modbus-RTU" for MODBUS messages in RTU mode, "Wiegand-ASCII" for Wiegand messages in ASCII mode, "Wiegand-26","Wiegand-34", etc for Wiegand messages in byte mode, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.Protocol
member.value: Type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
