member.summary: Returns the voltage level used on the serial line.
member.returns: a value among YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage level used on the serial line
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.set_voltageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the voltage type used on the serial line.
Valid values will depend on the Yoctopuce device model featuring the serial port feature. Check your device documentation to find out which values are valid for that specific model. Trying to set an invalid value will have no effect. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSerialPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage type used on the serial line
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.VoltageLevel
member.value: Voltage level used on the serial line.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.get_serialMode
member.summary:
Returns the serial port communication parameters, as a string such as "9600,8N1".
The string includes the baud rate, the number of data bits, the parity, and the number of stop bits. An optional suffix is included if flow control is active: "CtsRts" for hardware handshake, "XOnXOff" for logical flow control and "Simplex" for acquiring a shared bus using the RTS line (as used by some RS485 adapters for instance).
member.returns: a string corresponding to the serial port communication parameters, as a string such as "9600,8N1"
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSerialPort.SERIALMODE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.set_serialMode(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the serial port communication parameters, with a string such as "9600,8N1".
The string includes the baud rate, the number of data bits, the parity, and the number of stop bits. An optional suffix can be added to enable flow control: "CtsRts" for hardware handshake, "XOnXOff" for logical flow control and "Simplex" for acquiring a shared bus using the RTS line (as used by some RS485 adapters for instance). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the serial port communication parameters, with a string such as "9600,8N1"
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.SerialMode
member.value: Serial port communication parameters, as a string such as

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().

a string containing a JSON definition of the job

Load and start processing the specified job file.

member.summary:
Manually sets the state of the RTS line.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.get_CTS
member.summary:
Reads the level of the CTS line.
The CTS line is usually driven by the RTS signal of the connected serial device.
member.returns: 1 if the CTS line is high, 0 if the CTS line is low.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.snoopMessages(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Retrieves messages (both direction) in the serial port buffer, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
If no message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of YSnoopingRecord objects containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.writeStxEtx(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ASCII string to the serial port, preceeded with an STX code and followed by an ETX code.
member.param: the text string to send
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.writeMODBUS(System.String)
member.summary:
Sends a MODBUS message (provided as a hexadecimal string) to the serial port.
The message must start with the slave address. The MODBUS CRC/LRC is automatically added by the function. This function does not wait for a reply.
member.param: a hexadecimal message string, including device address but no CRC/LRC
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.queryMODBUS(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Sends a message to a specified MODBUS slave connected to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
The message is the PDU, provided as a vector of bytes.
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to query
the message to send (PDU), as a vector of bytes. The first byte of the PDU is the MODBUS function code.
member.returns: the received reply, as a vector of bytes.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array (or a MODBUS error reply).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusReadBits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads one or more contiguous internal bits (or coil status) from a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x01 (Read Coils).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to query
the relative address of the first bit/coil to read (zero-based)
the number of bits/coils to read
member.returns: a vector of integers, each corresponding to one bit.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusReadInputBits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads one or more contiguous input bits (or discrete inputs) from a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x02 (Read Discrete Inputs).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to query
the relative address of the first bit/input to read (zero-based)
the number of bits/inputs to read
member.returns: a vector of integers, each corresponding to one bit.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusReadRegisters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads one or more contiguous internal registers (holding registers) from a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x03 (Read Holding Registers).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to query
the relative address of the first holding register to read (zero-based)
the number of holding registers to read
member.returns: a vector of integers, each corresponding to one 16-bit register value.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusReadInputRegisters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads one or more contiguous input registers (read-only registers) from a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x04 (Read Input Registers).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to query
the relative address of the first input register to read (zero-based)
the number of input registers to read
member.returns: a vector of integers, each corresponding to one 16-bit input value.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusWriteBit(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets a single internal bit (or coil) on a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x05 (Write Single Coil).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to drive
the relative address of the bit/coil to set (zero-based)
the value to set (0 for OFF state, non-zero for ON state)
member.returns: the number of bits/coils affected on the device (1)

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusWriteBits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Sets several contiguous internal bits (or coils) on a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x0f (Write Multiple Coils).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to drive
the relative address of the first bit/coil to set (zero-based)
the vector of bits to be set (one integer per bit)
member.returns: the number of bits/coils affected on the device
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns zero.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusWriteRegister(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets a single internal register (or holding register) on a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x06 (Write Single Register).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to drive
the relative address of the register to set (zero-based)
the 16 bit value to set

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns zero.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusWriteRegisters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Sets several contiguous internal registers (or holding registers) on a MODBUS serial device.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x10 (Write Multiple Registers).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to drive
the relative address of the first internal register to set (zero-based)
the vector of 16 bit values to set

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSerialPortProxy.modbusWriteAndReadRegisters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets several contiguous internal registers (holding registers) on a MODBUS serial device, then performs a contiguous read of a set of (possibly different) internal registers.
This method uses the MODBUS function code 0x17 (Read/Write Multiple Registers).
member.param: the address of the slave MODBUS device to drive
the relative address of the first internal register to set (zero-based)
the vector of 16 bit values to set

member.returns: a vector of integers, each corresponding to one 16-bit register value read.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy
member.summary:
The YServo class is designed to drive remote-control servo motors outputs.
This class allows you not only to move a servo to a given position, but also to specify the time interval in which the move should be performed. This makes it possible to synchronize two servos involved in a same move.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.FindServo(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a RC servo motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the RC servo motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YServo.isOnline() to test if the RC servo motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a RC servo motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the RC servo motor, for instance SERVORC1.servo1.
member.returns: a YServo object allowing you to drive the RC servo motor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Servo available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YServo.FindServo to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.summary: Stops or starts the RC servo motor.
member.param: either YServo.ENABLED_FALSE or YServo.ENABLED_TRUE
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.get_range
member.summary: Returns the current range of use of the servo.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the current range of use of the servo
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.RANGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.set_range(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the range of use of the servo, specified in per cents.
A range of 100% corresponds to a standard control signal, that varies from 1 [ms] to 2 [ms], When using a servo that supports a double range, from 0.5 [ms] to 2.5 [ms], you can select a range of 200%. Be aware that using a range higher than what is supported by the servo is likely to damage the servo. Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call will have no effect.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the range of use of the servo, specified in per cents
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.Range
member.value: Current range of use of the servo.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.get_neutral
member.summary: Returns the duration in microseconds of a neutral pulse for the servo.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the duration in microseconds of a neutral pulse for the servo
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YServo.NEUTRAL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.set_neutral(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the duration of the pulse corresponding to the neutral position of the servo.
The duration is specified in microseconds, and the standard value is 1500 [us]. This setting makes it possible to shift the range of use of the servo. Be aware that using a range higher than what is supported by the servo is likely to damage the servo. Remember to call the matching module saveToFlash() method, otherwise this call will have no effect.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the duration of the pulse corresponding to the neutral position of the servo
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YServoProxy.Neutral
member.value: Duration in microseconds of a neutral pulse for the servo.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy
member.summary:
The YSpiPort class allows you to fully drive a Yoctopuce SPI port.
It can be used to send and receive data, and to configure communication parameters (baud rate, bit count, parity, flow control and protocol). Note that Yoctopuce SPI ports are not exposed as virtual COM ports. They are meant to be used in the same way as all Yoctopuce devices.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.FindSpiPort(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a SPI port for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the SPI port is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YSpiPort.isOnline() to test if the SPI port is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a SPI port by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the SPI port, for instance YSPIMK01.spiPort.
member.returns: a YSpiPort object allowing you to drive the SPI port.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type SpiPort available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YSpiPort.FindSpiPort to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.get_protocol
member.summary:
Returns the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.PROTOCOL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.set_protocol(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the type of protocol used over the serial line.
Possible values are "Line" for ASCII messages separated by CR and/or LF, "Frame:[timeout]ms" for binary messages separated by a delay time, "Char" for a continuous ASCII stream or "Byte" for a continuous binary stream. The suffix "/[wait]ms" can be added to reduce the transmit rate so that there is always at lest the specified number of milliseconds between each bytes sent. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the type of protocol used over the serial line
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.Protocol
member.value: Type of protocol used over the serial line, as a string.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.set_voltageLevel(System.Int32)

Changes the voltage type used on the serial line.
Valid values will depend on the Yoctopuce device model featuring the serial port feature. Check your device documentation to find out which values are valid for that specific model. Trying to set an invalid value will have no effect. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_OFF, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL3VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5V, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL5VR, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS232, YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_RS485 and YSpiPort.VOLTAGELEVEL_TTL1V8 corresponding to the voltage type used on the serial line
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readLine
member.summary:
Reads a single line (or message) from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for a message protocol, such as 'Line' mode or frame protocols.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function returns the oldest available line and moves the stream position just after. If no new full line is received, the function returns an empty line.
member.returns: a string with a single line of text
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readMessages(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for incoming messages in the serial port receive buffer matching a given pattern, starting at current position.
This function will only compare and return printable characters in the message strings. Binary protocols are handled as hexadecimal strings.
The search returns all messages matching the expression provided as argument in the buffer. If no matching message is found, the search waits for one up to the specified maximum timeout (in milliseconds).
member.param: a limited regular expression describing the expected message format, or an empty string if all messages should be returned (no filtering). When using binary protocols, the format applies to the hexadecimal representation of the message.
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a message if none is found in the receive buffer.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the messages found, if any. Binary messages are converted to hexadecimal representation.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty array.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.read_seek(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current internal stream position to the specified value.
This function does not affect the device, it only changes the value stored in the API object for the next read operations.
member.param: the absolute position index for next read operations.
member.returns: nothing.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.read_tell
member.summary: Returns the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the absolute position index for next read operations.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.read_avail
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes available to read in the input buffer starting from the current absolute stream position pointer of the API object.
member.returns: the number of bytes available to read

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.queryLine(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a text line query to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for 'Line' protocol.
member.param: the line query to send (without CR/LF)
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next text line received after sending the text query, as a string. Additional lines can be obtained by calling readLine or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.queryHex(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends a binary message to the serial port, and reads the reply, if any.
This function is intended to be used when the serial port is configured for Frame-based protocol.
member.param: the message to send, coded in hexadecimal
the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a reply.
member.returns: the next frame received after sending the message, as a hex string. Additional frames can be obtained by calling readHex or readMessages.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.uploadJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the job definition string (JSON data) into a job file.
The job file can be later enabled using selectJob().
member.param: name of the job file to save on the device filesystem
a string containing a JSON definition of the job
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.selectJob(System.String)
member.summary:
Load and start processing the specified job file.
The file must have been previously created using the user interface or uploaded on the device filesystem using the uploadJob() function.
member.param: name of the job file (on the device filesystem)
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary: Clears the serial port buffer and resets counters to zero.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readByte
member.summary:
Reads one byte from the receive buffer, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, or if there is no data available yet, the function returns YAPI.NO_MORE_DATA.
member.returns: the next byte
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readStr(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a string, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of characters to read
member.returns: a string with receive buffer contents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readBin(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a binary buffer, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to read
member.returns: a binary object with receive buffer contents
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readArray(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a list of bytes, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to read
member.returns: a sequence of bytes with receive buffer contents

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSpiPortProxy.readHex(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads data from the receive buffer as a hexadecimal string, starting at current stream position.
If data at current stream position is not available anymore in the receive buffer, the function performs a short read.
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to read
member.returns: a string with receive buffer contents, encoded in hexadecimal
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Manually sets the state of the SS line.
This function has no effect when the SS line is handled automatically.

Retrieves messages (both direction) in the SPI port buffer, starting at current position.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy
member.summary: The YStepperMotor class allows you to drive a stepper motor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.FindStepperMotor(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a stepper motor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the stepper motor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YStepperMotor.isOnline() to test if the stepper motor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a stepper motor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the stepper motor, for instance MyDevice.stepperMotor1.
member.returns: a YStepperMotor object allowing you to drive the stepper motor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type StepperMotor available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YStepperMotor.FindStepperMotor to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.get_motorState
member.summary: Returns the motor working state.
member.returns: a value among YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_ABSENT, YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_ALERT, YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_HI_Z, YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_STOP, YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_RUN and YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_BATCH corresponding to the motor working state
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.MOTORSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.get_diags
member.summary: Returns the stepper motor controller diagnostics, as a bitmap.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the stepper motor controller diagnostics, as a bitmap
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.DIAGS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.set_stepPos(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the current logical motor position, measured in steps.
This command does not cause any motor move, as its purpose is only to setup the origin of the position counter. The fractional part of the position, that corresponds to the physical position of the rotor, is not changed. To trigger a motor move, use methods moveTo() or moveRel() instead.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the current logical motor position, measured in steps
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.get_stepPos
member.summary:
Returns the current logical motor position, measured in steps.
The value may include a fractional part when micro-stepping is in use.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current logical motor position, measured in steps
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.STEPPOS_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.get_speed
member.summary:
Returns current motor speed, measured in steps per second.
To change speed, use method changeSpeed().
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to current motor speed, measured in steps per second
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.SPEED_INVALID.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YStepperMotor.PULLINSPEED_INVALID.

member.summary:
Starts the motor at a given speed.
The time needed to reach the requested speed will depend on the acceleration parameters configured for the motor.

member.summary:
Starts the motor to reach a given absolute position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration and max speed parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: absolute position, measured in steps from the origin.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Starts the motor to reach a given relative position.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration and max speed parameters configured for the motor.

Starts the motor to reach a given relative position, keeping the speed under the specified limit.
The time needed to reach the requested position will depend on the acceleration parameters configured for the motor.
member.param: relative position, measured in steps from the current position.
limit speed, in steps per second.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.emergencyStop

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.alertStepOut
member.summary:
Move one step in the direction opposite the direction set when the most recent alert was raised.
The move occurs even if the system is still in alert mode (end switch depressed). Caution. use this function with great care as it may cause mechanical damages !
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.alertStepDir(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Move one single step in the selected direction without regards to end switches.
The move occurs even if the system is still in alert mode (end switch depressed). Caution. use this function with great care as it may cause mechanical damages !
member.param: Value +1 or -1, according to the desired direction of the move
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.abortAndBrake
member.summary: Stops the motor smoothly as soon as possible, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YStepperMotorProxy.abortAndHiZ
member.summary: Turn the controller into Hi-Z mode immediately, without waiting for ongoing move completion.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds. On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy
member.summary:
The YTemperature class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce temperature sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger. This class adds the ability to configure some specific parameters for some sensors (connection type, temperature mapping table).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.FindTemperature(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a temperature sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the temperature sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YTemperature.isOnline() to test if the temperature sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a temperature sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the temperature sensor, for instance METEOMK2.temperature.
member.returns: a YTemperature object allowing you to drive the temperature sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Temperature available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YTemperature.FindTemperature to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.set_unit(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the measured temperature.
That unit is a string. If that strings end with the letter F all temperatures values will returned in Fahrenheit degrees. If that String ends with the letter K all values will be returned in Kelvin degrees. If that string ends with the letter C all values will be returned in Celsius degrees. If the string ends with any other character the change will be ignored. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept. WARNING: if a specific calibration is defined for the temperature function, a unit system change will probably break it.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the measured temperature
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.get_sensorType
member.summary: Returns the temperature sensor type.
member.returns: a value among YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_DIGITAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_K, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_E, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_J, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_N, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_R, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_S, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_T, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_4WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_3WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_2WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_OHM, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_NTC, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_LINEAR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_INTERNAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_IR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_PT1000 and YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_CHANNEL_OFF corresponding to the temperature sensor type
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.set_sensorType(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the temperature sensor type.
This function is used to define the type of thermocouple (K,E...) used with the device. It has no effect if module is using a digital sensor or a thermistor. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a value among YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_DIGITAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_K, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_E, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_J, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_N, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_R, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_S, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_TYPE_T, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_4WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_3WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_PT100_2WIRES, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_OHM, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_NTC, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_LINEAR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_INTERNAL, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_IR, YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_RES_PT1000 and YTemperature.SENSORTYPE_CHANNEL_OFF corresponding to the temperature sensor type
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.SensorType
member.value: Temperature sensor type.

member.summary: Returns the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the current value of the electrical signal measured by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SIGNALVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.get_signalUnit
member.summary: Returns the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTemperature.SIGNALUNIT_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.SignalUnit
member.value: Measuring unit of the electrical signal used by the sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.set_ntcParameters(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Configures NTC thermistor parameters in order to properly compute the temperature from the measured resistance.
For increased precision, you can enter a complete mapping table using set_thermistorResponseTable. This function can only be used with a temperature sensor based on thermistors.
member.param: thermistor resistance at 25 degrees Celsius
Beta value
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTemperatureProxy.set_thermistorResponseTable(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary:
Records a thermistor response table, in order to interpolate the temperature from the measured resistance.
This function can only be used with a temperature sensor based on thermistors.
member.param: array of floating point numbers, corresponding to all temperatures (in degrees Celsius) for which the resistance of the thermistor is specified.
array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the resistance values (in Ohms) for each of the temperature included in the first argument, index by index.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy
member.summary:
The YSensor class is the parent class for all Yoctopuce sensor types.
It can be used to read the current value and unit of any sensor, read the min/max value, configure autonomous recording frequency and access recorded data. It also provide a function to register a callback invoked each time the observed value changes, or at a predefined interval. Using this class rather than a specific subclass makes it possible to create generic applications that work with any Yoctopuce sensor, even those that do not yet exist. Note: The YAnButton class is the only analog input which does not inherit from YSensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.FindTilt(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a tilt sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the tilt sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YTilt.isOnline() to test if the tilt sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a tilt sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the tilt sensor, for instance Y3DMK002.tilt1.
member.returns: a YTilt object allowing you to drive the tilt sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Tilt available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YTilt.FindTilt to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.get_bandwidth
member.summary: Returns the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YTilt.BANDWIDTH_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.set_bandwidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the measure update frequency, measured in Hz.
When the frequency is lower, the device performs averaging. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: an integer corresponding to the measure update frequency, measured in Hz
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.Bandwidth
member.value: Measure update frequency, measured in Hz.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.calibrateToZero
member.summary:
Performs a zero calibration for the tilt measurement (Yocto-Inclinometer only).
When this method is invoked, a simple shift (translation) is applied so that the current position is reported as a zero angle. Be aware that this shift will also affect the measurement boundaries.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTiltProxy.restoreZeroCalibration
member.summary:
Cancels any previous zero calibration for the tilt measurement (Yocto-Inclinometer only).
This function restores the factory zero calibration.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YTvocProxy
member.summary:
The YTvoc class allows you to read and configure Yoctopuce Total Volatile Organic Compound sensors.
It inherits from YSensor class the core functions to read measurements, to register callback functions, and to access the autonomous datalogger.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTvocProxy.FindTvoc(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YTvoc.isOnline() to test if the Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor, for instance YVOCMK03.tvoc.
member.returns: a YTvoc object allowing you to drive the Total Volatile Organic Compound sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YTvocProxy.GetSimilarFunctions

Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YTvoc.FindTvoc to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YVoltageProxy.get_enabled
member.summary: Returns the activation state of this input.
member.returns: either YVoltage.ENABLED_FALSE or YVoltage.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this input
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YVoltage.ENABLED_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YVoltageProxy.set_enabled(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the activation state of this voltage input.
When AC measurements are disabled, the device will always assume a DC signal, and vice-versa. When both AC and DC measurements are active, the device switches between AC and DC mode based on the relative amplitude of variations compared to the average value. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: either YVoltage.ENABLED_FALSE or YVoltage.ENABLED_TRUE, according to the activation state of this voltage input
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YVoltageProxy.Enabled
member.value: Activation state of this input.

member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YWatchdogProxy
member.summary:
The YWatchdog class allows you to drive a Yoctopuce watchdog.
A watchdog works like a relay, with an extra timer that can automatically trigger a brief power cycle to an appliance after a preset delay, to force this appliance to reset if a problem occurs. During normal use, the watchdog timer is reset periodically by the application to prevent the automated power cycle. Whenever the application dies, the watchdog will automatically trigger the power cycle. The watchdog can also be driven directly with pulse and delayedPulse methods to switch off an appliance for a given duration.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWatchdogProxy.FindWatchdog(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a watchdog for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the watchdog is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YWatchdog.isOnline() to test if the watchdog is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a watchdog by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the watchdog, for instance WDOGDC01.watchdog1.
member.returns: a YWatchdog object allowing you to drive the watchdog.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWatchdogProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Watchdog available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YWatchdog.FindWatchdog to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWatchdog.STATE_INVALID.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy
member.summary:
The YWeighScale class provides a weight measurement from a ratiometric sensor.
It can be used to control the bridge excitation parameters, in order to avoid measure shifts caused by temperature variation in the electronics, and can also automatically apply an additional correction factor based on temperature to compensate for offsets in the load cell itself.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.FindWeighScale(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a weighing scale sensor for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the weighing scale sensor is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YWeighScale.isOnline() to test if the weighing scale sensor is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a weighing scale sensor by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the weighing scale sensor, for instance YWBRIDG1.weighScale1.
member.returns: a YWeighScale object allowing you to drive the weighing scale sensor.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type WeighScale available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YWeighScale.FindWeighScale to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.

member.summary:
Changes the measuring unit for the weight.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the measuring unit for the weight
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWeighScale.EXCITATION_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.set_excitation(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Changes the current load cell bridge excitation method.

member.param: a value among YWeighScale.EXCITATION_OFF, YWeighScale.EXCITATION_DC and YWeighScale.EXCITATION_AC corresponding to the current load cell bridge excitation method
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.Excitation
member.value: Current load cell bridge excitation method.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.set_tempAvgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.get_tempAvgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.
The purpose of this adaptation ratio is to model the thermal inertia of the load cell. The averaged temperature is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current compensation temperature. The standard rate is 0.2 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the averaged temperature update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWeighScale.TEMPAVGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.TempAvgAdaptRatio
member.value: Averaged temperature update rate, in per mille.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.set_tempChgAdaptRatio(System.Double)
member.summary:
Changes the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.get_tempChgAdaptRatio
member.summary:
Returns the temperature change update rate, in per mille.
The temperature change is updated every 10 seconds, by applying this adaptation rate to the difference between the measures ambient temperature and the current temperature used for change compensation. The standard rate is 0.6 per mille, and the maximal rate is 65 per mille.
member.returns: a floating point number corresponding to the temperature change update rate, in per mille
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWeighScale.TEMPCHGADAPTRATIO_INVALID.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YWeighScaleProxy.TempChgAdaptRatio
member.value: Temperature change update rate, in per mille.

member.summary:
Records a weight offset thermal compensation table, in order to automatically correct the measured weight based on the averaged compensation temperature.
The weight correction will be applied by linear interpolation between specified points.

The weight correction will be applied by linear interpolation between specified points.

array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the offset correction to apply for each of the temperature variation included in the first argument, index by index.

The weight correction will be applied by linear interpolation between specified points.

array of floating point numbers, corresponding to the span correction (in percents) to apply for each of the temperature included in the first argument, index by index.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy
member.summary:
The YWireless class provides control over wireless network parameters and status for devices that are wireless-enabled.
Note that TCP/IP parameters are configured separately, using class YNetwork.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.FindWireless(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a wireless LAN interface for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the wireless LAN interface is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YWireless.isOnline() to test if the wireless LAN interface is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a wireless LAN interface by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the wireless LAN interface, for instance YHUBWLN1.wireless.
member.returns: a YWireless object allowing you to drive the wireless LAN interface.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumerates all functions of type Wireless available on the devices currently reachable by the library, and returns their unique hardware ID.
Each of these IDs can be provided as argument to the method YWireless.FindWireless to obtain an object that can control the corresponding device.
member.returns: an array of strings, each string containing the unique hardwareId of a device function currently connected.
