member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWireless.SSID_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.get_channel
member.summary: Returns the 802.11 channel currently used, or 0 when the selected network has not been found.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the 802.11 channel currently used, or 0 when the selected network has not been found
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWireless.CHANNEL_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.get_security
member.summary: Returns the security algorithm used by the selected wireless network.
member.returns: a value among YWireless.SECURITY_UNKNOWN, YWireless.SECURITY_OPEN, YWireless.SECURITY_WEP, YWireless.SECURITY_WPA and YWireless.SECURITY_WPA2 corresponding to the security algorithm used by the selected wireless network
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWireless.SECURITY_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.get_message
member.summary: Returns the latest status message from the wireless interface.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the latest status message from the wireless interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWireless.MESSAGE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.get_wlanState
member.summary:
Returns the current state of the wireless interface.
The state YWireless.WLANSTATE_DOWN means that the network interface is not connected to a network. The state YWireless.WLANSTATE_SCANNING means that the network interface is scanning available frequencies. During this stage, the device is not reachable, and the network settings are not yet applied. The state YWireless.WLANSTATE_CONNECTED means that the network settings have been successfully applied ant that the device is reachable from the wireless network. If the device is configured to use ad-hoc or Soft AP mode, it means that the wireless network is up and that other devices can join the network. The state YWireless.WLANSTATE_REJECTED means that the network interface has not been able to join the requested network. The description of the error can be obtain with the get_message() method.
member.returns: a value among YWireless.WLANSTATE_DOWN, YWireless.WLANSTATE_SCANNING, YWireless.WLANSTATE_CONNECTED and YWireless.WLANSTATE_REJECTED corresponding to the current state of the wireless interface
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YWireless.WLANSTATE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.startWlanScan
member.summary:
Triggers a scan of the wireless frequency and builds the list of available networks.
The scan forces a disconnection from the current network. At then end of the process, the the network interface attempts to reconnect to the previous network. During the scan, the wlanState switches to YWireless.WLANSTATE_DOWN, then to YWireless.WLANSTATE_SCANNING. When the scan is completed, get_wlanState() returns either YWireless.WLANSTATE_DOWN or YWireless.WLANSTATE_SCANNING. At this point, the list of detected network can be retrieved with the get_detectedWlans() method.
On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.joinNetwork(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the wireless lan interface to connect to an existing access point (infrastructure mode).
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.param: the name of the network to connect to
the network key, as a character string
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.adhocNetwork(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the wireless lan interface to create an ad-hoc wireless network, without using an access point.
On the YoctoHub-Wireless-g and YoctoHub-Wireless-n, you should use softAPNetwork() instead, which emulates an access point (Soft AP) which is more efficient and more widely supported than ad-hoc networks.
When a security key is specified for an ad-hoc network, the network is protected by a WEP40 key (5 characters or 10 hexadecimal digits) or WEP128 key (13 characters or 26 hexadecimal digits). It is recommended to use a well-randomized WEP128 key using 26 hexadecimal digits to maximize security. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.param: the name of the network to connect to
the network key, as a character string
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.softAPNetwork(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the configuration of the wireless lan interface to create a new wireless network by emulating a WiFi access point (Soft AP).
This function can only be used with the YoctoHub-Wireless-g and the YoctoHub-Wireless-n.
On the YoctoHub-Wireless-g, when a security key is specified for a SoftAP network, the network is protected by a WEP40 key (5 characters or 10 hexadecimal digits) or WEP128 key (13 characters or 26 hexadecimal digits). It is recommended to use a well-randomized WEP128 key using 26 hexadecimal digits to maximize security.
On the YoctoHub-Wireless-n, when a security key is specified for a SoftAP network, the network will be protected by WPA2.
Remember to call the saveToFlash() method and then to reboot the module to apply this setting.
member.param: the name of the network to connect to
the network key, as a character string
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWirelessProxy.get_detectedWlans
member.summary:
Returns a list of YWlanRecord objects that describe detected Wireless networks.
This list is not updated when the module is already connected to an access point (infrastructure mode). To force an update of this list, startWlanScan() must be called. Note that an languages without garbage collections, the returned list must be freed by the caller.
member.returns: a list of YWlanRecord objects, containing the SSID, channel, link quality and the type of security of the wireless network.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty list.

member.name: T:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy
member.summary:
This is the parent class for all public objects representing device functions documented in the high-level programming API.
This abstract class does all the real job, but without knowledge of the specific function attributes.
Instantiating a child class of YFunction does not cause any communication. The instance simply keeps track of its function identifier, and will dynamically bind to a matching device at the time it is really being used to read or set an attribute. In order to allow true hot-plug replacement of one device by another, the binding stay dynamic through the life of the object.
The YFunction class implements a generic high-level cache for the attribute values of the specified function, pre-parsed from the REST API string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.FindFunction(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves a function for a given identifier.
The identifier can be specified using several formats:
- FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleSerialNumber.FunctionLogicalName
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionIdentifier
- ModuleLogicalName.FunctionLogicalName
This function does not require that the function is online at the time it is invoked. The returned object is nevertheless valid. Use the method YFunction.isOnline() to test if the function is indeed online at a given time. In case of ambiguity when looking for a function by logical name, no error is notified: the first instance found is returned. The search is performed first by hardware name, then by logical name.
If a call to this object's is_online() method returns FALSE although you are certain that the matching device is plugged, make sure that you did call registerHub() at application initialization time.
member.param: a string that uniquely characterizes the function, for instance MyDevice..
member.returns: a YFunction object allowing you to drive the function.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_hardwareId
member.summary:
Returns the unique hardware identifier of the function in the form SERIAL.FUNCTIONID.
The unique hardware identifier is composed of the device serial number and of the hardware identifier of the function (for example RELAYLO1-123456.relay1).
member.returns: a string that uniquely identifies the function (ex: RELAYLO1-123456.relay1)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.HARDWAREID_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_functionId
member.summary:
Returns the hardware identifier of the function, without reference to the module.
For example relay1
member.returns: a string that identifies the function (ex: relay1)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.FUNCTIONID_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_friendlyName
member.summary:
Returns a global identifier of the function in the format MODULE_NAME.FUNCTION_NAME.
The returned string uses the logical names of the module and of the function if they are defined, otherwise the serial number of the module and the hardware identifier of the function (for example: MyCustomName.relay1)
member.returns: a string that uniquely identifies the function using logical names (ex: MyCustomName.relay1)
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.FRIENDLYNAME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.isOnline
member.summary:
Checks if the function is currently reachable, without raising any error.
If there is a cached value for the function in cache, that has not yet expired, the device is considered reachable. No exception is raised if there is an error while trying to contact the device hosting the function.
member.returns: true if the function can be reached, and false otherwise

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_module
member.summary:
Gets the YModule object for the device on which the function is located.
If the function cannot be located on any module, the returned instance of YModule is not shown as on-line.
member.returns: an instance of YModule

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.GetSimilarFunctions
member.summary:
Enumre toutes les fonctions de type Function.
Returns an array of strings representing hardware identifiers for all Function functions presently connected.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_logicalName
member.summary: Returns the logical name of the function.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the logical name of the function
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.LOGICALNAME_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.set_logicalName(System.String)
member.summary:
Changes the logical name of the function.
You can use yCheckLogicalName() prior to this call to make sure that your parameter is valid. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.param: a string corresponding to the logical name of the function
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: P:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.LogicalName
member.value: Logical name of the function.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_advertisedValue
member.summary: Returns a short string representing the current state of the function.
member.returns: a string corresponding to a short string representing the current state of the function
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.ADVERTISEDVALUE_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.muteValueCallbacks
member.summary:
Disables the propagation of every new advertised value to the parent hub.
You can use this function to save bandwidth and CPU on computers with limited resources, or to prevent unwanted invocations of the HTTP callback. Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.unmuteValueCallbacks
member.summary:
Re-enables the propagation of every new advertised value to the parent hub.
This function reverts the effect of a previous call to muteValueCallbacks(). Remember to call the saveToFlash() method of the module if the modification must be kept.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.loadAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the current value of a single function attribute, as a text string, as quickly as possible but without using the cached value.
member.param: the name of the requested attribute
member.returns: a string with the value of the the attribute
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns an empty string.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.isReadOnly
member.summary:
Test if the function is readOnly.
Return true if the function is write protected or that the function is not available.
member.returns: true if the function is readOnly or not online.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFunctionProxy.get_serialNumber
member.summary: Returns the serial number of the module, as set by the factory.
member.returns: a string corresponding to the serial number of the module, as set by the factory.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns YFunction.SERIALNUMBER_INVALID.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFirmwareUpdateProxy.GetAllBootLoaders
member.summary:
Returns a list of all the modules in "firmware update" mode.
Only devices connected over USB are listed. For devices connected to a YoctoHub, you must connect yourself to the YoctoHub web interface.
member.returns: an array of strings containing the serial numbers of devices in "firmware update" mode.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFirmwareUpdateProxy.CheckFirmware(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Test if the byn file is valid for this module.
It is possible to pass a directory instead of a file. In that case, this method returns the path of the most recent appropriate byn file. This method will ignore any firmware older than minrelease.
member.param: the serial number of the module to update
the path of a byn file or a directory that contains byn files
a positive integer
member.returns: : the path of the byn file to use, or an empty string if no byn files matches the requirement
member.para: On failure, returns a string that starts with "error:".

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFirmwareUpdateProxy.get_progress
member.summary:
Returns the progress of the firmware update, on a scale from 0 to 100.
When the object is instantiated, the progress is zero. The value is updated during the firmware update process until the value of 100 is reached. The 100 value means that the firmware update was completed successfully. If an error occurs during the firmware update, a negative value is returned, and the error message can be retrieved with get_progressMessage.
member.returns: an integer in the range 0 to 100 (percentage of completion) or a negative error code in case of failure.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFirmwareUpdateProxy.get_progressMessage
member.summary:
Returns the last progress message of the firmware update process.
If an error occurs during the firmware update process, the error message is returned
member.returns: a string with the latest progress message, or the error message.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YFirmwareUpdateProxy.startUpdate
member.summary:
Starts the firmware update process.
This method starts the firmware update process in background. This method returns immediately. You can monitor the progress of the firmware update with the get_progress() and get_progressMessage() methods.
member.returns: an integer in the range 0 to 100 (percentage of completion), or a negative error code in case of failure.
member.para: On failure returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.reset
member.summary:
Reverts the layer to its initial state (fully transparent, default settings).
Reinitializes the drawing pointer to the upper left position, and selects the most visible pen color. If you only want to erase the layer content, use the method clear() instead.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.clear
member.summary:
Erases the whole content of the layer (makes it fully transparent).
This method does not change any other attribute of the layer. To reinitialize the layer attributes to defaults settings, use the method reset() instead.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.selectColorPen(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Selects the pen color for all subsequent drawing functions, including text drawing.
The pen color is provided as an RGB value. For grayscale or monochrome displays, the value is automatically converted to the proper range.
member.param: the desired pen color, as a 24-bit RGB value
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.selectGrayPen(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Selects the pen gray level for all subsequent drawing functions, including text drawing.
The gray level is provided as a number between 0 (black) and 255 (white, or whichever the lightest color is). For monochrome displays (without gray levels), any value lower than 128 is rendered as black, and any value equal or above to 128 is non-black.
member.param: the desired gray level, from 0 to 255
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.selectEraser
member.summary:
Selects an eraser instead of a pen for all subsequent drawing functions, except for bitmap copy functions.
Any point drawn using the eraser becomes transparent (as when the layer is empty), showing the other layers beneath it.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.setAntialiasingMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or disables anti-aliasing for drawing oblique lines and circles.
Anti-aliasing provides a smoother aspect when looked from far enough, but it can add fuzziness when the display is looked from very close. At the end of the day, it is your personal choice. Anti-aliasing is enabled by default on grayscale and color displays, but you can disable it if you prefer. This setting has no effect on monochrome displays.
member.param: true to enable anti-aliasing, false to disable it.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

the distance from top of layer, in pixels
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

the distance from top of layer to the top border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from left of layer to the right border of the rectangle, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the bottom border of the rectangle, in pixels

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.selectFont(System.String)
member.summary:
Selects a font to use for the next text drawing functions, by providing the name of the font file.
You can use a built-in font as well as a font file that you have previously uploaded to the device built-in memory. If you experience problems selecting a font file, check the device logs for any error message such as missing font file or bad font file format.
member.param: the font file name, embedded fonts are 8x8.yfm, Small.yfm, Medium.yfm, Large.yfm (not available on Yocto-MiniDisplay).
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.drawText(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Draws a text string at the specified position.
The point of the text that is aligned to the specified pixel position is called the anchor point, and can be chosen among several options. Text is rendered from left to right, without implicit wrapping.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the text anchor point, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the text anchor point, in pixels

the text anchor point, chosen among the YDisplayLayer.ALIGN enumeration: YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_TOP_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_CENTER_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BASELINE_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BOTTOM_LEFT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_TOP_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BASELINE_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BOTTOM_CENTER, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_TOP_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_CENTER_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BASELINE_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BOTTOM_DECIMAL, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_TOP_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_CENTER_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BASELINE_RIGHT, YDisplayLayer.ALIGN_BOTTOM_RIGHT.
the text string to draw
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.drawImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Draws a GIF image at the specified position.
The GIF image must have been previously uploaded to the device built-in memory. If you experience problems using an image file, check the device logs for any error message such as missing image file or bad image file format.
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left of the image, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top of the image, in pixels
the GIF file name
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.drawBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Draws a bitmap at the specified position.
The bitmap is provided as a binary object, where each pixel maps to a bit, from left to right and from top to bottom. The most significant bit of each byte maps to the leftmost pixel, and the least significant bit maps to the rightmost pixel. Bits set to 1 are drawn using the layer selected pen color. Bits set to 0 are drawn using the specified background gray level, unless -1 is specified, in which case they are not drawn at all (as if transparent).
member.param: the distance from left of layer to the left of the bitmap, in pixels
the distance from top of layer to the top of the bitmap, in pixels
the width of the bitmap, in pixels
a binary object
the background gray level to use for zero bits (0 = black, 255 = white), or -1 to leave the pixels unchanged
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

the distance from top of layer, in pixels

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YDisplayLayerProxy.hide
member.summary:
Hides the layer.
The state of the layer is preserved but the layer is not displayed on the screen until the next call to unhide(). Hiding the layer can positively affect the drawing speed, since it postpones the rendering until all operations are completed (double-buffering).
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.

member.summary:
Shows the layer.
Shows the layer again after a hide command.
member.returns: 0 if the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YWlanRecordProxy.get_security
member.summary:
Returns the security algorithm used by the wireless network.
If the network implements to security, the value is "OPEN".

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_mobileCountryCode
member.summary:
Returns the Mobile Country Code (MCC).
The MCC is a unique identifier for each country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Mobile Country Code (MCC).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_mobileNetworkCode
member.summary:
Returns the Mobile Network Code (MNC).
The MNC is a unique identifier for each phone operator within a country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Mobile Network Code (MNC).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_locationAreaCode
member.summary:
Returns the Location Area Code (LAC).
The LAC is a unique identifier for each place within a country.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Location Area Code (LAC).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_cellId
member.summary:
Returns the Cell ID.
The Cell ID is a unique identifier for each base transmission station within a LAC.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Cell Id.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_signalStrength
member.summary: Returns the signal strength, measured in dBm.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the signal strength.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YCellRecordProxy.get_timingAdvance
member.summary:
Returns the Timing Advance (TA).
The TA corresponds to the time necessary for the signal to reach the base station from the device. Each increment corresponds about to 550m of distance.
member.returns: an integer corresponding to the Timing Advance (TA).

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSmsProxy.get_textData
member.summary: Returns the content of the message.
member.returns: a string with the content of the message.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSmsProxy.addText(System.String)
member.summary:
Add a regular text to the SMS.
This function support messages of more than 160 characters. ISO-latin accented characters are supported. For messages with special unicode characters such as asian characters and emoticons, use the addUnicodeData method.
member.param: the text to be sent in the message
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSmsProxy.addUnicodeData(System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Add a unicode text to the SMS.
This function support messages of more than 160 characters, using SMS concatenation.
member.param: an array of special unicode characters
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.

member.name: M:YoctoProxyAPI.YSmsProxy.send
member.summary:
Sends the SMS to the recipient.
Messages of more than 160 characters are supported using SMS concatenation.
member.returns: 0 when the call succeeds.
member.para: On failure, throws an exception or returns a negative error code.
